homepage_content: Bestie Cafe Bestie Cafe Scroll Menu contact RESERVATIONS 8+ If you have a larger group and want to book a table, please email info@bestiecafe.co.nz with your details. Please be prompt, as we will give your table away if you’re not here within 15 minutes of your booking. We can usually accomodate smaller groups easy as. We do not take bookings for these. OTHER ENQUIRIES Please email all other enquiries to info@bestiecafe.co.nz ADDRESS Shop 13, St Kevins Arcade 183 Karangahape Road Auckland, 1010 Lots of public transport will get you to Bestie, and there is a separated cycle-way all along K’Rd with plenty of bicycle parking. If you need to drive, best parking can be found a short distance away in the AT Parking Building at 20 Upper Queen Street . Or around the corner on Grey’s Ave. HOURS OPEN 7 DAYS 7:30 - 14:30 Monday to Friday 8:30 - 14:30 Saturday to Sunday Public Holidays - CLOSED

City Works Depot started life as the Auckland Council Workshops. Developed by the City in 1968 under thure and maintenance departments at a time when the Councilâs own staff fixed streets and maintained parks. Sold by the City in 1992 the property sat largely idle until Tournamentâs purchase in 2012. Â It has since been carefully adapted and restored. The iconic City Works Depot sits between Ponsonby and Freemans Bay to the West and the City to the East. A collaboration of diverse and creative tenancies, we are a neighbourhood of businesses that make and create. Atrium On Ulster's Rooms View All Rooms 2 Bedroom Unit – Sleeps 4 Check Details 2 Bedroom Unit – Sleeps 4-5 Check Details 2 Bedroom Access Unit Check Details 1 Bedroom Unit – Super King & Single Bed Check Details 1 Bedroom Unit & Cedar Hot Tub Check Details Superior 1 Bedroom Check Details Studio – Cedar Hot Tub Check Details Studio Access Unit Check Details Studio Unit – Super King Bed Check Details Studio Unit – Queen Bed Check Details Atrium on Ulster – The Ultimate Hamilton Accommodation Hamilton accommodation is available at Atrium On Ulster – One of Hamilton’s newest motel, accommodation and conference facilities. Qualmark rated 4* Plus . Our rooms offer modern, spacious, warm and quiet accommodation. All rooms have heat pump / air con and all have lovely comfortable beds, great showers, LCD TV’s and free broadband. Accommodation Facilities in Hamilton We have a range of facilities available for use within our accommodation. Our spacious, air conditioned conference/meeting room is equipped with digital overhead projector, white board, internet access and can accommodate up to 40 persons, theatre style. We are happy to cater conference lunches, morning and afternoon teas. Your host Mashiur is committed to provide excellent service and strive to make your stay at Atrium on Ulster accommodation, an enjoyable one.. Gallery Local Activities: Ask Us Stay & Visit Great Attractions News From Us 21 May 21 May Read All News Testimonial The hosts were incredibly friendly, helpful and made us feel welcome. My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay last weekend. We stayed in a studio room, it was super tidy, very comfortable and the perfect size for us. The bathroom was lovely, most importantly, the hosts were incredibly friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome the minute we arrived. Will definitely stay here again next time we visit Hamilton. Stayed July 2014, travelled as a couple Review by sarahbearnzon Tripadvisor Sarah Bearnzon , Traveller “Customer service – it does still exist.” 4 of 5 starsReviewed 1 week ago We had booked only night stay, on a return trip from the USA to Aus, to watch the Chiefs and Force rugby. A early flight arrival meant we arrived in Hamilton @7.30am, tired and before anything was opened. We went to reception and asked if there was any chance we could check in. The guys could not have been more accommodating and sorted it right out and even brought a cooked breakfast to our room. The rooms are a motel style, but very modern and clean and ticked all the boxes for me, including the best shower i think i have ever had. Thanks so much for looking after us and i would certainly go back when in Hamilton. Stayed April 2015, travelled as a couple John Smith , Travellers “Ideal location to get to the Rugby” We had an upstairs unit, with a small balcony, in this new motel. The well appointed rooms really were super clean. Just a short walk to the Stadium made the trip to the game really enjoyable. The supermarket & places to eat were in walking distance too. Only one tiny issue – the kitchenette – the microwave is on (what was for me) a high shelf, which was a tad difficult to manage when removing hot food. Stayed April 2015, travelled with family Cigar0 , Traveller

name: gaystay.co.nz
homepage_content: Home LGBTQ+ hosted accommodation throughout New Zealand fa fa-facebook Autumn Farm Takaka, Golden Bay More details Guysers Rotorua City More details Omahanui Auckland City More details Omaka Lodge Forgotten world, Central North Island More details Bayview Valley Lodge Whitianga, Coromandel More details Ah House B&B Nelson City More details Welcome to GayStay New Zealand Are you looking for accommodation? We connect you with lesbian, gay, bi-sexual and transgender Hosts across Aotearoa New Zealand. Accommodation types: Bed & Breakfast, Home Stay, Farm Stay, Vineyard Retreat, City Townhouse, Guesthouse, Eco-accommodation, Wedding venues and Celebrants. The GayStay website connects guests with our community of Hosts in accommodation ranging from budget to luxury. Specialities include: Men only, clothing optional, trans-welcoming, catering for dietary requirements, disability access, business visitors, group activities, etc. You may share our homes with us - just like friends staying over. Or you may want independence and solitude. Whether you enjoy sharing life stories or travel adventures, finding out about the history and natural wonders of the country - our Hosts have the knowledge you need for the perfect stay. Whether you’re a Kiwi or an international visitor, here on business or on holiday, our Hosts will make you welcome and introduce you to the local rainbow community. Please check with Hosts directly via the links on their pages to confirm availability and prices. And don't forget to mention GayStay when you book! An overview of queer New Zealand Aotearoa New Zealand is a liberal nation. We were the first country to give all women the vote, and we have had openly lesbian, gay and transgender members of parliament. We’ve recognised same-sex civil unions since 2005 and made same-sex marriage legal in 2013. Our Human Rights Act means people cannot be discriminated against on the basis of their gender or sexuality. This includes allowing people to use the toilet that matches their gender identity, and many businesses and public places have unisex or gender-neutral facilities. Our country is nuclear free, and we have a reputation for being clean and green. These factors together with our beautiful landscapes, unique wildlife and bountiful seas make New Zealand a ‘must do’ destination. Look out for the summer Pride festivals in most cities, and events such as the AIDS Foundation’s Big Gay Out early in the year. Your LGBTQ+ Kiwi experience awaits you. name: harbourlodgewellington.com
homepage_content: Harbour Lodge Wellington Harbour Lodge Wellington Nestled on a hill above Wellington harbour, looking across to the beautiful Orongaronga hills The Views Take the time to sit and watch the changing views The Lodge Set amid the bush on a quiet hillside, but close to town, the Interislander and the Stadium The Indoor Pool Area In the summer cool down in the pool. In the winter soak up the sun Spa anyone? In the colder months you could enjoy a soak in the spa The Sauna The sauna is available on request The Rooms We have four double rooms each with a king-sized bed and ensuite Breakfast Continental Breakfast is included in the room rate Welcome to the new website of Harbour Lodge Wellington Situated on a quiet hillside, Harbour Lodge Wellington is a luxurious bed and breakfast with stunning views of Wellington Harbour. The lodge features an indoor summer swimming pool, spa pool, and sauna, as well as a large guest lounge with a wood burner. Each room has a private bathroom, internet-capable TV, and tea/coffee making facilities. Three of the four rooms have direct access to a sun-filled outdoor deck. Free Wi-Fi internet access though out the lodge and off-street parking are available. Heaters are provided in each room, and the bathrooms have underfloor heating. A continental breakfast with fresh seasonal fruit salad, yoghurt, muesli, toast, and spreads is served each morning. Harbour Lodge Wellington is surrounded by beautiful native trees and is both secluded and private. However, it is also just a 5-minute drive from Wellington city centre, the Interislander Cook Strait Ferry Terminal, and Wellington Regional Stadium. Lou and Chris We are Lou and Chris, the owners of Harbour Lodge Wellington. We have been running our lodge for 20 years and we thoroughly enjoy meeting our guests. We will give you a warm welcome and look after you during your stay. We want you to feel at home at Harbour Lodge Wellington, and we are here to help you make the most of your time in Wellington. Book your stay today and experience the luxury and tranquility of Harbour Lodge Wellington. Guest Book We have had many guests stay with us and sign our Guest Book. Have a look what some of them have said about their stay. Great hosts make you feel very welcome everything I like - warm clean and tidy the spa was a bonus oh and the heated floors In the bathroom the beautiful views Toni NZ Jun 23 Lovely stay in Wellington Lovely accommodation with good facilities. Lou & Chris were excellent hosts and very sociable with guests. Views from Harbour Lodge are amazing ð Yvonne UK Mar 2023 Great property with stunning views but near to city. Very welcoming and friendly hosts. Spacious and comfortable room with a fridge and good tea making facilities. Large bathroom. Great guest lounge with views over the harbour. What a pool! David UK Mar 2023 A very comfortable stay with a lovely host. Recommended! Breakfast was very healthy and fresh with a fabulous view of the Harbour. Best accommodation we have stayed at in New Zealand. Berris Australia Mar 2023 Wellington visit Hosts, Lou and Chris, were extremely friendly and sociable. Views from property, in particular the sitting room, very impressive. Breakfast good. Able to catch a bus locally to get into city centre.. Neil UK Nov 2022 Very good Very nice stay. Host was welcoming and gracious. She went out of her way to make gluten-free food available for breakfast and room was very comfortable. Love the heated floor in the bathroom! Suzanne NZ Mar 2023 Exceptional Beautiful spot to stay for a quick business trip and some time out. Lovely host’s, stunning views and so very tranquil. Would definitely stay again. Pip NZ May 2021 Would certainly stay again as we enjoyed our 2 days there. The breakfast was well presented and fully adequate for our needs. The hosts sat and chatted to us which was very interesting and enjoyable. We were able to go as we pleased as the guest entrance is separate from the owners entrance. The owners were very welcoming and tried to ensure the stay was to your liking. Graham NZ May 2021 Our Partners Copyright (c) 2000 - 2023, Harbour Lodge Wellington; all rights reserved. V1.2 Other Credits and other Copyrights .

name: lichfields.co.nz
homepage_content: Wedding Accomodation Kumeu | www.lichfields.co.nz | Auckland top of page Lichfields Cottage Accommodation ABOUT ABOUT Lichfields Cottage is a peaceful country retreat located in Waimauku, a 40-minute drive from central Auckland. We are in the heart of wine country, surrounded by local vineyards and close to local wedding venues including The Hunting Lodge, Kumeu Valley Estate, Settlers, Markovina and Allely Estate. ​ A simple complimentary breakfast is provided for you to help yourselves with a selection of cereals, bread, local free-range eggs from our chickens (when they’re laying), milk, butter and jam. Tea and coffee are provided. ​ The pool is warm late November to early April and is located behind the main house. Access to the pool is all yours for the duration of your stay, pool towels are provided. Tennis racquets are balls are provided if you wish to have a game of tennis. ​ Our Cottage surrounds have been featured in several tv shows as a filming location including Married at First Sight and Cooks on Fire. Please contact us if you wish to film on site as there is a minimum charge of $1,250 per day (8 hours). ​ Our check in time is 2:30pm, check out at 11am. If you are requiring a slightly earlier check-in or later checkout - we are more than happy to try to accommodate this if we are able, however, please enquire as it depends if we have bookings on either side of your stay. ​ Our family home is next door to the Cottage however the cottage is very peaceful and private with just the horses next door for company and the sound of birdsong. We have a friendly dog called Crackle, our cat Maximus and 10 chickens. If you are not a dog person please do let us know and I will keep him inside. ​ ​ Please note that we do not allow events on site. ​ ROOMS THE COTTAGE Lichfields Cottage is a fully self-contained cottage with three bedrooms, modern open plan kitchen and beautiful living space. ​ Two bedrooms have queen beds and the other has two long single beds ​ Our rate is $450 NZD per night. Contact us to check availability OUR SERVICES OUR SERVICES Breakfast Continental breakfast is included as part of your stay. Please let us know in advance if you have any dietary requirements Garden Lichfields is set on over 6 acres with a pond, fruit trees, native trees and bush with a private courtyard behind the cottage overlooking the horse paddocks next door. Pool The pool is located to the rear of the main house and is warm from late November to early April. Pool towels are provided as part of your stay. Babysitting Available We can provide babysitting on weekends to look after your children at the cottage. Please e-mail us at bookings@lichfields.co.nz ​ We specialise in wedding accommodation and have lots of room for parking for your make up artist, photographer, florist, etc and have many beautiful locations for your wedding photos. Bridal Tennis Court ​ We provide tennis racquets and balls as part of your stay. Our dog Crackle loves to play 'fetch' with the ball! GALLERY GALLERY THINGS TO DO THINGS TO DO Vineyard and Winery Tours The cottage is surrounded by local vineyards, including The Hunting Lodge, Soljans and Westbrook. We recommend The Hunting Lodge pinot noir! Gannet Colony Muriwai Beach is known for the gannet colony and is well worth a visit. Muriwai Surf School Surf lessons are available at Muriwai Beach surf school which is just 12 minutes drive from Lichfields GUEST REVIEWS GUEST REVIEWS "Stunning accommodation for pre wedding and wedding night!! Thanks Kirsty for the amazing hospitality! Really enjoyed staying here !!" Cameron & Christina Bain ​ ​ Contact bottom of page

name: mangoreiheights.co.nz
homepage_content: Mangorei Heights Luxury Accomodation New Plymouth Taranaki 0 Escape to Nature in the Heart of Taranaki Set high above the beautiful rolling hills of Taranaki, Mangorei Heights offers a truly unique escape. Surrounded by native bush and with stunning views of Mount Taranaki, our luxury accommodation provides both comfort and privacy. Whether you’re looking for a romantic break, a peaceful getaway, or a base for your next adventure, Mangorei Heights is the perfect place to unwind and explore. Relax, take in the scenery, and enjoy everything that New Zealand’s stunning landscape has to offer. Start Your Adventure Discover what Mangorei Heights has to offer Take in stunning views of Mount Taranaki from your private cabin, complete with a balcony and a soothing outdoor baths for relaxing after a day of exploring. You’re just a short 700m walk from the Pouakai walking track and only 15 minutes from New Plymouth’s beaches, shops, restaurants, and more. Book a Cabin The cabin offers mountain and ocean views from both the kitchen (kitchenette in Tui) and bedroom, plus a spacious deck to enjoy the scenery. It comes with a fully equipped kitchen in Ruru and kitchenette in Tui, a Weber BBQ at both, and all the basics like tea, coffee, and milk. Inside, you’ll find a cosy lounge with a 32-inch TV in Tui and 50-inch TV in Ruru, Netflix, Disney+, and a comfy couch in each. Perfect for a peaceful getaway with everything you need close by. Enjoy grazing platters and relaxing massage sessions during your stay — send us a message to add these services to your booking. View Platter Menu Massage Menu Coming Soon Complimentary BBQ Equipment, Gym & Laundry Facilities are available on-site Book a Cabin Relax, unwind, and soak in the views · Relax, unwind, and soak in the views · Relax, unwind, and soak in the views · A Scenic Venue for Intimate Weddings Host your wedding with the stunning backdrop of Mount Taranaki and panoramic views of the ocean. Mangorei Heights offers a peaceful and scenic setting, perfect for intimate ceremonies and gatherings. Our private cabins and natural surroundings provide a relaxed atmosphere, making your day both beautiful and effortless. Reach out to us to discuss how we can help make your wedding just the way you imagined. Inquire Today “Thank you so much, what an amazing little peace of paradise. Was pretty incredible getting to enjoy a sunrise with a coffee in hand while we enjoyed a hot bath. Amber had an amazing start to her birthday.” Gary O. What a lovely cabin. The cabin is super modern, cozy and clean insider. Location is fantastic too. The outdoor bath tub was a bonus. Too bad it was raining non-stop during our stay but the cozy cabin surely provides a warmly stay-in. Mario Loved every bit of the cabin. It was super nice, modern, and tidy. Shaan and Jessica are so accommodating and went extra mile to make sure we have the best possible stay. Loved the bath tub in the deck- we enjoyed soaking and so relaxing watching the night sky. Highly recommend this place. Charlete D. Curious About Your Stay? Find Out Here What’s included in the cabin? Our cabins are packed with everything you need for a great stay. You’ll enjoy stunning views from your private balcony, relaxing outdoor baths, and a kitchenette in Tui and full kitchen in Ruru, with a fridge, microwave, toaster, and kettle. We also provide basics like milk, tea, coffee, sugar, oil, salt, and pepper. Plus, there’s a comfy lounge area with a 32-inch TV in Tui and a 50-inch TV in Ruru, Netflix, Disney+, and comfy couches to watch from in both How close is the cabin to things to do? The cabin is just a short 700m walk to the start of the Pouakai walking track and only a 15-minute drive to New Plymouth’s beaches, restaurants, shops, and the coastal walkway. Lake Mangamahoe Mountain Bike Park and other city highlights are also within easy reach. What are the check-in and check-out times? Check-in is typically from 2:00 PM, and check-out is by 10:00 AM. If you need different times, just let us know, and we’ll do our best to accommodate. What’s your cancellation policy? If you cancel more than 14 days before your arrival, you’ll get a full refund. Cancellations made between 7 and 14 days before arrival will incur a 50% cancellation fee. Unfortunately, no refunds are given for cancellations within 7 days of arrival or for no-shows. We recommend travel insurance for added peace of mind. Are pets allowed? Sorry, we don’t allow pets in the cabin. We want to ensure a clean and comfortable environment for all our guests. What facilities are available at the cabin? The cabins include a range of amenities like free Wi-Fi, a gas BBQ, outdoor furniture, books, magazines, and a garden. You’ll also find laundry onsite, luggage storage, and on-site parking. Is the cabin suitable for families or groups? Yes, the cabin is great for families or small groups. It has a fold-out couch in the lounge area for extra guests and plenty of space to relax and enjoy. What is the cabin's smoking policy? The cabin is a non-smoking property. We ask all guests to respect this policy to keep the space fresh and pleasant for everyone. What entertainment options are available? The cabins are equipped with a 32-inch Smart TV in Tui & 50-inch Smart TV in Ruru, and access to Netflix and Disney+. You can relax and enjoy your favourite shows or movies during your stay. Can Mangorei Heights be used as a wedding venue? Yes, we do offer the option to host intimate weddings at Mangorei Heights. With our stunning views and beautiful setting, it’s a perfect spot for a memorable celebration. Contact us for more details and to discuss how we can make your special day extraordinary. Book a Stay Gift an experience instead Whether it's a cosy getaway or a chance to unwind with grazing platters and massages, our gift voucher is the perfect way to treat someone to a bit of relaxation and time to recharge. It’s a thoughtful gift that offers a break from the everyday. Buy Gift Vouchers

name: mirandaseaviewapartments.com
homepage_content: Miranda Seaview Apartments | Ocean View Accommodation in Miranda About Miranda Seaview Apartments. Located in Miranda with its own private hot tub, Miranda Sea View Apartment is a secluded farmstay apartment that offers self-catering accommodation with free WiFi and the Miranda Hot Springs at the bottom of the hill. All apartments include a private courtyard and on site parking. The kitchen is fitted with a cooking hob and an air oven. Towels and bed linen are provided in this nicely secluded accommodation. Enjoy the most spectacular night skies, moon rises and sunsets reflecting off the Coromandel peninsula with the lights of Thames reflecting in the evening seaviews. You can engage in various activities, such as cycling, hiking, bird watching and fishing.nt and not just a hotel, we are sure you will love it here. Contact Details 740 Back Miranda Road, Waitakaruru 3576 Local: 022 065 5099 International: +64 22 065 5099 Why Stay With Us? Experience luxury, comfort, and breathtaking views at Miranda Seaview Apartments. Quick drive to the beach, enjoy free Wi-Fi, and relax in modern, spacious rooms. Discover Miranda Located in the heart of Miranda, you’re minutes from local attractions, cafes, and seaside activities. Explore Miranda Attractions Your own private court yard Animals included The court yard has unobstructed views out over the firth of Thames to the Coromandel peninsula. The funiture can be arranged into a daybed to soak up the sun and the Spa Pool is ready and waiting to look out to sea or steer at the stars at night. The Apartment Clean and comfortable with everything you need Located in Miranda with its own private hot tub, Miranda Sea View Apartment is a secluded farm-stay apartment that offers self-catering accommodation with free WiFi, king size bed and the most beautiful view. All apartments include a private courtyard and on site parking in this nicely secluded accommodation. Facilities Everything you should need The kitchen is fitted with a fridge, micrrowave, cooking hob, an air oven, toaster, kettle, coffee maker, cutlery and plates. There are tea, coffee, salt and pepper. Towels and bed linen are provided. Heaters and Tv are in your bedroom to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The View Looking out to the firth of Thames Whether you are in your apartment or in the spa pool you'll have unobstructed views of the sea, the Coromandel peninsula, and the milky way. If you need to relax with a view you can fall in love with Miranda Sea View Apartment is the place to stay. Things to do around Miranda. MIRANDA SHOREBIRD CENTRE 5.6k drive from Miranda Seaview Apartments WAHARAU REGIONAL PARK A beautiful place to relax or take walks HAURAKI RAIL TRAIL Bring your bike and go for a ride KAIAUA Walks, beach, pub and famous fish and chips FISH & CHIPS The best in the country, so they tell us ;) CAFES The most fabulous country cafes GOLF CLUBS Country living at it's best THAMES TOWNSHIP Directly across the water or 25 min drive. PAEROA & WAIHI Gold, tunnels antiques and beaches NGATEA Gardens, food and blue berries COROMANDEL PENINSULA Best beaches, lifestyle and enjoyment in NZ MATAMATA Hobbits, towers, waterfalls and Heritage trail MIRANDA SHOREBIRD CENTRE 5.6km : 4 min from Miranda Seaview Apartments you can take a look at some of New Zealand’s amazing birdlife. With nearly half of the population of the endemic Wrybill found at Pukorokoro Miranda during part of the year, and with numbers of shorebirds often exceeding 10,000 the coastline is almost a mandatory stop for any birdwatcher passing by. MIRANDA SHOREBIRD CENTRE Details Close WAHARAU REGIONAL PARK Waharau Regional park. 21km just 16 min drive from Miranda. This gentle, short walk through regenerating forest in Waharau Regional Park is ideal for inexperienced bushwalkers. Start at the information building. Follow the green markers through the kānuka dominated forest and tree ferns. Bring a picnic or use the wood and gas barbeques provided (bring your own wood). If you want to keep exploring, join up with one of the rugged tramping tracks towards the Hunua Ranges. Located on the eastern side of the rugged Hunua Ranges, Waharau Regional Park extends from the range to the coast. The Māori name Waharau means 'the ever-changing stream mouth' and refers to the stream that winds its way down from the eastern Hunua Ranges and flows out into the Firth of Thames. WAHARAU REGIONAL PARK Details Close HAURAKI RAIL TRAIL The Hauraki Rail Trail is a short drive from Hamilton, Auckland and Tauranga and is accessible from the quaint townships of Thames, Paeroa, Te Aroha, Waihi and Matamata. Officially starting from Kaiaua in the North, the start of the trail traces the Shorebird Coast along the Firth of Thames. Riders enjoy contrasting landscapes from the verdant Hauraki Plains, to the intriguing Karangahake Gorge, carved by the forces of nature. Finally, there’s a gentle ride South through lush farmlands to the hometown of the Hobbiton Movie Set. Our new Miranda-Thames section is a flat 45km – Most do in under 2 hours each way, making it suitable for young and old alike. Cruise along the top of stop banks beside the Firth of Thames taking in lush farm lands and wetlands with magnificent views to the Coromandel Ranges. There’s the popular Bugger cafe at Pipiroa as well as the friendly Kopu hotel just south of Thames for light drinks and snacks. If you have time, consider riding onto Paeroa and perhaps book the 5.15pm bus home. See cycle trail website for more details on the shuttle service. Booking essential. HAURAKI RAIL TRAIL Details Close KAIAUA 12km north of Miranda. Best known for it's fish and chips Kaiaua is a fishermans paradise. Mussle farms just down the road makes for a great days fishing even off the beach. Rays rest reserve is off East Coast Road, approximately 4.5 km south of Kaiaua township and adjacent to the Firth of Thames. It is such a beautiful place to go for a walk on the beach. FISH & CHIPS It's 12km north of Miranda to the Famous Kaiaua Fisheries or 8km's in the opposite direction to the Ocean's divine takeaways and ice-cream shop in Waitakaruru. But our little secret is the Kiwi taste Cafe at the Miranda Holiday park at the bottom of our hill. Even John Gault is very impressed with them. KAIAUA Details Close FISH & CHIPS FISH & CHIPS Details Close CAFES . CAFES Details Close GOLF CLUBS GOLF CLUBS Details Close THAMES THAMES Details Close PAEROA & WAIHI PAEROA & WAIHI Details Close NGATEA . NGATEA Details Close COROMANDEL PENINSULA COROMANDEL PENINSULA Details Close MATAMATA MATAMATA Details Close Client Testimonials This place was perfect for our visit to Miranda. A fantastic view over the Hauraki Gulf to the distant hills. The hosts were so welcoming and friendly. Having a spa at the end of the day added to the perfection of this accommodation. We would stay there again. John Great Retreat!!!Beautiful views. Quiet and tranquil. Bonus was the private hot spa pool as the Miranda pools were closed. Double bonus was having the cows grazing right outside our courtyard & the lovely bird song outside our window! Good for the soul!! Ben This farmstay is set in pleasant grounds with a beautiful view over the Hauraki Gulf to Thames in the distance. Hosts made us welcome & were helpful. We enjoyed the private spa pool each evening. A very pleasant stay & would recommend it providing you enjoy the quiet & peacefulness of the countryside. Mary This was the best place to take a break that I could have chosen.it was quiet,private,amazing view,beautiful cottage decor,,immaculately clean,lovely kitchen facilities,comfortable warm bed with the most beautiful linen,my own private spa outside the unit which I used constantly the two nights I stayed,seeing the sun rise and watching the stars come out while I floated relaxing. It is without a doubt a place I will be visiting again.Id highly recommend it Nicky We enjoyed everything in this recreational farm over looking the Miranda Shorebird Centre. They have all the modern amenities in a relaxed rural setting. Hosts opened their farm and hearts to us, educating us on how farming works and local life. This is one of our treasured stays in New Zealand! Daniel Great Retreat!!!Beautiful views. Quiet and tranquil. Bonus was the private hot spa pool as the Miranda pools were closed. Double bonus was having the cows grazing right outside our courtyard & the lovely bird song outside our window! Good for the soul!! Ben Get In Touch. name: pakiriholidaypark.co.nz
homepage_content: Family Holiday Caravan Park | Pākiri Beach Holiday Park Your Slice of Heaven by the Sea escape • delight • relax • unite Pākiri Beach Holiday Park Pākiri Beach Holiday Park is perfect for a family holiday by the beach just 90 minutes north of Auckland. Set on 14 km of pristine white sand, Pākiri Beach Holiday Park is your ultimate getaway destination! Enjoy one of New Zealand’s finest beaches, nestled alongside the safe and calm Pākiri estuary, an abundance of activities, and a variety of accommodation options await you. Book now for an unforgettable escape in nature's embrace. Pākiri Beach Holiday Park feels a world away and offers the best of the picturesque north. We offer one of the best camping grounds and caravan parks in Auckland. Tucked away in a tranquil rural setting, Pākiri Beach Holiday Park is the perfect place for families seeking a rejuvenating holiday by the beach or a chance to unwind surrounded by nature's beauty. We are ideally located alongside the tranquil Pākiri estuary behind the stunning white sands of Pākiri Beach and the beautiful Hauraki Gulf. Surrounded by nature, Pākiri Beach is home to hundreds of diverse birds, some critically endangered, showcasing the vibrant biodiversity of New Zealand and all it has to offer. We have been proudly family-owned for over 40 years! At Pākiri Beach Holiday Park we offer a well-established rural but seaside camping ground alongside cabins and luxury beachfront accommodations that are sure to provide a calming, and relaxing stay no matter how long you visit. At Pākiri there is truly an abundance of activities for all ages and interests, whether it be swimming, surfing, beach fishing or kayaking, to name a few, there’s something for everyone at this holiday park. We aim to be Auckland's favourite caravan park and camping ground holiday destination, and it shows. Our commitment is evident, and we consistently receive positive feedback year after year. Our friendly staff are always listening, encouraging feedback, and doing our best to constantly improve your experience at Pākiri Beach Holiday Park so we can continue to be a cherished retreat for holidaymakers exploring the beauty of New Zealand's beautiful coast. View More The Lodge Our luxury lodge offers uninterrupted sea views of Pākiri Beach. Diverse Accommodation Options Whether you prefer a luxury lodge, a cozy cabin or a traditional camping experience, there is an option to suit every preference and budget. Loads of fun activities Get ready for an unforgettable experience filled with activities both within our park, in the estuary, at the beach, and in the surrounding area. So much awesomeness! I stayed here 4 nights recently. First visit and it was such a great time that I'm going back next week with my granddaughters. A great place for kids with all the fun activities they have. - HeatherJay30, Whangarei Untouched, undeveloped, golden sand, coastal bird paradise. Cell phone signal patchy but that’s what being off the beaten track is about. We rented a beach front cottages and the Lodge. We congregated in the lodge to eat, talk and sit in the sun on the verandah. - Oscorzo, Auckland Had another wonderful stay in a beach side chalet. This time in late May. No matter what time of year you stay here the view is always spectacular and the light at this time of year is beautiful. The chalet was really warm despite some nasty cold weather arriving. - Debbie M, Auckland Read More + 10 Park Map Download or view our holiday park map to see where you want to stay. name: ramadaauckland.co.nz
homepage_content: Ramada Victoria Street | Marsden Hotel Group top of page Ramada Victoria Street Immerse yourself in the city of Auckland while enjoying the comforts of our Ramada Suites by Wyndham Victoria Street West. Located in the central business district, our hotel is perfectly positioned for easy travel to local attractions. If you’re here on business, you’ll appreciate our close proximity to the SkyCity Auckland Convention Centre. We are within walking distance of Aotea Square, featuring outdoor space used for markets and other public gatherings. You can head to The Civic to catch a musical or concert, and our hotel is less than 30 kilometers from Auckland Airport (AKL). BOOK NOW 147 Victoria Street West, Auckland CBD Ph: +649 971 5000 reception@ramadavictoria.co.nz View Google Maps Room Types Enjoy the following facilities in most room types. FREE HIGH SPEED WIFI WASHER & DRYER WORK DESK COOKING FACILITIES LARGE TV SCREENS Please Note : The photos on our website are provided to give you a general idea of the style and comfort of our rooms. As each room is unique, the layout, furnishings, and views may vary. We'll do our best to meet your preferences, but specific rooms and views can't always be guaranteed. Hotel Room A well appointed hotel room offering a king bed. With quality sound proofing and convenient amenities, enjoy a comfortable stay. A selection of rooms can be split as two single beds upon request, subject to availability. BOOK NOW One Bedroom Apartment The One Bedroom Apartment can accommodate up to 3 guests, complete with a full kitchen and laundry facilities. Lounge and bedroom area are separate for increased privacy. BOOK NOW Deluxe Studio The Studio Apartment offers a king bed, complete with kitchen and laundry facilities. A selection of rooms can be split as two single beds upon request, subject to availability. ​ BOOK NOW One Bedroom Balcony The One Bedroom Apartment can accommodate up to 3 guests, complete with a full kitchen and laundry facilities. Lounge and bedroom area are separate for increased privacy. BOOK NOW Executive Studio The Executive Studio Apartment offers spacious, well appointed room, complete with a kitchen and laundry facilities. A selection of rooms can be split as two single beds upon request, subject to availability. BOOK NOW Two Bedroom Suite The spacious Two Bedroom Suite can accommodate up to 5 guests, complete with a full kitchen (including an oven), and laundry facilities. With a comfortable king bed in each room, enjoy comfort and convenience. BOOK NOW Things to do in Auckland Central City Sky Tower Standing 328 meters tall, the Sky Tower has dominated the Auckland skyline for over 27 years, offering stunning 360° views across Tāmaki Makaurau along with award winning dining. Read More Auckland Art Gallery With multiple exhibition spaces spreading across four levels of an award-winning building, this is the largest and most inspiring visual arts experience in Aotearoa New Zealand. Read More Wētā Workshop Unleashed Enjoy Unleashed, a global award-winning movie-making tour. Welcome to a fantastical film effects facility, inspired and built by New Zealand’s Academy Award-winning Weta Workshop. Read More All Blacks Experience Whether you have an interest in rugby or not, this emotive, guided experience allows guests to connect with New Zealand, Māori culture and gain insights into Kiwi lifestyle, attitude and humour. name: saltandpeppercafe.co.nz
homepage_content: Salt & Pepper Cafe and Restaurant | Levin New Zealand Cafe & Restaurant 0 Welcome to Salt & Pepper Café & Restaurant Meet Levin’s Hidden Gem Discover a truly inviting dining experience at Salt & Pepper Café & Restaurant , located in the tranquil setting of the Garden Depot, 4 Buller Road, Levin . Surrounded by lush greenery and warm hospitality, it’s the perfect destination to relax, unwind, and indulge. Our menu offers a delicious blend of restaurant-quality dishes and freshly prepared cabinet options , crafted with care to suit every taste and occasion. Whether you're enjoying a leisurely brunch, a business lunch, or a coffee/cocktail with friends , you’ll find something to savour. Take a seat by the crackling indoor fireplace or soak up the serenity in our covered outdoor area , ideal for enjoying Levin’s sunshine year-round. Walk-ins are welcome, or contact us to reserve your table today. Experience Salt & Pepper Café & Restaurant – where flavour, comfort, and atmosphere come together. The Garden Depot More than just a café visit. After enjoying a relaxing meal paired with your favourite drink, why not continue the experience while sitting on one of Salt & Pepper Café & Restaurant’s scenic decks, surrounded by beautiful plants and trees? Take a moment to explore all that The Garden Depot and the Farm Shop have to offer. The Garden Depot is a destination in itself—offering everything you need to enhance your outdoor space, from vibrant plants to stylish garden décor. You’ll also find a thoughtfully curated selection of homewares and unique gift ideas , perfect for any occasion. Be sure to stop by the Farm Shop , where you’ll discover a range of fresh, locally sourced produce and gourmet goods , available to take home and enjoy. Take your time, browse at your leisure, and complete your visit with something truly special—right next door to your table. Functions Functions at Salt & Pepper Café & Restaurant Host your private events with us. Whether it’s work dos, corporate functions, family reunions, or special celebrations, we offer the perfect setting to make your occasion unforgettable. Our team is here to help you plan every detail and ensure your event runs smoothly. Contact us today to start planning your memorable private function. We Are a Fully Licensed Venue At Salt & Pepper Café & Restaurant, we offer an extensive range of beverages to suit every taste. Enjoy expertly brewed L’affare coffee , a selection of Kapiti specialty teas , refreshing beers on tap , handcrafted cocktails , and much more. Whether you're after a morning pick-me-up, a relaxing afternoon drink, or a cocktail, our diverse drink menu has something to delight every palate. Menus From classic favourites to individually crafted delights, our menu is full of delicious options to suit every taste. Explore a variety of vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free choices. For questions or custom orders, just chat with our friendly staff—we’re happy to accommodate your dietary restrictions and preferences with care and style. View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize We’d love to hear from you Visit us Hours: Mon - Fri: 9 am - 3.30 pm Sat & Sun: 9 am - 3.30 pm Phone number: 06 368 7270 Email: saltandpeppercafenz@gmail.com Location: 4 Buller Road, Horowhenua, Levin

name: sculptureum.nz
homepage_content: Exploring Exquisite Sculptures in Auckland: A Blend of Art & Culture" 0 “A startlingly original experience.” - Sydney Morning Herald Sculptureum is a unique attraction. There is nothing like it anywhere in the world. Just five minutes from Matakana and an hour north of Auckland, Sculptureum is home to world-class art, stunning gardens, and award-winning dining. It's a place designed to inspire and surprise. Sculptureum is usually ranked on Trip Advisor as being one of the four best attractions in the whole of New Zealand. Come and see for yourself why it is so highly rated. It’s an experience you won’t forget. Learn more

At Sofitel Wellington, our state-of-the-art technology and dedication to impeccable service will allow you to smartly and creatively imagine your event’s perfect moments. Meetings Discover more Discover more Weddings Discover more Discover more Sustainable luxury While visiting our beautiful island nation, join us in upholding the Tiaki Promise. This commitment to respect and care for the land for the benefit of future generations is embedded in our ethos, and we are honoured to be a sustainable business in the name of safeguarding this promise. name: thebotanistlyallbay.co.nz
homepage_content: The Botanist - plant based cafe & restaurant in Lyall Bay The Botanist brings the best in innovative plant based cuisine to the stunning south coast of Wellington. We're bringing real food to the people - fresh & healthy, comforting & tasty, using seasonal produce with local ingredients, ethically sourced & organic where possible. Views to the sea, a sheltered sunny courtyard, six rotating craft beer taps, botanical cocktails, local & organic wines. For delivery head over to Uber Eats or DoorDash Make a booking in the link above, or just pop in to see us. Menu also available on Uber Eats and DoorDash Gift Vouchers Online Gift Vouchers - Click here to purchase Sea Shepherd & Paritua Wines Fundraiser - 30th October from 6.30pm We've teamed up with Paritua Vineyard and Sea Shepherd NZ to bring you a fantastic evening of dining, fundraising & drinking excellent wine! We'll be serving a multi course plant based dinner, matched with Paritua wines, in support of Sea Shepherd New Zealand. Each dish draws its inspiration from the sea with a kiwi twist & paired with organic & vegan wine - presented by Ollie Kettle and Josh Pointon of Paritua Wines. Proceeds from tickets sold will be donated to Sea Shepherd to help protect our oceans Click on the links for the menu & bookings We are now taking brunch bookings on weekends, in the link above or email us at info@thebotanistlyallbay.co.nz Taco Tuesdays are back! 3 Tacos & a Pint, Wine or Non Alc for $25. From 5pm Wednesday's are Lyall Bay Locals Day! $13.50 cocktails, 20% off beer & wine 4-7pm every Weds Thursday Burger & a Beverage $20! Any house beer, wine or juice plus any burger for only $20, incl fries We are open 10am-10pm Monday to Friday for winter, and 8am - 10pm Saturday and Sunday. Check us out on Facebook & Instagram

name: wellingtoncityheritage.org.nz
homepage_content: Plimmer House - Wellington Heritage - Absolutely Positively Wellington City Council Me Heke Ki Poneke Search 99 Boulcott Street, Wellington, Wellington Image: WCC - Charles Collins, 2015 Map Constructed 1872 - 1874 Architect(s) Charles Tringham Builder(s) Unknown A rare Wellington example of Carpenter Gothic architecture, with picturesque turrets, steep gables, and decorative barge boards. In 1983 the house was moved forward to build behind it. The house is associated with several notable Wellington families, in particular John Plimmer ‘the father of Wellington’. Plimmer’s grandson bought the house in 1911 and it stayed in the family until 1960 when it was sold and used as a home, office, and wool store. Since 1971 it has housed various restaurants with the Boulcott Street Bistro being there since 1991. Downloadable(s) Download this content as PDF close History Plimmer House, situated at 99 Boulcott Street, is associated with the Plimmer family of Wellington, after whom Plimmer’s Steps, Plimmer’s Emporium, and Plimmer’s Ark are named. It is a rare example of the Victorian Carpenter Gothic style in Wellington City, and although it stands crowded by modern high rise buildings, it retains its original integrity and donates its heritage character to the streetscape. The house is thought to have been designed by Charles Tringham for Eustace de Bathe Brandon, a son of Alfred de Bathe Brandon a well known early settler and the founder of the law firm which still bears his name. Eustace had the house built, costing £400, as a wedding gift for his new wife Anna Marie Watson. The house was constructed by Scoular and Archibald, later responsible for the construction of Government Buildings (1876), and they had a mortgage over the house. Thomas Scoular bought the house from Brandon in 1878. In 1901 Scoular died and the house was bought from his estate by Frederick Roach, however, he could not meet the terms of his mortgage, and in 1911 the National Bank sold the house to Isaac (Harold) Plimmer, the son of Charles Plimmer and the grandson of the man dubbed the ‘father of Wellington’ John Plimmer. The house was hardly lived in by the Plimmer family, as Harold Plimmer died at Gallipoli and left the house and all his other possessions to be divided among his remaining family – his father, mother, and two sisters, Girlie and Mollie – who lived nearby at 93 Boulcott Street. However, this letter did not come to light until Charles Plimmer’s death and in 1934 a legal settlement of his estate gave the house to his sister Girlie. She did not occupy the house until the last years of her life and died in 1958. It is not known who occupied the house during the period it was owned by the Plimmers. In 1960 the house was sold to wool broker Leo Tattersfield and used as a home, office, and store. He is responsible for renaming it Plimmer House. By 1969 the house was again on the market, and the Wellington City Council approved plans to re-use the house as a restaurant, to be named Ancoto. It finally opened in 1971, after considerable alterations were made. Thereafter the house was primarily associated with dining. In 1983 the house was under threat from the construction of a modern apartment building, it was finally decided to move the building forward on its site so that the new building could be erected behind it. Since 1991 Plimmer House has been occupied by the Boulcott Street Bistro, a popular restaurant. The house has been through some alterations since being the home of Boulcott Street Bistro, but has retained its heritage values throughout, and its conversion to a restaurant has undoubtedly ensured its survival in an otherwise modern high rise environment. Modifications close 1872 - 1874 Construction 1922 Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, add bathroom (00055:1:A83) 1925 Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, garage (00055:50:A4720) 1948 Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, reinstatement (00056:350:B26954) unknown Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, building additions and alterations (00058:733:C33195) 1972 Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, locker and store room (00058:767:C34599) 1983 Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, relocate and alter Plimmer house (00058:0:C62212) 1986 Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, Kitchen alterations (00059:0:D2588) 1991 99 Boulcott Street, restaurant alterations (00059:497:E23708) 1995 99 Boulcott Street, restaurant alterations (00061:163:15232) Occupation History close unknown Not assessed close Architectural Information Building Classification(s) close Not assessed Architecture close The main architectural feature of Plimmer House lies in the quality of its exterior decorations and elements. The style of the house is Carpenter Gothic, featuring a steep-pitched gable, decorated fretwork, and a pendant and finial. A small octagonal tower completes this asymmetrical composition. The house is a good example of what is a relatively rare style, particularly in an inner city context. The house is a typical nineteenth century timber construction and has technical value for this reason. The decorative fretwork demonstrates the adaptability of timber in a skilled craftsman’s hands. The interior has been altered extensively, firstly in the 1960s when it was used as offices, and later in 1969 when the architects Craig, Craig and Moller were engaged to upgrade and modify the building for use as a restaurant. In 1983 when the building was moved forward on its site to allow for a high rise development behind, further alterations were carried out. The building was also altered in 1991 and 1995. Materials close Rusticated weatherboard Timber joinery Iron roofing Setting close Situated on Boulcott Street, Plimmer House has a high streetscape value, particularly in comparison to surrounding high rise buildings. Its small scale is offset by the adjacent high-rise buildings, and it is set behind a small front garden with a picket fence which contributes a semblance of authenticity to its much altered setting. close Cultural Value Plimmer House is a fine example of Carpenter Gothic architecture, a style that is relatively rare in Wellington. The picturesque quality of the turrets, steep gables, and decorative barge boards give the house significant aesthetic value. This house is associated with several notable Wellington families, in particular that of John Plimmer ‘the father of Wellington’. Plimmer’s grandson, Harold, bought the house in 1911 and it remained in the family until 1960. This house is held in high public esteem as the only 19th century building surviving in Boulcott Street, it has rarity value, and the decision to move it on its site rather than demolish show this. The establishment of a well regarded restaurant in this building has helped this building to remain popular and have ensured its survival. Aesthetic Value close Architectural Does the item have architectural or artistic value for characteristics that may include its design, style, era, form, scale, materials, colour, texture, patina of age, quality of space, craftsmanship, smells, and sounds? Plimmer House is a fine example of Carpenter Gothic architecture, a style that is relatively rare in Wellington. The picturesque quality of the turrets, steep gables, and decorative barge boards give the house significant aesthetic value. Townscape Does the item have townscape value for the part it plays in defining a space or street; providing visual interest; its role as a landmark; or the contribution it makes to the character and sense of place of Wellington? This house has considerable streetscape values particularly in relation to the surrounding high rise buildings. Historic Value close Association Is the item associated with an important person, group, or organisation? This house is associated with several notable Wellington families, in particular that of John Plimmer ‘the father of Wellington’. Plimmer’s grandson, Harold, bought the house in 1911 and it remained in the family until 1960. Scientific Value close Archaeological Does the item have archaeological value for its ability to provide scientific information about past human activity? Plimmer House is found within the NZAA Central City Archaeological Area R27/270. This house was constructed pre 1900, although it has been moved from its original site. The risk of archaeological discovery is unknown. Technological Does the item have technological value for its innovative or important construction methods or use of materials? There is some technical value in the construction of this house as it is a good representative of nineteenth century timber construction. The fretwork is an excellent example of the craftsmanship of the time. Social Value close Identity Sense Of Place Continuity Is the item a focus of community, regional, or national identity? Does the item contribute to sense of place or continuity? This building contributes significantly to the sense of place and continuity in the central city of Wellington due to its long standing place in the streetscape. Public Esteem Is the item held in high public esteem? This house is held in high public esteem as the only 19th century building surviving in Boulcott Street, it has rarity value, and the decision to move it on its site rather than demolish show this. The establishment of a well regarded restaurant has helped this building to remain popular and have ensured its survival. Level of Cultural Heritage Significance close Authentic Does the item have authenticity or integrity because it retains significant fabric from the time of its construction or from later periods when important additions or modifications were carried out? The exterior of this building retains significant authenticity although the interior has been through a number of alterations. These internal alterations have, however, helped this building to remain popular and have ensured its survival in an otherwise high rise environment. Rare Is the item rare, unique, unusual, seminal, influential, or outstanding? Plimmer House is a rare example of the Carpenter Gothic style in Wellington city and is the only 19th century building remaining on Boulcott Street. Importance Is the item important for any of the above characteristics at a local, regional, national, or international level? This house is important at a local level due to its association with early prominent Wellingtonians, its place in the streetscape, as a representative of a now rare style of architecture in the city, and its technical values. Local / Regional / National / International Importance close Not assessed close Site Detail District Plan Number 17/34 (Heritage Order) Legal Description Lot 1 DP 377864 Heritage New Zealand Listed 1/Historic Place 225 Archaeological Site Pre 1900 Building Current Uses unknown Former Uses unknown Has building been funded No Funding Amount Not applicable Earthquake Prone Status Not Earthquake Prone close Additional Information Sources close Historic Places Trust. ‘Charles Tringham’. Professional Biographies’. Accessed 30 August 2013, Wellington City Council. Wellington Heritage Building Inventory 2001: Non Residential Buildings. Wellington City Council, 2001. Archives: 1922Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, add bathroom (00055:1:A83) Archives: 1925Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, garage (00055:50:A4720) Archives: 1948Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, reinstatement (00056:350:B26954) Archives: 1971Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, building additions and alterations (00058:733:C33195) Archives: 1972Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, locker and store room (00058:767:C34599) Archives: 1983Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, relocate and alter Plimmer house (00058:0:C62212) Archives: 1986Unit 2, 99 Boulcott Street, Kitchen alterations (00059:0:D2588) Archives: 199199 Boulcott Street, restaurant alterations (00059:497:E23708) Archives: 199599 Boulcott Street, restaurant alterations (00061:163:15232) Technical Documentation close Inventory Report Footnotes close Not available Last updated: 11/3/2016 1:54:17 AM

name: ambassadoroamaru.co.nz
homepage_content: Oamaru Motel Accommodation - ASURE Ambassador Motor Lodge CHECK AVAILABILITY FIND THE BEST RATE WELCOME TO ASURE AMBASSADOR MOTOR LODGE Motel Accommodation in Oamaru Wiley welcomes you to ASURE Ambassador Motor Lodge situated at the north end of the Oamaru Central Business District. At our 11-unit motel we strive to offer the best in comfort and hospitality, offering home-baked muffins to all guests on arrival. As we have both travelled extensively we feel we have good insight to travellers' needs and are happy to assist with itineraries if required. Rooms Our room layouts comprise studio, 1 and 2-bedroom units, 6 with spa baths. All are ground-floor and smoke-free. Off-street-parking at your unit door. Studio Unit Studio Unit with Spa Bath Studio Access Unit 1 Bedroom Spa Unit Executive 1 Bedroom Unit 1 Bedroom Family Unit 2 Bedroom Family Unit #1 2 Bedroom Family Unit #2 Visiting Oamaru Oamaru is 116km from Dunedin, 283km from Christchurch and is known as the Gateway to the Waitaki and Southern Lakes District. Oamaru, described as 'New Zealand's best kept secret' is recognised as a destination town with the world-renowned Yellow and Blue Penguin Colonies. Stay with us, relax and take time to enjoy the many wonderful attractions the Waitaki Region has to offer. A two-minute drive takes you through the town centre to Victorian Oamaru with its beautiful white-stone architecture, the magnificent Opera House and the famous blue and yellow-eyed penguin colonies. Other attractions nearby are Whitestone Cheese, world-class Public Gardens, the Moeraki Boulders, the Fossil Trail and Steampunk Headquarters. View Rooms Our Airbnb Accommodation Welcome to White Oasis – a cosy, stylish two-bedroom retreat just a 10-minute walk from supermarkets, shops, and cafés, yet tucked away in a peaceful setting where you can truly relax. Inside, unwind beneath rustic Australian ironbark beams in the living area, where a baby grand piano invites musical moments. Enjoy modern comforts, including a fully equipped kitchen with a Lavazza coffee machine and a 55" Panasonic smart TV – all surrounded by the tranquillity of nature. A Bosch laundry makes longer stays easy, while Oamaru's Victorian charm and famous blue penguins await nearby. When the sun's out, fire up the BBQ and dine alfresco. Unlimited complimentary WiFi keeps you connected throughout your stay. Visit White Oasis 2018 RECOGNITION OF EXCELLENCE ASURE Ambassador Motor Lodge HotelsCombined 9.2 Rated by Guests ASURE_Ambassador_Motor_Lodge Call us on 0800 437 214 to book direct and save We are members of the ASURE Accommodation Group which consists of quality, independently owned and operated accommodation properties throughout New Zealand. Our ASURE loyalty programme: stay 10 nights at any three ASURE properties throughout New Zealand and receive a $100 credit off your 10th night. To see information on all our properties and for checking availability in any of these properties, click here. Your Deal Today

name: annickhouse.co.nz
homepage_content: Annick House, welcoming self contained & bed and breakfast accommodation in Nelson, New Zealand Annick House Offers tastefully furnished superior accommodation in the heart of Nelson City, New Zealand. private, spacious, well appointed self contained studio private, spacious, well appointed self contained guest apartment quiet and secluded setting just eight minutes’ walk from Nelson's shopping area and restaurants breakfast tray featuring local fruits in season, a selection of cereals, and locally produced jams or a sumptuous cooked breakfast. We deliver the breakfast tray to your rooms, for you to enjoy at your leisure. your home away from home We look forward to you enjoying a memorable holiday in peaceful surroundings and a homely atmosphere in our sunny and secluded haven. Nelson is a great place to unwind, relax and share the many things you'll discover and enjoy in Nelson City and the Tasman region. Nelson is the Sunshine capital of New Zealand it's renowned for its fine wines and vineyards, craft beers and breweries, artists' studios and craft outlets. Give yourself time to enjoy our beautiful clean beaches, fantastic Abel Tasman, Nelson Lakes and Kahurangi national parks and many other outdoor activities. Nelson is the favourite holiday destination for New Zealand families. We're Nelson Locals We're happy to help you create memories - having lived in the Nelson area for many years we're familiar with all the local attractions. We're very happy to assist with advice and activity bookings. "The joy in this home is infectious! Thank you so much for your warmth and welcome" Helen "Peaceful, relaxing and quiet stay, beautiful gardens, delicious breakfasts. Thank you" Jennifer & Brett, Colorado, USA

homepage_content: ASURE Aveda Motor Lodge Pukekohe | ASURE Aveda Motor Lodge Welcome to ASURE Aveda Motor Lodge Arrival Arrival calendar Departure Departure calendar Guests 1 guest 2 guests 3 guests 4 guests 5 guests 6 guests 7 guests 8 guests 9 guests 10 guests Guests calendar Book Now Relax in 4.5 star comfort â enjoy modern, spacious, pristine rooms with excellent facilities while being centrally located in the heart of Pukekohe. Our Mission: is to strive to provide the best possible guest experience. Videos Rooms Executive Studio Enjoy a spacious, non-smoking room for 2 guests with a plush king bed, free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, and reverse-cycle air conditioning. Each room includes a modern ensuite (some with spa baths), a fully equipped kitchenette with complimentary tea, coffee, and milk, plus thoughtful extras like leather seating, workspace, and family amenities on request. Learn More Large Executive Studio Located upstairs, relax in a spacious, non-smoking room designed for couples, friends, or small families, up to 3 guests. Featuring a luxurious king bed plus a king single, free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, and reverse-cycle air conditioning. Each room includes a modern ensuite (some with spa baths), a well-equipped kitchenette with complimentary tea, coffee, and milk, along with comfortable seating, workspace, and family-friendly amenities on request. Learn More Easy Accessible Studio Our easy access room for two guests is thoughtfully designed for comfort and convenience, featuring special bathroom fittings with a walk-in spacious shower, wide doorways, and accessible kitchenette facilities. Relax with a plush king bed, free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, and reverse-cycle air conditioning. Complimentary tea, coffee, and milk, along with comfortable seating, workspace, and practical amenities, ensure every guest enjoys a relaxing and hassle-free stay. Learn More One-Bedoom Apartment Enjoy the comfort of a spacious suite with a separate bedroom and lounge, perfect for added privacy and relaxation. A plush king bed along with a bathroom that features a spa bath with shower overhead, while the kitchenette offers bench-top cooking facilities alongside complimentary tea, coffee, and milk. Free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, reverse-cycle air conditioning, and thoughtful extras ensure a comfortable and convenient stay. Learn More Two-Bedroom Apartment Ideal for families or groups up to 4 guests, our two-bedroom units offer the convenience of separate sleeping spaces alongside a comfortable lounge. Each unit features a modern bathroom, a well-equipped kitchenette with bench-top cooking, complimentary tea, coffee, and milk, plus free unlimited WiFi, Smart TV with Sky 50+ channels, and reverse-cycle air conditioning. Thoughtful extras and family-friendly amenities ensure a relaxed and enjoyable stay. Learn More Previous Next About Us Welcome to the Aveda Motor Lodge. Our award-winning motel provides superb accommodation in the heart of Pukekohe and offers a range of different room types to meet every need. Super comfortable, spacious, secure and spotless clean our rooms are ideal for business or leisure, whether you are travelling on your own or as part of a group or family Conveniently located, Aveda Motor Lodge is within walking distance Pukekohe Town Centre, where you will find a variety of excellent eateries and shopping. You can easily drive to the attractions in the Fraklin District and greater Auckland area. Auckland Airport is 35 minutes, 10 minutes to the Karaka Horse Venue, 45 minutes to the Auckland CBD, and Hamilton is a mere 50 minutes away with the motorway ramps north and south only 10 minutes from the Aveda Motor Lodge. Our team is focused on supporting you to make your stay memorable. Our mission is to strive to provide the best possible guest experience â we look forward to hosting you. name: avenue-motel.co.nz
homepage_content: Avenue Motel Alexandra - Home Avenue Motel Alexandra's accommodation Avenue Motel has a 4 Star Plus rating and we are proud to offer 15 high-quality units. With very competitive rates and executive style comfort, your stay with us will be enjoyable and satisfying. Alexandra is the hub of New Zealand's stone fruit and merino wool industries. Set your own pace in Central Otago. Cycle a section of the Otago Central Rail Trail, see the area from the sky, taste award-winning wines in amazing locations, try curling year-round at Nasby 45 minutes from Alexandra, play a round of golf, cruise the Clutha River, visit picturesque historic gold mining towns or just kick back and relax. Avenue Motel Alexandra is your perfect base for all these activities. Ideally situated for easy access to the town and in close proximity to many sporting facilities: the Molyneux complex, the aquatic center, an 18-hole golf course and the start of the Central Otago Rail Trail, Hamish look forward to welcoming you at the Avenue Motel, Alexandra. Motel Overview 15 spacious units (including Executive units, Spa unit, Studio units). Wheelchair accessible facilities available in two of the units. Please enquire direct. Well appointed, self-catering kitchenettes with Fridge, Microwave Oven. All units have air-conditioning/heat pumps. Roller-beds, Child porta - cots and high chairs available. Free Wifi available in all rooms ( 10 GB free ). Flat Screen TV's with SKY Guest Select 50 + Channels in all rooms. Free off-street parking. Free secure bike storage. Barbecue area. Guest laundry facilities. Walking distance to local restaurants. View more View our room types Our motel has 15 High-quality units Competitive rates and executive style comfort View more Local attractions Central Otago is New Zealand’s most inland region, also it’s hottest, coldest and driest. View more Get in touch Hamish would like to welcome you to the Avenue Motel. View more Read our guest reviews Great location We stayed here for one night, the 2 bedroom unit was spacious, has great amenities and was very clean.Full kitchen facilities & Beds comfortable. Second visit here and doesn't disappoint as one of the cleanest & well kept motels we have stay at. Would definitely stay again if needed accommodation in Alexandra. -Wendy Awesome trip Awesome awesome motel, we stayed twice over January for our friends wedding. The cleanest rooms i have ever stayed in and the banter with the owners was a real kiwi feel. So helpful, nothing eas an issue and i love how they give the wifi code straightaway. We will always stay here when we go to central otago. Thanks - AliceC Lovely room, great host A very nice room, with everything we needed. The proprieter was extremely helpful and friendly and overall this was one of the best motels we've used in our tour of New Zealand. There was a pleasant venue for dinner within a short walking distance. A lovely stay! -Wendy B Weekend trip This motel have the most comfortable King beds ever. I am fussy about sleeping in hard beds, but the owners had all the lovely things I like in a bed. Also spotless. Lovely motel, totally recommend it. Also the town has a really nice feel about it. -Shona M Excellent place to stay Stayed at this motel and was very happy with our time there. The room was very clean & tidy with everything we needed there. The room was only a single room with a bathroom but it was a big room with plenty of space. Definitely reccommend this place to anyone to stay. -gusgus Read more Photo Gallery Our beautiful Central Otago town. Visit, stay and explore for yourself... Photography by Joy Bennett Photography by Joy Bennett Photography by Joy Bennett Photography by Joy Bennett ALEXANDRA WEATHER Avenue Motel Alexandra Your Hosts: Hamish Dua | Phone: +64 3 448 6919 | Email: avenue.motel@xtra.co.nz | Address: 117 Centennial Avenue, Alexandra 9320, Central Otago © 2025 - Sitemap - Admin Login - Website by GuestTraction

name: aucklandairportlodge.co.nz
homepage_content: Auckland Airport Lodge Auckland Airport Accommodation Complimentary Airport Shuttle & Car Storage MULTIPLE DEVICES - ALL ROOM TYPES FREE UNLIMITED WIFI Self-contained accommodation FREE SHUTTLE TO DOMESTIC & INTERNATIONAL TERMINALS 10 MINS FROM AKL AIRPORT ] Auckland Airport Lodge Accommodation Book Now Free Car Storage & Complimentary Airport Shuttle - Free Unlimited WiFi Auckland Airport Lodge offers accommodation a short distance away from Auckland Airport, perfect for short layovers or a quiet nights rest before departing onwards to other destinations around New Zealand. Our fully self-contained accommodation are a popular choice for travellers. Full kitchen facilities in-room allow guests to self-cater, with a 24hr Countdown Supermarket nearby offering a full range of food, drink & supermarket products. There are a number of wonderful attractions for all ages and interess close to Auckland Airport & Auckland Airport Lodge - see our below list for more information. Self-contained Accommodation Conference Facilities Free Airport Shuttles & Parking Close to Auckland Airport Local Dining Options Nearby Attractions Terms and Conditions Online Reservations Testimonials Stayed twice, one each end of our trip, overnight stop in Auckland. First room was standard. Certainly great for a overnight stay, booked well ahead so excellent rate which includes free shuttle to airport. Room clean, think recently up dated. Excellent beds & pillows. On way back stayed in a more expensive deluxe room, big, would sleep 4. Again, beds are great. All looks modern. Certainly stay again especially if you book well ahead & get the cheap rates and need accommodation near the airport. – Margaret S Whanganui, New Zealand We chose this place mainly because of the airport shuttle service on offer and car storage availability. We were not disappointed, everything was awesome. The morning we returned from a 12.5 hr flight it was a decent frost, the shuttle was bang on time which was nice and our vehicle had been bought out of the storage area and sitting in the sun to warm up and defrost. The only minor criticism we have is there was quite a step up into the shower cubicle from the floor, otherwise our Unit ticked all the boxes. Will definitely come here again! – cookaborough Rotorua, New Zealand A very convenient location for airport stayovers, free airport shuttle is easy, picked up and checked in within minutes! The room is extremely spacious with excellent facilities from a kitchenette to a little backyard! The man who works here is also lovely and will do anything to help. All in all – excellent value for money and exceptional service! Would definitely recommend 🙂 – Eleanor S

homepage_content: Black and White Barn — Matakana Boutique 0 Rustic and CHARMING in CENTRAL MATAKANA FROM $800 to $1300 PER NIGHT ACCOMMODATES 6 GUESTS ACROSS 3 BEDROOMS Architecturally designed for entertaining, the black and white barn exudes rustic elegance. Nestled among mature trees and a one-minute walk to the vibrant Matakana village, it’s the perfect place for couples or large groups to stay. The property comprises three spaces – book them separately or together to suit your needs. View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize The Barn Three bedrooms make up the house: upstairs, one queen, two singles and a bathroom. Downstairs, the master suite has a king that you can split into two singles, an ensuite bathroom, a spacious kitchen, laundry, and scullery. Open-plan living flows from the kitchen to the lounge, with a fireplace for those cooler nights. The private back garden has a large table and seating – ideal for al fresco summer meals. The property also has two adjoining suites, which can be opened to form a larger space or separated for privacy. Learn More Previous Next About ASURE Brookvale Motel Motel Accommodation in the heart of Lake Wanaka Welcome to ASURE Brookvale Motel in Wanaka, New Zealand. Located a stone's throw away from the town center and lakefront, our quiet oasis offers fully self-contained units, making it your home away from home. Enjoy the convenience of being only 300 meters from Wanaka's lakefront and a 2 minute walk to Wanaka town centre. Relax with views of the majestic mountains and serene creek from your private balcony or garden. Each unit is equipped with full kitchen facilities, ensuite bathrooms, living area with couch, dining area, flatscreen smart tv's and complimentary WiFi available throughout the property. All units have dual heat pump air conditioning units to ensure your comfort in any season. Wanaka Golf Course is a short 5-minute walk, and the famed Puzzling World is just a 3-minute drive. Additionally, the renowned Cardrona and Treble Cone Ski Fields are a scenic 35-45 minute drive from our doorstep. homepage_content: Blue Seas Motels || Stay in Kaikoura | Sea View Motel Kaikoura – Blue Seas Home Accommodation Activities Location Book Online Contact Us © Blue Seas Motels - 2025 BLUE SEAS MOTELS We have the perfect accommodation for you. BLUE SEAS MOTELS We have the perfect accommodation for you. BLUE SEAS MOTELS We have the perfect accommodation for you. Welcome Welcome to Blue Seas Motels, your home away from home in picturesque Kaikoura where a warm welcome is guaranteed. Come and stay with us on the beach front and enjoy our comfortable, spacious units set in a peaceful location. You'll be treated to beautiful Kaikoura sunrises and sunsets as well as impressive views of the sea and mountains. Situated only 1.5km from the town centre, we are in a great position to help you make the most of Kaikoura's wonderful attractions. There's a whole range of fantastic activities in Kaikoura, such as whale watching, kayaking trips, swimming with dolphins or seals, hunting trips, helicopter trips and 4-wheel drive trips, and we'll even help you book your tours, free of charge. We look forward to seeing you soon! ROOMS View Details ACTIVITIES View Details LOCATION View Details CONTACT US View Details About Us Blue Seas Motel is 1.5km from the Kaikoura town centre on the beachfront and is conveniently located close to key attractions. With a range of well-appointed units, friendly staff, and a convenient location, Blue Seas Motels provide a delightful and relaxing stay for visitors exploring the charms of Kaikoura. Experience nature at its best! In the picturesque coastal town of Kaikoura, visitors can delight in a diverse array of exciting activities and attractions. Whether it's swimming with dolphins, whale watching, exploring the breathtaking coastline, or savouring delectable seafood, there is an abundance of experiences to cater to the interests and preferences of every visitor. ROOMS Enjoy beautiful sunsets and sunrises from our motel in Kaikoura. Choose from either studios or one and two bedroom units. name: brunorossi.co.nz
homepage_content: Bruno Rossi NZ 0 Delizioso Italian-Inspired Fresh Coffee. Rich, bold and handsome. Everything good coffee should be. “Bruno Rossi is the complete package!” Mark Skilling from Mumbles Café, Hanmer Springs. "They understand my business. The changeover went seamlessly. It was all done in a morning and they were out of here by lunchtime! It’s the complete package, and that’s what you want.” “Quality and freshness are number one.” Scott Pepler, Master Roaster With over 25 years in the industry, Scott knows coffee inside-out. In fact, it’s safe to say he’s mastered the art of the perfect blend. “We source our green beans ethically and roast only the best. Repeatability and consistency are key to me.” Read more… Our Coffee Blends Inspired by Italy’s love affair with espresso, Bruno Rossi fresh coffee blends are tailored to suit New Zealand’s unique coffee culture, while celebrating the Italian-inspired heritage of this espresso brand. Primavera produces a nutty, caramelly flavour with notes of berry and a floral aroma from the finest Ethiopian blends. Slow roasted for a delicate, smooth and well-balanced coffee. Definitely as good as matching your shoes with your man bag. Alto offers up a rich, balanced and full-bodied experience. Slow roasted for superior flavour, complete with chocolatey notes and a sweet, spicy finish. So good you could pour it on your spaghetti (caveat… we actually haven't tried this). Uno , our darkest blend, brings you a distinctive and full-flavoured brew featuring a nutty, chocolate aftertaste. Dark roasted to produce a balanced coffee with a rich, strong edge. You'd even sell your Vespa for a cup. “Sustainability is at the core of what we do.” Antica Soljan, Sustainability Manager All our Bruno Rossi coffee is Rainforest Alliance Certified. The farmers who grow our beans get a fair price, which means they can invest back into their communities. Read more ... “Reliability and expertise you can count on.” Rob Hulse, Machinery & Servicing, Espresso Mechanics We’ll help you choose the best machinery for your café, all backed by our team of unsurpassed technical experts. “We’re here to share our knowledge with you.” Andrew Payne, Barista Training We’ll share our extensive coffee expertise to help build on the skills of your first-class baristas. Your customers want consistently beautiful coffee. Whether you’re setting up a new café or simply want to change coffee partners, our team of friendly, dedicated and passionate coffee people will help you every step of the way; taking the pressure off and making things easy. Meet our people … We’d love to start a conversation with you. Get in touch now or talk to a real person on 0800 423 267. Make An Enquiry Send Us An Email Give Us A Call
