name: bellini.co.nz
homepage_content: Bellini – Bellini Bar – Hilton Auckland Skip to content About Sitting at the end of Princes Wharf, on the ground floor at Hilton Auckland, Bellini Bar is Auckland’s hidden treasure in the heart of the CBD. By day, sip on fresh barista coffee and take in Bellini’s waterfront views. By night, as the lights are dimmed, enjoy a cocktail, beer, or glass of champagne sitting seaside. Taking in the nautical surroundings, Bellini offers a relaxed yet sophisticated atmosphere, with elegant touches and an extensive beverage list. Bellini focuses on innovative cocktails, fine wines, and local spirits, with a Neo-Mediterranean-inspired menu of small plates and snacks designed to share. Bellini offers comfortable outdoor seating for those hot Auckland summer days, and in the colder months, enjoy a whisky or red wine by the indoor fire pit. For an added element of fun, book in for one of Bellini’s famous mixology masterclass, or a glamorous contemporary afternoon tea. Whether you are in for an after-work drink, a morning coffee catch-up with friends, or an in-house guest, everyone is welcome. Unwind in style as you watch the boats sailing out over Waitemata Harbour at Bellini. Open 7 days a week Monday – Friday , 8 am – Late Saturday, Sunday, and Public Holidays, 9 am – Late What’s On Wine O’clock Monday – Thursday 4:00pm – 6:00pm | Friday – Sunday 8:00pm – 10:00pm When the hour is right, it’s Wine O’Clock time! With daily featured wine, starting from $12* or explore the vines, one pour at a time with our curated wine tasting. Champagne & Opera Every Friday | 6.30pm-7.30pm Together with Champagne Pommery, Piano Traders and New Zealand Opera School, Bellini brings you a sunset hour of opera on Friday evenings. Sit back with a glass of champagne in hand and enjoy an evening of great opera moments from Handel to Verdi with some of New Zealand’s most talented opera singers. Afternoon by the Sea Every Thursday – Sunday | 11.00am-4.00pm Festive Afternoon Tea Experience the magic of the season with Pastry Chef Hiranya Ratnayake’s handcrafted Festive Afternoon Tea, showcasing refined takes on beloved seasonal favourites. Mixology Masterclass Join us at ‘the distillery’ for a cocktail/mocktail masterclass where you will learn how to shake, stir and strain 3 signature cocktails with our expert mixologists. Email us at bellini@hilton.com to find out more. Let’s get social! Copyright Bellini 2025 - All Rights Reserved Back To Top

name: civictheatre.net.nz
homepage_content: Civic Theatre Waipukurau | Civic Theatre Unfortunately we are unable to screen our Sunday screening of “Snow White” at 11.45am - Minecraft will still screen at 1.30pm (Sunday) - And other movies will run as per schedule - Sorry for any inconvenience CIVIC THEATRE COMPLEX CONTACT The Civic Theatre Waipukurau opened on 12 November 1981, it was designed by Hastings architect Peter Holland to replace the old Municipal Theatre in Kitchener St which had to be demolished after being declared an earthquake risk. Today, the Civic Theatre Waipukurau complex is run by Sereena & Donald Parkinson, showing movies, and also operating Latitude 40 South Cafe and Roaring Forties Takeaways. The main cinema seats 260+ people, and is equipped with the latest digital-cinema technology, the largest screen in Hawke's Bay and dolby surround sound. name: doughbakery.co.nz
homepage_content: Dough Bakery | Discover Fresh Bakery Delights Today Welcome to Dough Bakery Dough is a modern take on the classic bakery. We’re inspired by the everyday kiwi bakeries but enjoy the elegance of European deliciousness. Dough Bakery is proud to be a (little) family-owned business from the mighty Upper Hutt Quick View Quick View Shop Now Hands On Bread Making Classes Join our bread making courses at Dough Bakery and explore the art of artisan baking. We host both private and public classes. Tim will teach you how to create delicious bread that you get to take home afterwards. We provide drinks, snacks and - of course - a recipe for you to keep! Book now Family Owned and Operated Dough Bakery started as a teeny business and has grown to six locations throughout Wellington. Tim and Mia Tracey started Dough and remain ‘on the tools’ in the business. Dough represents family and tradition. We create each loaf, pastry, and cake, prioritising quality over and above anything else. We blend timeless techniques and modern ideas then hand-make the goods at our HQ in Upper Hutt. Learn more

name: coastalmotorlodge.co.nz
homepage_content: Coastal Motor Lodge Skip to main content Skip to footer Main Content Coastal Motor Lodge Coastal Motor Lodge is a four star Motel located five minutes North of Thames at the gateway of the magnificent Coromandel Peninsula. Accommodation is set amongst beautiful lush grounds directly opposite the Hauraki Gulf and provides a range of quality accommodation including elevated sea view studio chalets, family room, access rooms and budget style cottages. We also cater to businesses who require a home away from home for valued employees. Coastal Motor Lodge has four accommodation options to choose from to suit couples, families and a range of budgets. There are: six sea view studio chalets that sleep 2 adults two sea view chalets that sleep up to 3 people one 1 bedroom unit with sea views two ground level access units four larger kiwi batch style cottages. " Stunning place. Wonderful Staff and service. Had a great stay. Thank you Facilities Reception Just up the stairs in the middle of the motel you will find our guest reception. We are open from 8am to 8pm each day to look after all your needs. Chalet Style Room with Balconies Most of our units have balconies facing west towards the relaxing Firth of Thames. Enjoy and wine and relax as the sun sets across the water. Tranquil Setting Along The Coast Our large lawn and gardens are available for you to play and relax. Sit in the BBQ area or wander the grounds and nearby beach. BBQ We have a BBQ and outdoor eating area for our guests.There is no charge for the BBQ, but we ask that you clean up when you have finished. Guest Laundry A guest washing machine and dryer is available on site. Sky Satellite TV Sky 50+ channels including Sky Sport.We also Have MYSKY, live pause and record in every room Footer Contact Us +64 7 868 6843 info@coastalmotorlodge.co.nz 608 Tararu, State Highway 25, Thames, Coromandel Peninsula, New Zealand Getting Here The best way to travel to Thames is via car. It’s an easy drive from most upper North Island towns and cities. Another option is to travel by bus, there are several bus companies, like Intercity Bus operating services to Thames from various destinations. A ferry service operates from Auckland to Coromandel town. 2025 © barefoot web design

name: ciciocacio.co.nz
homepage_content: Italian Restaurant - Cicio Cacio Osteria Newtown Skip to content A me piacciono gli anfratti bui delle osterie dormienti, dove la gente culmina nell’eccesso del canto. A me piacciono le cose bestemmiate e leggere, e i calici di vino profondi. “I like dark crannies of sleeping osterie, where people culminate in the excess of singing. I like cursed and light things, and deep glasses of wine." Our Story “It was something like ten or eleven years ago. I was lost and lonely, working as a cook, living in an old motel (The Carillon) in Mount Cook in Wellington, and trying to be a writer. I didn’t have time or will for washing my clothes at the motel, so every Monday on my day off I would walk to Newtown, leave my stuff at a laundry nearby and go to have a coffee at Baobab café. There was an eatery called Manon at the back of an alleyway in front of the cafe. I would spy the restaurant from the little window thinking how cute it was. Manon eventually closed down and the place seemed to be abandoned for years. The place looked as old as it could be in Europe, and decadent and bohemian as all the things I loved. Few years went by and life took over. I married a beautiful Chilean girl who used to cook with me and call me “dictator!”, I learned to speak Spanish like a Chilean, I stopped writing bull… and I got into running some Italian kitchen in town at Mariluca first and then Ombra. Then my friend Luis who runs Viva Mexico next door, passed me the contact of the landlord of that old place in Newtown. The landlord was an old man in an old house in Oriental Bay. He loved that restaurant more than anything he had and he always dreamt to bring it back to life, before it was too late. My wife Patricia, my former business partner and I opened the place with $16.000 dollars, with a name that nobody could pronounce, going against any common sense business rules and with no much hope to survive. We started serving two lonely house made sausages on an empty plate, pouring only Italian wines, and writing menus in Italian. People thought we were nice guys, but won’t make it. And here we are, five years later, celebrating every day the same love for good people, honest food and true wines.” (Giulio Ricatti – chef patron) A CULINARY JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF ITALY... By being an “osteria” we mean that at Cicio Cacio we cook humble Italian food in a family environment. We are passionate about Italian regional cuisine and we pretend to travel the whole peninsula, researching Italian lost recipes. We change the menu every month, following a different city of Italy. If we can do something by hand we will do it, as our famous bread, pasta and sausages. Our goal is to be as authentic as it would be the food you eat at home in Italy. We try to look closer at ingredients, places, people and memories. Our language is the language of simplicity, treated with care and respect. All our dishes, wines and menus are in Italian because Italy is what our “osteria” is about. We invite you to enjoy the trip. Buon Appetito!! the art of wine As for our food, our wine list reflects our travels through Italy and our passion for mysterious and exotic grapes. As home of something like 500 different varieties, Italy is probably the most interesting wine producer in the world. We love our wines and we love our people, and we try to match the two things. Are you a student? Are you an artist? Are you an intellectual, a housewife or a businessman? Are you young or old? Man or female? Poor or rich? We try to have wines for everyone. We like wines that express Italy at its best, keeping the subject easy and democratic. As every other art (or craft) it is a simple thing, really. It is not a headache. It is a pleasure. Drink List Cicio Cacio is not only a restaurant, it is our home. We will light candles and fire, pour wine and play music. As Baudelaire would have said: “We will boil and serve our own heart”. name: hukalodge.com
homepage_content: Huka Lodge New Zealand | Luxury Taupo Accommodation NZ | 5-Star Resorts By the river at Huka Lodge Long regarded as one of the world’s most revered and inspirational luxury accommodations, Huka Lodge is set among 17-acres of established, parklike gardens along the banks of the emerald-blue Waikato River near Lake Taupō on New Zealand’s North Island. With humble beginnings more than a century ago as a fisher’s camp with white canvas tents pegged along the trout-rich river, Huka Lodge has today secured its place as one of the country’s oldest and most celebrated luxury lodges. In 2024 Huka Lodge closed for a carefully considered ‘centenary redesign’, and reopened its doors in March 2025, ready to welcome a next generation of global luxury traveller. Step inside to experience our luxury Regal luxury Fit for a King: twenty guest suites along with two exclusive owners' residences, the Alan Pye Cottage and Alex van Heeren Cottage, are dotted along the banks of the Waikato River and among verdant gardens, each opening onto rolling green lawns and with the sounds of birdsong and the burbling river as nature's orchestral score. Find your suite Exclusive packages & offers Exclusive packages The century-young Huka Lodge welcomes guests to Taupō in the heart of New Zealand’s North Island. Specially tailored packages are generously inclusive and allow for extended stays with extra benefits. View all packages and see what’s included in every stay Classic Huka Stay 3 nights or more with premium extras View Details Baillie Escape A shorter stay with generous inclusions View Details Best Hotels Asia-Pacific 2025 October 2025 The World’s 50 Best Hotels 2025 The 51-100 List #88 October 2025 Two MICHELIN Keys October 2025 Readers' Choice Awards 2025 #2 World's Best Resort Australasia and the South Pacific October 2025 Readers' Choice Awards 2025 #19 Best Resort Australia and Pacific October 2025 Fodor's Finest 2026: The 5 Best Hotels in Australia and the Pacific September 2025 The WanderSleeps List April 2025 Hotel Awards - Best New Country Retreats April 2025 Star Awards 2025 February 2025 The Best Places to Go in Oceania January 2025 Luxury Awards Asia Pacific - Best Country Lodge in New Zealand June 2024 Oceania’s Leading Boutique Hotel September 2022 Natural beauty Overlooking the ever-changing Waikato River – one moment lazy and deep, the next swirling and icy blue – Huka Lodge is located in Taupō, distinguished by its vast lake and endowed with a gentle climate, a leisurely pace and spectacular landscape. Explore Taupō Elegant dining The fine dining and exceptional cuisine on offer at Huka Lodge continues to define the world-class hospitality experience. A vast wine cellar of premium vintages complements a daily-changing menu, showcasing New Zealand’s finest produce. The restaurant, bar, lounges and terrace offer a traditional lodging ambiance, while signature dining venues are dotted around the estate. Whet your appetite Grand heritage Founded as a fisherman’s camp in 1924 with white canvas tents pegged by the Waikato River, Huka Lodge was recognised first as a best-kept secret among anglers and grew in popularity with guests from around the world drawn to the property’s signature checked lawns leading to the river’s swirling eddies and rushing rapids. A century on, Huka Lodge has a grand heritage, rich in stories and history to be discovered. Discover more Huka Lodge has proudly unlocked Two MICHELIN Keys in The MICHELIN Guide – a distinction that recognises the world’s most exceptional stays, awarded to a lodge that’s unique in every way. View our listing Huka Lodge has proudly unlocked Two MICHELIN Keys in The MICHELIN Guide – a distinction that recognises the world’s most exceptional stays, awarded to a lodge that’s unique in every way. View our listing LODGE NEWS AWARDS Tatler Best Awards 2025 Huka Lodge and sister property Longitude 131° in Australia's Red Centre have been named among Tatler’s Best 100 Hotels Asia-Pacific, celebrating excellence in hospitality. Discover the full guide to top hotels, restaurants and bars here. READ ARTICLE PRESS Be At One with Nature at this Bucolic Luxury Lodge A year-long, NZ$25 million transformation by Baillie Lodges and Virginia Fisher has revitalised the historic charm Huka Lodge with modern elegance, serene riverscape views and bespoke experiences. Lauren Ho chronicles it here for Wallpaper*. READ ARTICLE PRESS After a multi-million-dollar renovation, Huka Lodge proves why it's New Zealand's best luxury lodge Delicious editor Krysia Bonkowski travelled to Taupō for a first look at the newly reimagined Huka Lodge, where rich heritage meets contemporary elegance in expanded suites, bold interiors, and a new wellness offering set against the lodge’s iconic riverside backdrop. Read Article PRESS One of New Zealand's Most Impressive Resorts Has 20 Suites Set Along the Country's Longest River Travel + Leisure checked in to the newly refreshed Huka Lodge, where a thoughtful redesign by longtime collaborator Virginia Fisher brings a bold new energy to the riverside retreat, blending nostalgic charm with contemporary flair. Read Article PRESS New Zealand’s Historic Huka Lodge Reopens With Stunning Expansion Forbes travel writer Laurie Werner journeyed to New Zealand’s North Island to experience the newly reopened Huka Lodge, where a US$13.5 million renovation has elevated the century-old riverside retreat with expanded suites, floor-to-ceiling views, and a refreshed design by Virginia Fisher. Read Article PRESS A $23m facelift has made NZ’s most famous holiday lodge even more luxe AFR’s Ute Junker crossed the ditch to see how a $23 million revamp has taken New Zealand’s iconic Huka Lodge to new levels of luxury, with refreshed interiors, fine dining flair, and signature riverside charm. Read Article PRESS T&C Hotel Awards 2025 – Best New Rural Country Retreats Huka Lodge has been named in Town & Country's 12 Best New Rural Country Retreats list - a prestigious collection of top-tier rural getaways, from New Zealand to Norway and Bavaria to Britain, serenity is guaranteed. Read Article PRESS New Zealand’s original luxury lodge reopens after a $22 million renovation Gourmet Traveller’s Michael Harry offers a personal take on the newly reopened Huka Lodge, highlighting its $22.6 million refurbishment by Baillie Lodges. With refreshed interiors, a serene wellness retreat and elevated dining, the iconic hideaway balances heritage charm with a new era of quiet, contemporary luxury. Read Article PRESS Centenary Revamp Revealed Traveller’s Trudi Jenkins offers a personal review of the newly reopened Huka Lodge, commenting: ‘At first glance, the remote setting and quiet luxury conjure an episode of Succession - Tom and Shiv strolling over the manicured lawns... But there is a more layered history to Huka that speaks to a genuine desire to protect its unique charm’. READ ARTICLE PRESS The Best Places to Go in Australia, New Zealand and the South Pacific in 2025 Condé Nast Traveller UK has cast the net wide in considering the ‘Best Places to Go in Australia, New Zealand and the South Pacific in 2025’, naming Huka Lodge’s hometown of Taupō in the celebrated list. Read Article PRESS Riverside Retreat Luxury Travel magazine’s Belinda Craigie travelled to Huka Lodge and reports back that, 'A stay at Huka Lodge is just the remedy for leaving stresses behind and enjoying the finer features of Aotearoa - nature, exceptional food and wine, and genuine hospitality.' We agree! Read Article PRESS Seven Best Hotels Huka Lodge has been named in Fodor’s prestigious World’s Best Hotels list for the Asia Pacific region. As writer Michelle Tchea says, 'Known as the 'Grande Dame of New Zealand', Huka Lodge started as a simple fishing lodge in the 1920s and has grown into the premier location for luxury experiences.' Read Article PRESS Weekend in Taupo Writer Sue Hoffart takes a long weekend in Taupō, with Huka Lodge as her luxury base. 'Run, don’t walk from end-of-week commitments to reach Huka Lodge before the sun’s last rays bounce off this riverside beauty spot,' she says. Read Sue’s top 12 things to in the region as seen in Air New Zealand’s inflight magazine Kia Ora. Read Article PRESS Celebrating in Style Celebrating her 30th birthday at Huka Lodge, travel writer and global wanderer Brooke Saward of World of Wanderlust writes ‘I was starting to devise a plan to stay for good’, so taken was she with her experience. Read the full feature here. READ ARTICLE PRESS Loved by Locals Kiwis' are known for being house proud, and with great reason. With two years of lockdowns and border closures seeing a rise in domestic travel, Amy Louise Bailey for Travel + Leisure writes about the home-grown destinations locals can't get enough of. READ ARTICLE PRESS Romance Rating Big 7 Travel has named Huka Lodge as the sixth most romantic hotel in the world and number one in New Zealand. With suites layered in luxury, secluded dining nooks and mesmerising river views, it's easy for hearts to be sent aflutter here. READ ARTICLE PRESS NZ Best Bucket List Travel Experiences New Zealand Herald’s travel section has wrapped up the bucket list for 2022 – for travel to wherever we can – including Aotearoa’s world renowned Huka Lodge. We think it’s a top to-do too! Read all about it here. READ ARTICLE JOURNAL In Profile: Kerry Molloy Born and raised in New Zealand, Huka Lodge General Manager Kerry Molloy continues to lead the award-winning lodge in 2021 and beyond. Take a moment to read about his connection to New Zealand’s oldest luxury lodge. READ FEATURE NEWS Founder Alex van Heeren Honoured Huka Lodge founder Alex van Heeren is celebrated for his vision to create a superlative hospitality experience - the first of its kind in New Zealand. At Baillie Lodges we have honoured his legacy by renaming the Owner’s Cottage as the Alex van Heeren Cottage. VIEW COTTAGE With a reputation for peerless fly fishing and generous hospitality, Huka Lodge combines class, discretion and impeccable service in one of the most serene locations on the planet. John Barker Escape Huka Lodge has legendary status in New Zealand, it is spoken about in revered tones. On arrival, I realised there may be more to this place than a fancy room and breath-taking views. Kelli Brett Cuisine I cannot readily articulate just how the property held me in its grasp at first sight. However, it did, and still does to this day. Was it the sheer force and power of the turquoise green waters of the Waikato River on the one hand and all that tranquility and softness on the other? Perhaps it was simply the contradiction of the two. Alex van Heeren Founder, Huka Lodge There are so many things to like: the riverfront setting; the lavish duplex accommodations; and the superb cuisine. It is one of the finest hideaways of its type in the world. Andrew Harper Andrew Harper Travel Follow us FOR RESERVATION ENQUIRIES CALL +64 7 222 4555 OR ENQUIRE HERE reservations@hukalodge.co.nz +64 7 222 4555 ✕ Want to be the first to know? name: kingibritomart.com
homepage_content: kingi Britomart 0 Open 7 days All-day service & dinner Mon — Sun, 7am — late kingi celebrates seafood. Local, sustainably caught seafood that tastes like the ocean it came from. Savour the terroir of New Zealand’s oceans, dunes, river mouths and reefs, and enjoy a good glass of wine. Life is sweeter in rhythm with the ocean. At kingi, a deep connection to the ocean and land is celebrated on every plate and in every glass. We advocate for sustainable fishing and work with fishermen and women who share this value with us. We envision a brighter future for New Zealand’s fisheries. kingi Private is a sophisticated, brick-lined private dining or conference space. The private dining menu echoes the menu at kingi, with some special twists and additions, and is focused around sustainably sourced and seasonal produce from New Zealand. Learn more Follow kingi on social @kingi_britomart View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize View fullsize

name: lunasgelateria.co.nz
homepage_content: Gelato & Sorbet Parlour | Luna's Gelateria | Taupo top of page Luna's Gelateria Are you in the mood for a tasty ice cold treat? Pop into Luna's. Is it hot out there? Pop into Luna's. Are you wondering what to have for dessert? Pop into Luna's. Are you bored? Pop into Luna's. Are the kids getting on your nerves? Seriously, just pop into Luna's! Gelato really is the answer to everything. Don't believe me? Pop into Luna's ​ We have a large selection of gourmet gelato/ice cream & sorbet so set some time aside and pop into Luna's! ​ P.s We offer free tasters. Yip, we know. It's the best. ​ Refer to google for opening hours ​ 29 Tongariro Street, Taupo & 650 Lake Terrace, Taupo (The Landing) JUST A FEW OF OUR FLAVOURS Gelato & Sorbet We have waaaaaaaaaaay more flavours in store, to see what is available today feel free to pop into the store. PASSIONFRUIT SORBET CHOCOLATE GELATO WHITE CHOCOLATE RASPBERRY GELATO MIXED BERRY SORBET OUR GELATO Our fruit gelato (with the exception of banana) is all sorbetto – water-based, not milk-based. They are dairy free, vegan, gluten free and contain up to 38% real fruit – hence are 99% fat free. ​ Our milk based gelato is just that – milk based, in contrast to ice cream which is cream based. This means that our gelato is lower in fat than traditional ice cream and has a fuller more satisfying flavour. ​ 31 of our flavours have won awards at the NZ Ice Cream Association Manufacturers awards. ​ ​ ABOUT US How It All Began We are a small family-run business who love Taupō and gelato! We think Taupō is an amazing town with beautiful scenery and limitless activities. The only thing we believed it was missing was a world class gelateria serving the finest gelato & sorbet all made from the best, natural ingredients. Luna's is here to fill the void! So don't wait, get involved and try one of our many fantastic flavours today! ​ ​ CONTACT Lunasgelateria@gmail.com ​ bottom of page

homepage_content: LTD. | Mosaic Venues - Dynamic dining concept. Dynamic dining concept. Location Level 1/60 Dixon Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand CONTACT ltdevents@mosaicvenues.com Instagram Each event, pop-up, and menu is intentionally temporary - shaped by the seasons, global inspiration, and what's on our minds. LTD. - short for âlimited - is a celebration of the ever-evolving. Check out our 'whats on' page for up to date information on events being held at LTD. What's On Everybody Eats at LTD. Everybody Eats is a community restaurant, operating every Sunday to Wednesday , from 6pm to 8pm . This pay-what-you-can dining experience serves up delicious, chef-prepared three-course meals using perfectly good rescued food â and everyone is welcome. To learn more or sign up to volunteer, click here . Donations are appreciated to continue their work. name: lodgeonstgeorges.nz
homepage_content: Lodge On St Georges 0 A Home Away From Home. Lodge on St Georges is set on a 5 acres in the sunny Hawke’s Bay. Just 1km from the Havelock North Village, with its vibrant boutique shopping, cafes, restaurants and wineries. The stunning 8 bedroom accommodation is fully self contained and self catering. Relax by the pool, play a game of tennis and meet our friendly petting animals on our scenic grounds. It is the perfect accommodation for family and friends, corporate retreats, wedding or sporting groups wanting to stay & play together in the beautiful Hawkes Bay. Lodge On St Georges 443 St Georges Rd, Havelock North 021894100 stay@lodgeonstgeorges.nz CHECK AVAILABILITY A short video showing an overview of The Lodge & Cottages Lodge layout All beds in the Lodge can be configured as either super kings or two singles, making it easy to suit your groups needs. Extra trundler beds are available on request. The Lodge The perfect location for a weekend escape, wedding accommodation, after wedding BBQ’s, family reunions, birthdays and anniversaries, sporting trips, corporate retreats, meetings or conferences. Learn More & Book

name: martinsbayholidaypark.co.nz
homepage_content: Martins Bay Holiday Park A wonderful place to stay for a holiday Escape Auckland city and discover the coastal retreat of Martins Bay. Only an hour's drive to the north. Read More Arrival Date Number Of Nights Check Availability Whether you seek the tranquility of a beachfront location or panoramic views, there are choices to suit your needs. Choose from a great range of accommodation options and camping and caravan sites, you will find much more than just the basic camping facilities. View All Accommodation Cottages & Cabins Caravans Studios Glamping Tent and Hardstand Sites SKY TV and Games Room Communal Kitchen Communal Bathroom Barbecue Area Recreational Gear Hire Laundry Facilities Discover Your Perfect Getaway at Martin's Bay Holiday Park Escape to the beauty of Martin's Bay on the spectacular Mahurangi Peninsula facing Kawau Island and the beautiful islands of the Hauraki Gulf. Just an hour North of Auckland, you'll discover a serene retreat where you can unwind, reconnect with nature, and create unforgettable memories. Wake up to stunning sea views, native birdsong, and spend your days exploring pristine surroundings, and let the relaxed pace rejuvenate your spirit. Your ideal holiday starts here. Download Park Map On-Site Facilities We offer a range of great facilities to make your stay comfortable and convenient. View All Facilities Reception Reception (Ph 09 353 9685 ) First Aid items available here. AED in both camp kitchens. Current reception opening hours: Monday to Thursday 9am – 5pm Friday 8.30am – 7pm Saturday 8.30am – 6pm Sunday 8.30am – 5pm After hours calls will divert to our night phone 021 244 2043 . If you have arranged to arrive after reception has closed please follow the instructions given. Please use your gate barrier code or swipe card when entering and exiting the park. Gates operate between 6.30am and 10pm. Camp Shop Our camp shop is located at reception and has the same opening hours. We stock a range of confectionery, icecreams and drinks and a limited range of grocery items. We also stock fish bait and burley. We offer both salt and party ice. Wifi passes, pedal cart and watercraft hire and late check-outs can all be booked and paid for here. Campsite power leads and lanterns can also be hired here. Coins for showers and laundry machines can be purchased here too. Rec Room Situated just across from the main kitchen, the room is set up for dining and also has a dedicated kitchen area that can be hired for special events/functions. There is a lounge area with a large flatscreen TV with Freeview, a reading area and a foosball table. BBQ & Picnic Area Our covered outdoor area off the Rec room has electric BBQ’s, a large communal fridge and picnic tables. The lighting changes to sensor operation after 10pm. Drop-down screens can provide protection from inclement weather. Our movie screen is located here too. The area is adjacent to the playground so parents can relax while keeping an eye on their children. Please note that alcohol is only permitted here or in the Rec Room while dining. Smoking or vaping is prohibited in all common use areas of the holiday park. Children’s Playground Our playground is open until dark each day. Please always supervise young children. The playground is available to those aged between 5 and 12 only. Any misuse of the equipment will result in a ban from using the area. Please report any dangerous behaviour or equipment issues to reception asap. A table tennis table is situated under the big Pohutukawa tree and equipment is available from the camp shop. Camp Kitchens Main Kitchen Our well-equipped kitchen has ovens, electric hobs, sinks for washing dishes, a hot water Zip plus fridges and freezers (please bag and label your food supplies). Toasters, kettles, microwaves and other kitchen equipment are there for you to use. Please bring your own pots, pans frying pans & cooking utensils etc. An AED if located just inside the main door for use in an emergency. Plateau Kitchen A second smaller kitchen is located up at the Plateau camp area. An AED is located here. Laundry Facilities Our main laundry is adjacent to the main facilities block and has coin operated washing machines and dryers. A small second laundry is located up in the plateau block next to the kitchen. Main Facilities Block This block contains our main kitchen and male and female shower and toilet facilities. The showers are coin operated (50c for 5 min hot water). Please be mindful to take as little time as possible when using these facilities especially during peak times. Disability Facility We have a dedicated shower and toilet room that is located opposite the laundry. Please collect a key from reception upon arrival. Tom's Block Facilities This smaller block is located at the northern end of the lower camp and contains an outside shower as well as female and male showers and toilets. Boat Wash-down And Fish Cleaning Area There are 3 bays with coin-operated water taps for washing down water craft. Please ensure that motors are not run after 7.30 pm. There is a great fish cleaning area providing a filleting table, water and fish waste bins. Please follow the rules posted in the area and clean down everything when you have finished. Bait can be stored in the freezer in the small shed if there is capacity. Please name your bait. Any unnamed bait will be considered “left for others to use”. These facilities can be very busy on weekends especially if there is a competition on so please be patient. We thank the Martins Bay Bending Rods group for their continued support of this facility. Boat Storage And Launching We offer both short- and long-term boat storage. Please enquire about fees and availability at reception. Casual boat storage must be booked in advance when making your camp booking as spaces are limited at peak times. There is an all-tide boat ramp right beside the holiday park offering great access to the beautiful waters and islands of Kawau Bay and the wider Hauraki Gulf. Swimming Pontoon This facility is provided by Auckland Regional Parks and is in place between Labour weekend and Easter. This facility is not monitored by the holiday park staff. Please use the platform safely and report any misuse or equipment issues to reception asap. Please ensure that younger children are supervised at all times. Ideal location Martins Bay is a picturesque beach just over one hour north of central Auckland on the Mahurangi Peninsula, a spectacular haven of crystal waters and rolling hills. Facing Kawau Island and the beautiful islands of the Hauraki Gulf - 'NZ's finest recreational marine reserve' - our park is waiting here for you to discover. Get Directions Things to do / Local Area The local area offers a taste of everything from superb beaches and charming villages to exciting adventures and rich history. View All Activities Matakana Village Farmers Market From award-winning coffee, to mouth-watering brunch dishes, there’s plenty to sample and savour. Relax by the riverside to live local music, while the kids explore the rustic treehouse and natural playground. The Matakana Market is zero waste – so take your baskets or bags and stock up on fresh produce, flowers, breads, deli treats and sweets. Perfect for a gourmet picnic, a special celebration or just to bring back to the holiday park with friends. Sculptureum The Sculptureum Experience is made up of three sculpture gardens and six art galleries spanning over 1.5km of flat paths. There is also a vineyard, function centre and the aptly titled bar and restaurant, Rothko. Walking Tracks Walking tracks cover all kinds of terrain around the coastline, through native bush and forest, across farmland and along beaches. Our local Regional Parks – Scandrett, Tawharanui, and Mahurangi offer local walking trails. Wine Trails Follow the wine trail around Matakana Coast – our closest vineyard and restaurant is at Brick Bay. Carts For Hire Kayaks For Hire Reserve We stayed 7 days in the Dotterel Caravan and Awning - With our two grandsons aged 10 and 7 - The caravan was very retro and was well equipped for what we needed - to lie there at night and hear the waves so close, It was magic looking out of the window to see all along the beach. I had to pinch myself. The caravan was a little dated but who cares when you ore literally 10 steps to the safe swimming beach - The awning had two beds for the boys that were really comfortable, we set up a fold out table inside - the deck was well used good wooden picnic table - To sit outside as the sun went down was beautiful - we were also lucky to have beautiful weather - The staff are amazing and so helpful - the cook house and toilets were really nice and clean. So much to do lovely walks - the boys loved riding the 3 wheelers. We couldn't get the Dotterel for next year - But we are booked in the Kereru also right on the beach - Shopping centre was great at Snells Beach for the your supplies and The Warehouse - also some great bakeries. and Takeaways -only10mins drive - I hope we can make this an annual holiday - Will bring a small barbecue next time.. Paradise20315094838, TripAdvisor 2023 Fantastic family time. The camping sites were big and spacious. Great safe swimming beach for children and clean facilities. Great hospitality from the staff. We were camping off peak and asked if we wanted some more time to pack up. We will definitely go again. Meander44392695350, TripAdvisor 2025 Sign up for news and promotions Get inspired for your next escape - sign up now! name: motuekaindian.co.nz
homepage_content: Simply Indian, delicious Indian food in Motueka BOOKINGS & TAKEAWAYS: 03 528 6364 TAKEAWAY MENU ORDER ONLINE - CLICK & COLLECT Simply Indian Restaurant & Take-away, Motueka Motueka's Indian Restaurant NAMASTE! And welcome to Simply Indian Simply Indian has been serving fine Indian cuisine for over twenty years to Motueka's locals and many visitors. Mouth-watering authentic Indian dishes, prepared by trained and experienced Indian chefs, for you to relish and enjoy. Not forgetting an ice cold Kingfisher to get your meal off to a good start. Our bar has a good selection of wines and soft drinks too. So after a hard days work or a trip into the Abel Tasman come and see Sabin and all the staff - they look forward to welcoming you. Simply Indian, the original Motueka Indian restaurant We're now over 20 years old. "I started work here 10 years ago in front of house as duty manager, and commuted from Nelson every day. I loved coming to work in Motueka and chatting with all the regulars and tourist visitors from far and wide. One day the opportunity to buy the restaurant came up and I jumped at the idea. I liked Motueka, the restaurant and its beautiful clientele so much that I bought it. And so I became the very proud owner of Simply Indian. I had just started a family and we moved to Motueka straight-away to be closer to our new venture. Two of the chefs from those days are the main stay of our kitchen still, ensuring you receive consistent quality dining every time you visit us. You might find cheaper but I'm confident you won't find better quality and taste. Thanks to everyone who dines with us, you have kept us going through the ups and downs that life throws our way." Sabin Lunch: 11am-2pm (5 days, Mon-Sat, closed Tuesday lunchtime) Dinner: from 5pm till late (7 days) Fully licensed & BYO - corkage fee: - $10 Great choice of vegetarian and vegan dishes Banquets & parties, dinner for two, a group of friends or a Friday shout with your work mates. It's best at Simply Indian in Motueka. Dining in? We recommend booking to avoid disappointment. NO surcharge on public holidays. CCTV is used on our premises to keep our staff and customers safe. Find Us Phone: 03 528 6364 Website By WeDoWebsites

name: lavenderfarm.co.nz
homepage_content: Visit | Lavendyl Kaikoura Lavender Farm +64 3 319 5473 info@lavenderfarm.co.nz Lavendyl Kaikoura Lavender Farm The home of Myra’s world famous lavender based ice-cream A year round experienece like no other Lavendyl Lavender Farm Kaikoura Lavendyl Kaikoura Lavender Farm is situated just 7 km north of scenic Kaikoura on the South Island of New Zealand. The 2.5 hectares are home to lavender, ornamental gardens, farm animals, a tea room, and a shop. Onsite there is also Dylans Country Cottages , two rustic, self-contained cottages. Opening hours : 6th September – 30th November 10:00 – 16:00 1st December – 28th February 09:00 – 17:00 1st March – 3rd June 10:00 – 16:00 Fri-Wed 4th June – 23rd July 10:00 – 15:00 Fri-Wed Except: 24th December 09:00 – 14:00 25th December Closed 26th December 12:00 – 17:00 1st January 14:00 – 17:00 Relaxing Gardens Enjoy the tranquil setting when you spend a few hours with us. During spring and summer, the scent of lavender is everywhere while the sap rises and the flowers bloom. However, with over 50 different lavenders onsite, we always have lavender in bloom to see and smell. There is much more to the gardens than lavender. The Circle of Thyme is a popular spot to sit in tranquility or meditate; the flowering thyme is a sight to behold. With a wide variety of New Zealand natives and other plants in the gardens, there is plenty to see all year round. Have a picnic surrounded by the scent and colour of beautiful lavender and flower gardens. Enjoy the scenic views from Mt Fyffe to the Kaikoura Peninsula. Entry to the gardens currently costs $5 per person over 15, children free. The charge varies through the season. Refreshments While you are here, enjoy a cup of tea or coffee which you can take into the garden. Accompany it with something from our selection of lavender edibles. Need a more substantial meal? We can provide a picnic lunch for you to enjoy in the gardens or high tea, both of these need to be booked 24 hours in advance. Want a lighter meal? Then try a Devonshire cream tea. Early birds can enjoy a homemade continental breakfast. As we make our bread this must be booked the day before. Don’t miss our amazing selection of homemade lavender ice cream. We have a wide range of flavours of lavender ice cream and vary the selection on offer. With more flavours in the pipeline, not to mention our vegan sorbets, there is sure to be somethiung new to try. Shop The onsite gift shop has a wide variety of lavender products, crafts, and more. You don’t need to love lavender to find something appealing. We make our lavender products using lavender oil and flowers from lavender grown on the farm. During the summer harvest, visitors may be able to see the distillation process when we extract essential oil from the plant. We produce pure essential lavender oil, blends for massage, moisturisers, toiletries, therapeutic massage creams, room sprays, candles, and food products. View Product Range Craft Onsite, there is a small flock of sheep whose wool we like to spin, weave, knit, and felt to produce a range of goods. You will often find Myra demonstrating these crafts in the shop. We run crafting sessions to allow you to try these crafts yourself. Some, such as making a felted soap, can be run on-demand with little notice and are great fun for all ages. You need to book others in advance. We are stockists of Ashford products and use these in our craft sessions. A favourite activity is the silk and merino scarf class. More Info  268 Postmans Road, Kaikoura, Canterbury, NZ  info@lavenderfarm.co.nz  +64 3 319 5473 Unfortunately, the time we have available to answer emails is limited. We have provided as much information about the facilities at Lavendyl and your visit as possible on our website. Sadly we are unable to answer questions where the answer can be found on the website such as opening hours and prices. It is impossible for us to predict when our large beds of lavender will be in flower - it varies from year to year. For up-to-date information on the gardens please check our Facebook page. name: naumai.co.nz
homepage_content: Naumai Partners NZ Limited - Renewable Energy Investments Energy Boom âin New Zealand Unlock Higher Returns Explore Partnerships NZ Generates 80+% electricity from renewables - Target 100% by 2030. A New Zealand Welcome Tena ra koutou katoa Kei konei a Naumai, e tu I runga I te hakaaro kotahi, Ki te haapai I te taiao, te Iwi, me nga haapori. E mahi tahi matou mahi haumi waenga I nga mahi puungao koomaru mo nga Iwi o Aotearoa, Mai I te Kotahitanga Kia hakarite I nga hakaritenga hei hakarauora nga HÄpori. No reira nau mai, piki mai,haere mai ki tenei mahi kotahi I te mahi puungao koomaru mahi hiko. Mauri ora! â â ââ Greetings to you all. Naumai stands here with a shared vision - âTo uplift the environment, the people and the communities. â âWe work together, investing in solar energy projects for the people of Aotearoa. âUniting efforts to create opportunities that revitalise communities. âSo welcome, join us and be part of the collective journey. Mauri ora! (To life and wellbeing) â NZ's Energy Strategy Growing Demand In 2023, NZ's electricity generation was approximately 43,488 gigawatt-hours (GWh). By 2050, demand is projected to increase by up to 82%, reaching 71.7 terawatt-hours (TWh) Strong Government Backing Policies like the Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS) and renewable energy incentives encourage private investment in clean energy. A Free Market NZ has a deregulated electricity market, allowing consumers to switch power retailers freely, fostering innovation and new market entrants. Download NZ Energy Strategy PDF Why Invest in New Zealand? Safe Haven Discover a country with low crime rates and a stable political landscape, offering peace of mind for investors. Green Energy Leader Benefit from a commitment to sustainability and renewable resources, paving the way for a cleaner future. Free Market NZ market is decentralised, renewable-focused, free trading system, with greater market flexibility, strong policy support, and higher renewable energy returns. Solar Edge NZ has higher solar irradiance than countries such as Malaysia & Singapore. This drives greater yields, and higher returns. NZ Energy Market Insights Free market allows for localised energy prices, largely due to varying distribution costs to various parts and corners of NZ. nz commerce commission - mar 2025 Energy Prices Household electricity bills will increase in April 2025 by about $10 a month (excluding GST), on average. Increasing costs for material and labour, higher interest rates, and rising levels of investment in the electricity network combine to cause this increase. Investment in electricity assets is needed to ensure New Zealanders continue to receive a reliable, safe, and resilient electricity supply. source CONSUMER NZ - SEP 2021 Price Differential The areas with incomes lower than the average are paying higher prices than the average. Larger towns and cities generally pay the least. Coupled with price rises over the past 20 years, the high electricity prices in lower-income areas are contributing to New Zealand's increasing levels of energy hardship and inequality. Northland on average pays 36% higher for electricity than the national average. Auckland pays 5% less than the national average. source INTEREST.CO.NZ - AUG 2024 The Problem to Fix Prices look set to rise for retail users, because wholesale prices have increased. Prices over $1000/MWhr (megawatt hour) are becoming all-too frequent as the cold winter blast coincides with low lake levels and inflows, and low wind generation. Normal used to be <$100/MWhr. So NZ is running at least 10 times normal, maybe more. âImage: www.ea.govt.nz source Business Model Partner for Growth At Naumai Partners, we create impactful partnerships that drive renewable energy initiatives. Our commitment to innovation fosters sustainable growth for communities and investors alike. Play The Video! How We Work: Harnessing Opportunities Discover Unique Investment Avenues Dive into detailed insights about the renewable energy sector, and identify strategic investment possibilities that align with your goals. Forging Strategic & Sustainable Partnerships Collaborate with locals and MÄori landowners to initiate projects that bring sustainable energy solutions to communities while enhancing mutual benefits. Innovative Energy Solutions Explore energy generation strategies, including solar initiatives that contribute to sustainable growth and energy independence for communities. Engaging Community Insight Share in the local knowledge surrounding energy initiatives and receive feedback that empowers sustainable community development. Collaborative Growth Collaborative growth is the key to unlocking the full potential of New Zealand's renewable energy sector. Fostering strategic partnerships between investors, industry leaders, local communities, and government bodies drive projects to scale efficiently while ensuring long-term success, ensuring that every venture is both profitable and impactful. Community Engagement Empowering local stakeholders through collaborative approaches and shared economic and tino rangatiratanga goals. â Strong community engagement is the foundation of successful renewable energy investments in New Zealand underpinned by genuine partnerships with local communities and MÄori. Investor-Friendly Environment New Zealand has ambitious net-zero targets and presents significant opportunities for investors seeking long-term, stable returns . Policies that promote ease of entry, transparent market mechanisms, and strong public-private partnerships provide for scalable and profitable renewable energy investments . About Us At Naumai Partners, we are committed to empowering sustainable energy initiatives that benefit communities across New Zealand. Our mission is to create meaningful partnerships that bridge investment opportunities with transformative renewable energy projects. With a focus on solar energy and community-driven development, we strive to harness the power of collaboration, bringing together expertise and investments from Malaysia and Singapore, to local opportunities in New Zealand. We are dedicated to ensuring that every project not only meets financial goals but also uplifts the local community and respects the cultural heritage of communities and MÄori. With us, you are joining a movement towards a greener future where energy solutions are not just profitable but also sustainable. Our commitment to transparency and excellence ensures that every partnership thrives in a supportive future-focused environment dedicated to growth and progress, sustainably. Contact Us We Would Love to Connect Our Location Auckland, New Zealand Reach Out Via Email kiaora@naumai.co.nz Give Us a Call +64 21 94 96 93 Your First Name Your Surname Your Email Address Your Contact Number Your Inquiry Submit Your Inquiry

homepage_content: New Zealand's Most Loved Beach - Ohope Beach TOP 10 Soak up the sun, sand and surf at Ōhope Beach TOP 10 Escape the fast pace of everyday life and create memories that last a lifetime at our award-winning Ōhope holiday park. View all accomodation types Book a room Arrive Depart Code See availability Your browser does not support the video tag. Haere mai, welcome to Ōhope Beach TOP 10 Holiday Park Boasting 11 kilometres of golden sand beaches, Ōhope Beach has long been a favourite spot for locals and holidaymakers alike. Voted New Zealand’s most-loved beach and ranked among the top 10 beaches in the South Pacific, it’s the ultimate destination for a coastal getaway. Locally owned, operated and family-run, the Ōhope Beach TOP 10 Holiday Park is a local treasure. Check out our accommodation Superior Ocean View 2 Bedroom Villa 2 bedrooms 1-8 People 1 Bathroom Perfect for beach-loving families and groups, this villa sleeps up to eight and is steps from the sand. MORE INFO BOOK NOW Superior Ocean View 1 Bedroom Villa 1 bedroom 1-6 People 1 Bathroom With a private bathroom and all the essentials, this is your relaxing base just meters from the sand. MORE INFO BOOK NOW Superior Ocean View Studio 1 bedroom 2 People 1 Bathroom Elevated above the beach, this beautifully appointed studio is perfect for couples. MORE INFO BOOK NOW Deluxe Ocean View 2 Bedroom Villa 2 bedroom 1-5 People 1 Bathroom This spacious two-bedroom villa offers spectacular ocean views and your own private spa pool. MORE INFO BOOK NOW Economy Unit - No Ensuite 1 Bedroom 1-3 People Shared bathroom Offering simple beachside comfort, this compact unit is great for couples or a small family of three. MORE INFO BOOK NOW Deluxe Ocean View Safari Tent - No Ensuite 2 Bedrooms 1-4 People Shared bathroom Experience glamping at its best in this furnished safari tent with panoramic views of Ōhope Beach. MORE INFO BOOK NOW Standard 2 Bedroom Tent - No Ensuite 2 Bedrooms 1-4 People Shared bathroom A unique blend of comfort and adventure, this two-bedroom canvas tent sleeps up to four guests. MORE INFO BOOK NOW Grass Powered Sites 300 Powered sites Shared Bathroom Steps from the beach, these powered grass sites offer a flat, open area for caravans, motorhomes, or tents. MORE INFO BOOK NOW Grass Unpowered Sites 120 Non-powered sites Shared Bathroom Ideal for traditional camping, these unpowered grassy sites offer space and freedom with a coastal vibe. name: owakalodgemotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Owaka Lodge Motel - Owaka, The Catlins, New Zealand CHECK AVAILABILITY FIND THE BEST RATE WELCOME TO OWAKA LODGE MOTEL Catlins Accommodation Offering affordable accommodation in the heart of The Catlins, Owaka Lodge Motel is the perfect base for your New Zealand nature experience The Catlins have so much to offer you – many beautiful beaches, bushwalks, waterfalls, including the beautiful Purukaunui Falls and McLean Falls, the Cathedral Caves, and the remains of a fascinating petrified forest. The area abounds in native birds including rare Hoiho Penguins, as well as Hooker's Sea Lions, seals and native flora – the entire district is a photographer's dream! Our motel has four modern units which sleep one to six, equipped with single to king-size beds. You can choose from Family units with separate sleeping, kitchen and bathroom, or Studio units with en suite. The kitchens have microwaves. All our units have cooking units, Freeview TV, electric blankets, and heating. We provide you with complimentary tea/coffee and milk, and continental breakfast is available on request. A laundry service is available on request. We have wireless internet onsite. Shops and restaurants are within easy walking distance. Rooms You'll love our clean, bright modern units, and our relaxed country setting. Family Unit Queen Motel King Studio Twin Studio The Catlins Your hosts, Gaynor and Derrel, welcome you to The Catlins! Off the beaten track on the unspoilt, rugged Southern coast of New Zealand winding between Fortrose and Kaka Point, you will travel through our beloved farmland, forest and seascape.Visit Nugget Point Lighthouse and the beautiful golden sandy beaches of Cannibal Bay and Surat Bay to see the Hooker's sea lions, NZ fur seals, and elephant seals, and Yellow-Eyed Penguins (Hoiho) in their natural habitat. name: omakaheights.co.nz
homepage_content: Welcome to Omaka Heights B&B Countrystay Air conditioning Heated TV Fridge 199 Brookby Rd, Blenheim 7272, New Zealand Phone:+64 3-572 7402 Email: booking@omakaheights.co.nz Welcome to Omaka Heights Positioned in the picturesque Omaka Valley, just 12km from Blenheim, our hilltop Countrystay offers out-standing panoramic views over vineyards and farmland through to the Richmond Ranges in the distance. We are within a few minutes drive of over 30 wineries. There are numerous restaurants and cafes located within Blenheim town and the surrounding vineyard area. Our self-contained Countrystay wing offers two guest rooms, each with private ensuite facilities and private decks, plus a guest lounge. The twin room/ensuite is completely wheelchair accessible. The lounge provides tea/coffee making facilities, refrigerator and television. The bedrooms are equipped with hairdryer, electric blankets and free WIFI. Guests are offered a self service continental breakfast. Enjoy a stroll around our eight hectare property. It can be an ideal rural retreat, offering a great blend of natural beauty, lush-green landscapes, and modern-age amenities. At Omaka Heights, we are committed to offering great features to promote tranquility and serenity for our prestigious guests. Our main objective is to let our guests make the most of their stay and enjoy quality time with their family, friends and loved ones. We have a range of accommodation options, including luxurious rooms and comfortable cottages. Our space is fully-equipped with new-age amenities. We have open floor plans with ample space to let you relax and unwind like never before. A fireplace is the icing on the top as it adds cosy ambience, perfect for chilly nights. Feel free to contact us and book your stay today! Indulge in savoury local cuisine, farm-to-table dining and authentic dishes in our rustic restaurants. Apart from this, you can explore a range of outdoor activities, such as hiking trails, fishing, trekking, orchard picking and much more. Our Partners © 2025 Omaka Heights. All Right Reserved.

name: peachshotchicken.com
homepage_content: Peach's Hot Chicken PEACH’S HOT CHICKEN OnLine ORDERING Peach's Hot Chicken Online Order Our Story Nashville Hot Chicken is fried chicken tossed in spice, traditionally served on white bread with pickles. The style was born in Nashville, Tennessee, in the 1970s and remains a much- loved staple across the United States. At Peach’s, we faithfully recreate this iconic Nashville dish with the highest quality ingredients, authentic flavour, and a recipe that comes straight from the source. Alex and Olivia George started Peach’s in a little food truck in late 2017, bringing a generations-old Nashville hot chicken method from Alex’s grandmother. With years of experience in high-end restaurants and hotels, they wanted to create a place that reflected how they like to dine out. To sum it up, they wanted to serve delicious comfort food in a casual, fun, atmosphere with great service. In 2019, team Peach decided to bring the love to their home suburb of Panmure with a brick-and-mortar shop. Alex and Olivia were overwhelmed with the amazing support of our community and the city of Auckland. After three years in their original premise, they decided team Peach was gonna need a bigger shop and moved just down the road, where we’re still serving today. From the start, Peach’s has been about doing things right. All our chicken is free range, antibiotic-free, butchered daily by our talented team, and prepared fresh to order. Once you pick your spice level, you can have it served on classic white bread with pickles, in a soft toasted bun as a burger, atop fluffy Belgian waffles or even in a house-made biscuit. It’s Nashville hot chicken done right. Thank y'all so much for being a huge part of this journey! Reservations Plan your visit to Peach’s Hot Chicken for a flavour-packed dining experience. Whether it’s lunch, dinner, or a special celebration, securing your table is quick and easy with our reservation system. Simply fill out the form below to book your spot. We only accept reservations for groups of 5 to 20 people . For parties of fewer than Five, we are happy to welcome you as walk-ins only , and please note that we will not honor any reservation requests for less than 5 people. For bookings more than 20 please email hello@peachshotchicken.com and we will try and accommodate your request. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to serving you! Contact Us Check out our new FAQs section at the top of the page! EMAIL: hello@peachshotchicken.com ADDRESS: 2 Queens Road Panmure Auckland 1072 OPENING HOURS: Mondays and Tuesdays: CLOSED Wednesday - Thursday: 11:30am-9:00pm Friday: 11:30am - 10:00pm Saturday: 11:00am - 10:00pm Sunday: 11:00am - 9:00pm Public Holidays - Check our Instagram posts & Google for Holiday Hours! FOOD GRADE: A https://www.aucklandcouncil.govt.nz/licences-regulations/business-licences/food-businesses-quality-grading/Pages/find-food-grade-restaurant-cafe.aspx To answer all the most common questions: Yes our chicken is halal - we use Brinks and they are halal certified. We do offer some items on the menu that are not considered halal. Please ask us in store if you have any concerns. RESERVATIONS. We take bookings for 5 people or more. Please click the Reservations page. Online orders are takeaway only. If you have ordered takeaways online or in store please do not ask to dine in with it. We are on DoorDash!!! We would love to cater for your event. Please visit the catering page above. DO NOT USE THIS FORM TO ORDER FOOD. GO TO THE ‘ORDER ONLINE’ TAB Please read all the information we have provided before sending us a question. Alternatively we have more questions answered in our FAQ section that you can visit if you scroll back up the page. Thank you!

name: pixiebowls.co.nz
homepage_content: Pixie Bowls Cart 0 Sign In My Account Scroll LOCATION 10 Napier Road, Havelock North HOURS Weekdays | 7.30am – 2.00pm Weekends | 8.00am – 2.00pm CONTACT info@pixiebowls.co.nz _ “EAT FOOD. NOT TOO MUCH. MOSTLY PLANTS” — MICHAEL POLLAN Started in 2018, Pixie is a smoothie bowl, smoothie, toast & espresso bar located in Havelock North, Hawke’s Bay. Our mission is to provide a fresh, fruity, fun & friendly product and experience, with a focus on plant-based and nutrient-dense foods for everyone to enjoy, regardless of diet. We believe ‘you are what you eat’, and our menu packs in about as much natural goodness as possible to fuel healthy minds, bodies and souls. Our relationships with local growers, producers and suppliers ensure that we get the freshest goods from people who care about quality as much as we do. Summer Menu LET’S CONNECT We’re still working on our TikTok presence, but in the meantime please give us a follow on instagram & facebook for fun, fruity facts, obscure observations, and the occasional important update. Instagram Facebook

name: pukematulodge.co.nz
homepage_content: Welcome Â Â Â Welcome to Pukematu Lodge Â He mihinui ki nga iwi katoa o nga hau e wha A prestigious greeting to all people from the four corners of the world Pukematu Lodge (a hill of hospitality) is located at the top of Flagstaff Road Hill opposite the historic and famous flag pole of Hone Heke and Kawiti. Nestled high amongst a native bush setting, panoramic sea views can be experienced in all directions. Owned and operated by local descendants of this special area this accommodation setting will provide you with an imaginative and wholesome experience during your stay in romantic Russell and the Bay of Islands in New Zealand. Nau mai haere mai ki Pukematu, he kainga i roto i nga kapua: Welcome and join us on a journey of peace, privacy and pampering at Pukematu a home within the clouds Please send mail to pukematu@hotmail.com for any questions or queries. name: platinumqueenstown.co.nz
homepage_content: Luxury accommodation Queenstown Platinum Villas Nearby bike & walking trail access. Water, mountain & forest views that surround and inspire. 500m to the lakes edge and 1.5km to town centre Perfectly placed 36 Villas. Practical, affordable luxury in central Queenstown, New Zealand. 36 Villas. Practical, affordable luxury in central Queenstown, New Zealand. Luxury accommodation Queenstown Thoughtfully designed holiday living with alpine charm, just minutes’ walk to the lakes edge & town. Our centrally located accommodation combine luxury, convenience, and practicality with an elevated position near the CBD, immersing you in an alpine setting rarely found so close to the action. Perfect for families or groups, we offer open grounds for kids to explore and serene spaces for adults to relax and enjoy stunning lake and mountain Queenstown views. Pick your perspective Alpine forest or lake views? Either outlook offers a picturesque setting to enjoy. Lake view villas Lake view villas 3 Bedroom + Living + Garage 2 Bedroom option in off-season Amazing unobstructed views across Lake Wakatipu and the Remarkables Mountain Range in our lake view villas. Explore villa Book Direct From NZD$765/night Alpine view villas Alpine view villas 3 Bedroom + Living + Garage 2 Bedroom option in off-season Experience a serene ambiance with picturesque forest and mountain vistas. A great value option. Explore villa Book Direct From NZD$655/night Book direct to receive: Best price guaranteed $50 Prezzy Card on arrival Free drink at local restaurant Return Guest Discount Continue & Book Direct Close X Book direct to receive: Best price guaranteed $50 Prezzy Card on arrival Free drink at local restaurant Return Guest Discount Continue & Book Direct Close X Practical luxury right here All the indulgence, all within the setting. Ski hire service to your villa Enjoy the convenience of having your ski and snowboard gear delivered directly to your Platinum villa, where it will be expertly fitted as you relax fireside with a wine or coffee. In-villa ski storage rack & boot dryer New ski storage racks and boot dryers will be installed in every villa garage, ready for guests during the 2025 winter snow season - another touch of practical luxury. Bike Wash/Repair Station Store your bike securely in your villa's private garage and keep it trail-ready with our Mountain Bike Repair and Wash Station, perfect for pre or post-ride care. Call in the Masseuse Stay in the comfort of your villa and let relaxation come to you. Our mobile massage experts bring everything needed for a rejuvenating spa experience, leaving you relaxed and restored. Private Chef to your villa table With Chef Fabien Simon, enjoy seasonal produce in a relaxed family meal or more elegant dinner. Dietary needs, shopping, cooking, serving, and cleaning is all taken care of. Named one of the best courts in the world Just steps from your villa, our perfectly positioned tennis court offers spectacular views - and the perfect reason to unplug and get outside. Plus all the essential complements... Grocery Delivery Family Entertainment Baby Equipment Private BBQ Hire Unlimited free WIFI House keeping Serviced or self-serviced Platinum Villas Queenstown Address: 96 Fernhill Road, Queenstown New Zealand (View on map) Reception Hrs: 8:30am to 6:30pm Freephone: 0800 422 442 (NZ only) Tel: +64 3 746 7700 Email: reservations@platinumqueenstown.co.nz Book Direct Close X “Incredible, fantastic, beautiful” “Incredible view, fantastic service, beautifully appointed. The villa gave us lots of space to not feel on top of one another, yet it was so cozy and warm with the fireplace and heaters - perfect to come back to after a long day of skiing or adventure.” Villa guest: Amanda B. Verified review via Tripadvisor Platinum deals & news Add me You must enable JavaScript to submit this form

name: pocketbarandkitchen.co.nz
homepage_content: Pocket Bar and Kitchen Auckland | Venue Hire and Garden Bar top of page Book our Event Space about US Tucked in a corner of Grey Lynn behind the old ASB Bank, Pocket is a blend of natural good times and hand crafted comfort. ​ Sun-drenched by day and luminous at night; our gabled greenhouse, deck and converted bar join forces to provide a great space for catching up with friends for a bite and a chat, making a night of it and everything in-between. We love our little piece of Auckland hospitality and can’t wait to show you why. ​ bottom of page

name: ramenria.co.nz
homepage_content: Japanese Ramen Bar | Ramen Ria | New Zealand top of page ABOUT US Ramen Ria is an absolute stalwart of the ramen scene in Christchurch, serving up soul warming bowls of ramen as well as other popular Japanese street eats - Edamame, Takoyaki, Karrage Chicken and Donburi. We take great pride in crafting authentic, tasty dishes using locally sourced fresh ingredients, noodles are made fresh on the daily, while bone broths are brewed for 8+ hours to give them a rich flavour. On top of that, the upstair bar provides you heaps of options of Japanese beer, soju and cocktails. Cool vibes only. READ MORE loading, walk in also welcome anytime :) WHAT PEOPLE SAY ABOUT US "No exaggeration - best ramen I have ever had. Ask about the $20 special, ramen & a side of fried chicken. Highly recommend the pork trio ramen! Staff are super friendly and the wait time is minimal (15 mins for us). I would post a photo of the food as soon as it came out but I was so hungry that I forgot to take one! Here's a photo of a half finished ramen, but trust me when I say that it's fantastic." Matt from Google Review Inquire private function & venue hire here Book bottom of page

name: saltandseed.co.nz
homepage_content: Home | Salt & Seed Private Dining and Catering top of page Our Services Private Events Wedding Catering Drink & Bar Service About Salt & Seed Salt and Seed provides clients with tailor-made seasonally-inspired menus that showcase the fantastic produce we have in New Zealand. Professional chefs, Chris and Natacha, are passionate about delivering a complete and consistent service tailored to your individual requirements. "Our mission is to utilise our experience and offer a range of bespoke packages and services to our guests - we bring the restaurant to you. ​ Over the last 10+ years, we have dedicated ourselves to a cooking career, with several of these years spent working in a 2 & 3 Michelin-starred restaurant in the U.K. We now look forward to showcasing our own style of food and service, highlighting the finest quality producers and artisans that the Bay of Islands & Northland has to offer!" - Chris & Natacha About "Absolutely amazing experience. I used them for my 40th Birthday Dinner with a group of friends. They took care of everything and were an absolute delight to deal with. They literally turn up and in the blink of an eye you're enjoying the most amazing meal, and then they quietly tidy everything away and head off. It meant I was able to relax and really enjoy the evening. I highly recommend them and I'd use them again." Toni Cooper At Your Service Email: info@saltandseed.co.nz Tell us a little about your event so we can begin the creation process Name Email Message Submit Thanks for submitting! Contact bottom of page

name: sundownermotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Sundowner Motel | Official Site | Blenheim Accommodation NZ Email: info@sundownermotel.co.nz | Phone: +64 3 578 2055 Check Availability / Book Online Sundowner Motel Sundowner Motel in Blenheim, Marlborough, NZ, is rated 4 Star and is an ideal motel complex for business and pleasure. Sundowner Motel offer you quality, well-appointed self-contained, spacious, ground floor units with parking directly outside the door. The Sundowner Motel is renowned for its quietness and the convenience of Springlands Shopping Complex directly opposite. We provide our business guests with competitive rates and chargeback facilities. With the Wine District on our doorstep, the beautiful Marlborough Sounds to the North, and Kaikoura and Nelson within easy reach, the Sundowner Motel is ideally placed for you to enjoy all aspects of the Marlborough Region. Blenheim Motel Accommodation Sundowner Motel has ground-floor studios and suites, each offering a well-equipped kitchen area, flat-screen TV and DVD player. All units have digital satellite TV with 50+ channels. View our room types Blenheim New Zealand The Marlborough Region has a wide range of leisure activities to enjoy. Things to do Motel Location Location Map and Directions for Sundowner Motel Blenheim Contact us BLENHEIM WEATHER Sundowner Motel NZ Freephone: 0800 82 81 80 Email: info@sundownermotel.co.nz Address: 132 Middle Renwick Road, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand © 2025 - Sitemap - Admin Login - Website by GuestTraction

name: sisterfields.co.nz
homepage_content: Cafe | Sisterfields | Hamilton top of page MENU Back2Top To Top FRESH INGREDIENTS. DELICIOUS FOOD. STUNNING VENUE. Designed to be a space of taste, Sisterfields takes pride in the simple elegance of exquisite food. Our bright and open venue is the perfect central spot for a cafe breakfast, lunch, or coffee during the day or a delicious dinner and wine by night. The menu showcases well-sourced New Zealand produce, including some kiwi favourites that are a little bit exciting. Experience Sisterfields flavour and flair. Whether you're in for a quiet dinner for two or celebrating a special day, we look forward to hosting you. ​ - Sisterfields ​ About Bookings Book A Table BOOK NOW Business Hours Open Daily 7am - 9pm buffet breakfast 7am - 10am 7 days Contact Get in Touch We'd love to hear from you +64 7 949 7746 info@sisterfields.co.nz Find us on Facebook 3 cups Blueberries A message from our Head Chef On Behalf of the Kitchen Staff, Welcome to Sisterfields. We work hard to source the freshest ingredients prepared with the love of people that are passionate about food. Our menu has been developed with keeping it simple, fresh and packed with flavour in mind. We trust you enjoy our food as much as we enjoy preparing it for you. Any special dietary needs please just let us know. Bon Appetite! Alper Huseyin Head Chef bottom of page

name: superbowlsouth.co.nz
homepage_content: Home - Retrobowl Invercargill, New Zealand’s Southernmost ten pin bowling Skip to content (03) 214 4944 Book Online Fun for Everyone Bowling Arcades Karaoke Functions Some of the fun you can have at Retrobowl Bowling 8 lanes now all with automatic bumpers, new scoring system, touch screen consoles & so much more! Book Online Arcade With 37 arcades to choose from you’ll have hours of endless fun. Just load up your came card with credit and tap to play. Win points, then redeem them for prizes Find out more! Karaoke With 100,000 plus songs and state of the art audio equipment set in a retro styled room, this space is so much fun! Find out More Cafe & Bar We have a fully licensed bar on site and our cafe has a whole new menu with delicious burgers designed by famous local chef Ethan Flack. Download Menu Functions & Events Whether you’re planning a work function or a 40th birthday, we’ve got the fun sorted. We have a fully licensed bar and can cater the food you desire. Find out more! Kids Parties We have the perfect space for your child’s birthday party upstairs. Hire the room only or have the party fully catered for with decorations, cake and food. You choose. Find out more! 2024 | Retrobowl Open Hours Hours: Mondays 12pm-9pm Tuesdays 12pm-9pm Wednesdays 12pm-9pm Thursdays 12pm-9pm Fridays 12pm-10pm Saturdays 10am-10pm Sundays 10am-8pm We recommend making a reservation, as we do get fully booked at times. Hours are based on demand and may change without notice. homepage_content: HOME | tawavillagebakery top of page PASTRY LOVE WELCOME Here at Tawa Village Bakery & Cafe, baking is our passion. homepage_content: Savoire Cafe and Wine Bar Home About Us Menu Gallery Contact Us Our Specials Reservation Savoire Cafe and Wine Bar Located in the buzz of Merivale Mall. It’s the perfect place to enjoy a wine and antipasto platter, relax with a Burton’s coffee in the outdoor courtyard, or celebrate your next occasion with friends. Our Story Savoire Style Savoire Cafe and Wine Bar is located in the buzz of Merivale Mall. It’s the perfect place to enjoy a wine and antipasto platter, relax with a Burton’s coffee in the outdoor courtyard, or celebrate your next occasion with friends. Vibrant Location Wine & Antipasto Coffee & Relaxation Celebration Spot Learn More This Week Specials Menu Citrus Cured Salmon​ With Honey Salmon / Citrus / Honey / Spice $20 Pork Tenderloin In Yogurt Pork / Tenderloin / Yogurt $25 Grilled Pork With Lemons Pork / Lemon / Onions $27 Roasted Prawns with Coriander Prawn / Coriander / Spices $18 Prawn Sausage Cassaoulet Prawn / Sausage / Tomato $19 Best Quality Foods Coffee “Underground Coffee – Christchurch’s Hidden Gem” Brewed in the heart of Christchurch, Underground Coffee is all about bold flavour, local passion, and expertly roasted beans. From ethically sourced origins to perfectly crafted cups, we serve coffee that’s as vibrant and unique as our city. Whether you’re grabbing a quick takeaway or settling in for a rich espresso experience, we keep it fresh, smooth, and unforgettable. Experience elegance at its finest Reserve Now. High Tea Indulge in the ultimate high tea experience with a contemporary twist. Perfect for special occasions or a catch up with friends, our High Tea features an extravagance of sweet delights and savoury bites, paired with your choice of tea,local coffee, french sparkling or Moët. We currently have an Exclusive High Tea Service at Savoire of Merivale Experience elegance at its finest Reserve Now. Robin Kokoi The food was great as well as the service. I just find the place too busy which is probably because of it’s goid reputation. Extra points to the staff! Very nice and friendly. Nikki “Nikki C” Crawford Thanks for the Top service very on to it and friendly. Chill atmosphere. Fast food service . Amazing tasty food highly recommended so filling. Omelette, Big breakfast . First table for the win Meet Shah Great spot with a chill and cozy vibe. The coffee was spot on and the food was fresh and full of flavor. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and the service felt really genuine. Perfect place to catch up with friends or just relax for a bit. Will definitely be coming back! name: theriverbanklane.co.nz
homepage_content: The Riverbank Lane SCROLL DOWN Located in the heart of Hamilton, The Riverbank Lane is a bustling community that is home to some of Hamilton’s finest retail stores, cafes and eateries. Places & Spaces Places & Spaces CAFE KOPI Espresso and Eats An elegant espresso bar, serving Hamilton's finest Rocket Coffee and featuring a selection of locally made eats. Browsers Quality Secondhand Bookshop A secondhand bookstore with a cosy, book-loving atmosphere where you'll find an exciting range of fiction and non-fiction, from the recent to the rare. MR. PICKLES Bar and Eatery A casual bar and eatery located at the end of The Riverbank Lane. Local, fresh and fun without a focus on any single cuisine. Mr. Pickles and the team can't wait to meet you. FABRIK Hair Salon Offering the very best service with award winning cutting and colouring techniques, Fabrik brings the latest thinking in hair design and style with passion. RÜDI’S Bakehouse Artisan Bakery Sourdough, pastries and coffee. All of Rüdi's products are handcrafted in small batches and baked fresh each day with a limited selection of sourdough bread and pastry items available. Banh mi Caphe Vietnamese Eatery A vibrant bar and restaurant, Banh Mi Caphe delivers authentic Vietnamese flavours without having to fly half way around the world. Set in a fitout celebrating its Vietnamese and French roots, this eatery is the perfect lunch, dinner or bar experience. LAREE PAYNE GALLERY Art Gallery The only dealer gallery in the Waikato Region. The Gallery focuses on presenting the work of leading contemporary artists whose work is fresh, engaging and relevant. Sip and Sew Sewing Workshops Offering sewing workshops and courses in a vibrant atmosphere where you can sip on tea or coffee, while learning timeless techniques to sew your own project. Hema Barbershop Men’s Hair Salon Experience precision cuts and personalized grooming at Hema Barbershop, where style meets tradition. Contact Contact Join Us - If you're interested in a space in The Riverbank Lane, we’d love to hear from you. Email: info@starkproperty.co.nz

name: thebackyardbar.co.nz
homepage_content: Bar and Eatery | The Backyard Bar and Eatery | Whatawhata top of page Serving Whatawhata Since 1866 Great Food · Great Atmosphere 1/15 Our Whanau vibes Our whole community here in Whatawhata feels like a big whanau and we pride ourselves in hiring staff that encompass our values and bring their own good energy to add to our work family. Garden Bar We have one of the last garden bars of this size in the Waikato. Come and enjoy your drink or your meal outside. Live Music The Backyard Gastro Pub regularly host a variety of live music acts on the outdoor stage.
