Purchase a gift card now and share the enchantment. Buy a Gift Card THE ENCHANTED RETREAT IS PART OF THE WOW Stays Portfolio Properties within the WOW Stays Portfolio undergo rigorous independent evaluations to ensure they epitomize the pinnacle of comfort, amenities, cleanliness, management, and distinctive charm. Have a Question? We’re Here to Help Get In Touch LOCAL Information Location & Nearby Attractions Havelock North, a charming village nestled in the heart of New Zealand’s stunning Hawkes Bay region, offers visitors a delightful blend of natural beauty, rich history, and vibrant culture. Known as the “Jewel of the Bay,” this picturesque destination is surrounded by the lush Te Mata Peak and verdant vineyards, providing an idyllic backdrop for both relaxation and adventure. Restaurants Embark on a delectable culinary journey in Havelock North, where a diverse selection of restaurants awaits your palate. From charming bistros to sophisticated dining establishments, each restaurant offers a unique and unforgettable experience. Indulge in a medley of flavors, from wood-fired pizzas and classic pasta dishes to modern Japanese cuisine and Mexican-inspired delights. Whether you’re seeking panoramic views or cozy ambiance, the restaurants in Havelock North cater to all preferences. With a focus on utilizing fresh, local ingredients and delivering exceptional service, these eateries promise to delight your senses and leave you with a lasting taste of this charming town’s culinary scene Café Experience the vibrant cafe culture of the village, where a delightful array of options awaits your taste buds. Whether you’re craving a cozy spot for a morning coffee or a place to unwind with friends over lunch, the cafes in Havelock North have you covered. From artisanal pastries and freshly brewed beverages to hearty breakfasts and light lunches, these cafes offer a range of delectable choices. Some cafes even boast picturesque outdoor seating, allowing you to soak in the charming surroundings. With a focus on quality ingredients and welcoming atmospheres, Havelock North’s cafes invite you to savor the flavors and enjoy the local ambiance. Local Village At the heart of Havelock North lies its vibrant village center, where you’ll find an array of boutique shops, art galleries, and cafés, all exuding a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The village’s rich architectural heritage, influenced by early English and Spanish Mission styles, contributes to its enchanting character and distinct charm. Strolling through its tree-lined streets, you’ll discover a community that embraces its history while looking towards a sustainable and prosperous future. Adventure Fly Fishing: Experience the thrill of fly fishing in Hawke’s Bay, where you can enjoy a diverse range of opportunities. Whether you’re interested in headwater fishing or easily accessible lowland angling, our knowledgeable guides can assist you in planning the perfect fishing excursion. Golf: Tee off at world-class golf courses in Hawke’s Bay. Cape Kidnappers Golf Course, ranked #17 in the world by Golf Digest, offers a truly remarkable golfing experience. Additionally, the Hastings Golf Club provides a beautiful championship course, perfect for golf enthusiasts. Bike Trails: Discover the beauty of Hawke’s Bay on two wheels. With over 180 kilometers of on-road and off-road trails, you can embark on a cycling journey along the stunning coastline. Marvel at the rugged mountainous landscapes and picturesque lowland rivers as you pedal through this cyclist’s paradise. We can arrange bike and e-bike hire to be conveniently delivered to the retreat, ensuring a seamless and hassle-free cycling experience for you. Helicopter Sight-Seeing: Take your exploration to new heights with a bespoke helicopter tour of the Hawke’s Bay region. Choose from a variety of tour options, including wineries, coastlines and wilderness. Let the breathtaking views leave you spellbound. Outfoxed: For exciting outdoor adventures, visit Outfoxed, where you can enjoy clay bird shooting, paintballing, golf driving, archery, crossbow, and more. Experience the thrill of adrenaline-pumping activities in a stunning natural setting. White Water Rafting: Embark on a thrilling white water rafting adventure on the Mohaka River. Mohaka Rafting offers a range of trips, from scenic grade 2 rafting to exhilarating grade 4/5 rafting, allowing you to experience the beauty and excitement of this stunning river gorge. Clay Target Shooting: Experience the thrill of clay target shooting during your stay at The Enchanted Retreat. Led by our expert partners, we provide a safe and picturesque setting near Havelock North. Whether you’re a beginner or seasoned shooter, they offer top-quality equipment and guidance for a memorable day out. Contact us to book this exhilarating experience and create unforgettable memories. Please contact us if you would like us to arrange this during your stay. Galleries & Markets Birdwood’s Gallery: A delightful gallery, sculpture garden, cafe, and traditional sweet shop, Birdwood’s Gallery is a must-see for all visitors and locals. Located at 298 Middle Road, Havelock North, it offers a unique and enchanting experience. Hastings City Art Gallery: Immerse yourself in contemporary art and design at Hastings City Art Gallery. With exhibitions featuring national and international artists, this gallery showcases a diverse range of artistic perspectives. You can find it at 201 Eastbourne Street East, Hastings. David Trubridge Design: Step into the world of renowned furniture designer David Trubridge and his team at the corner of Station Road and Groome Place, Whakatu, Hastings. Explore their design range, meet the team, and witness the fabrication of the latest works. Tennyson Gallery: Promoting New Zealand fine art and jewelry design, Tennyson Gallery upholds a long-standing tradition. Visit the gallery located at the corner of Tennyson and Hastings Streets in Napier to discover a wide range of artistic expressions. MTG Hawke’s Bay: Experience an award-winning museum housing a nationally significant collection of art and objects at 1 Tennyson Street, Napier. MTG Hawke’s Bay offers distinctive exhibitions and serves as a world-class research facility. Paperworks: Delve into the captivating world of works on paper by established and up-and-coming New Zealand artists at Paperworks. The gallery, located at 268 Clifton Road, Te Awanga, features a diverse range of artistic creations that will leave you inspired. SPA_ce: Explore the collection of work from artist Martin Poppelwell and guest artists at SPA_ce. With a practice spanning painting, drawing, pottery, and sculpture, Martin’s artistry is on display at 3 Market Street, Napier. Experience the unique blend of creativity and collaborations in carpet and furniture. Hawke’s Bay Farmers’ Market: Visit the Hawke’s Bay A&P Showgrounds every Sunday morning, where local artisans showcase their finest culinary creations. Sample delectable food, enjoy a freshly brewed coffee or a refreshing juice, and immerse yourself in the vibrant ambiance. It’s the perfect place to stock up on fresh, high-quality produce. Location: Kenilworth Road, HastingsOperating hours: Every Sunday, year-round, from 8:30 am to 12:30 pm Website:www.hawkesbayfarmersmarket.co.nz Biking & Hiking Havelock North Trails Te Mata Peak: Rising 399 meters above sea level, Te Mata Peak is an iconic landmark offering panoramic views of the entire Hawke’s Bay region. Multiple trails wind their way up the peak, catering to various fitness levels. The Giant Circuit Loop is a popular choice, providing a moderate challenge and rewarding hikers with vistas that extend from the Pacific Ocean to the distant mountains. Tainui Reserve: This serene reserve in Havelock North offers a network of well-maintained trails suitable for both walking and mountain biking. The Tainui Loop Track leads through native bush, revealing hidden streams and peaceful picnic spots along the way. Napier Trails Ahuriri Estuary Walkway: Explore the vibrant marine life and bird species that inhabit the Ahuriri Estuary. This flat and family-friendly walkway is ideal for a leisurely stroll or a relaxing bike ride. The trail winds through wetlands, salt marshes, and boardwalks, providing an opportunity to observe the area’s rich biodiversity. Eskdale Mountain Bike Park: For avid mountain bikers, the Eskdale Mountain Bike Park offers a range of trails suited to different skill levels. From gentle beginner tracks to adrenaline-pumping downhill runs, this park caters to every type of rider. The lush forest surroundings and stunning views make the experience even more rewarding. Wider Hawke’s Bay Area Trails Cape Kidnappers Coastal Trail: Embark on a memorable journey to Cape Kidnappers, known for its awe-inspiring gannet colonies and dramatic coastal landscapes. This trail can be explored on foot or by bike, and the 19-kilometer round trip allows adventurers to appreciate the raw beauty of the region while marveling at the birdlife. Kaweka Forest Park: Located a short drive from Napier, Kaweka Forest Park offers an extensive network of trails that cater to hikers and bikers alike. Immerse yourself in lush native forests, alpine landscapes, and tranquil rivers. The Park’s diverse terrain provides options for short day trips or multi-day excursions for the more adventurous. For more detailed information about these trails, including maps, difficulty levels, and current trail conditions, visit the official Hawke’s Bay tourism website at www.hawkesbaynz.com. Day Trips While Havelock North is a charming destination in itself, the surrounding Hawke’s Bay region offers an abundance of day trip possibilities. Here are some recommendations to make the most of your stay: Coastal Beauty: Take a scenic drive to Waimarama Beach and Ocean Beach for stunning coastal vistas, sun-soaked relaxation, and invigorating swims. Wineries: Discover Hawke’s Bay’s renowned wineries on a tasting tour. Visit iconic vineyards such as Craggy Range, Te Mata Estate, Mission Estate, and Black Barn Vineyards. Natural Wonders: Embark on an adventure to Cape Kidnappers to witness gannet colonies and marvel at coastal cliffs with guided tours. Art and Architecture: Explore Napier’s Art Deco architecture, stroll its streets, and enjoy shopping and dining. Family Fun: Splash Planet offers a fun-filled water park experience for families and thrill-seekers. River Retreat: Kayak along the tranquil Tuki Tuki River for a peaceful nature escape. Local Flavors: Don’t miss the vibrant farmers’ markets in Hastings and Havelock North for fresh produce and artisanal treats. The Enchanted Retreat SURPRISE A LOVED ONE SEEKING A ROMANTIC GETAWAY Unforgettable luxury camping under the stars awaits. Plenty of space and more amenities than you can shake a stick at – Dishwasher, hot tub, outdoor fire, indoor fire, outdoor lounge suit, hairdryer and even robes, just to name a few. Luxurious bed and linen makes all the difference too. We will be staying here for all future trips to the Hawke’s Bay. Jesse Marshall Beautiful stay! Would Highly recommend staying there to anyone. name: waimanawa.co.nz
homepage_content: Waimanawa | Kaha Ake Home Our Communities About Land Acquisition Location Build Partners News Enquire Kaha Ake Waimanawa From the mountains to the sea Modern living in harmony with nature Waimanawa promises a harmonious country living experience with easy access to both nature and urban conveniences. Register your interest Build partner info LOCATION Warkworth PROJECT UPDATE Coming soon Join us in creating Waimanawa, a developing community in Warkworth that will feature a blend of residential, business, and open space zones. This thoughtfully designed area will include 1600 new residential lots, parks, a retail center, and a public transport hub. Infrastructure enhancements, such as a water reservoir and cycle paths, aim to provide modern amenities while preserving the natural environment, including the Mahurangi River and Avice Miller Reserve. Register your interest Build partner info Why you'll love living here Located near the charming town of Warkworth, Waimanawa offers residents a gateway to a variety of scenic and recreational opportunities. Warkworth itself is a picturesque town perched by the Mahurangi River, featuring a selection of delightful restaurants and accommodations. Common Space Gateway to the Matakana coast Ideally positioned to explore beautiful beaches, renowned wineries, local art studios, exquisite cafés and much more. This area is ideally positioned to explore the beautiful beaches to the west and the renowned wineries to the east. Just off the coast lies the scenic Kawau Island, notable for its historic Mansion House, once the private retreat of Governor Grey. To the east of Warkworth and north of Mahurangi East, you’ll find the Tāwharanui Peninsula, home to the Tāwharanui Regional Park and Tawharanui Marine Park. Here, visitors can enjoy activities ranging from relaxing at stunning surf beaches to snorkeling in the Goat Island Marine Reserve. The nearby Matakana region is known for its excellent wineries, artists’ studios, and cozy country cafés. Whether you’re enjoying a fish and chips picnic by the river or exploring local vineyards and parks, Warkworth provides a perfect base for a range of enriching experiences. Experience the best of both worlds Imagine starting your day to the gentle sounds of nature, with your home nestled amidst beautiful green landscapes, while still enjoying the convenience of having Warkworth's lively town centre just minutes away. At Waimanawa, our goal is to craft a community that offers families the peacefulness of rural living, with the added benefit of being near vital amenities and exciting local attractions. This unique combination of natural serenity and easy access to urban comforts makes Waimanawa an ideal place for families to settle and grow. Explore the local area Learn More Build Partners We will team up with a collection of the region’s most sought after and experienced build partners to deliver Waimanawa. homepage_content: Waimanawa | Kaha Ake Home Our Communities About Land Acquisition Location Build Partners News Enquire Kaha Ake Waimanawa From the mountains to the sea Modern living in harmony with nature Waimanawa promises a harmonious country living experience with easy access to both nature and urban conveniences. Register your interest Build partner info LOCATION Warkworth PROJECT UPDATE Coming soon Join us in creating Waimanawa, a developing community in Warkworth that will feature a blend of residential, business, and open space zones. This thoughtfully designed area will include 1600 new residential lots, parks, a retail center, and a public transport hub. Infrastructure enhancements, such as a water reservoir and cycle paths, aim to provide modern amenities while preserving the natural environment, including the Mahurangi River and Avice Miller Reserve. Register your interest Build partner info Why you'll love living here Located near the charming town of Warkworth, Waimanawa offers residents a gateway to a variety of scenic and recreational opportunities. Warkworth itself is a picturesque town perched by the Mahurangi River, featuring a selection of delightful restaurants and accommodations. Common Space Gateway to the Matakana coast Ideally positioned to explore beautiful beaches, renowned wineries, local art studios, exquisite cafés and much more. This area is ideally positioned to explore the beautiful beaches to the west and the renowned wineries to the east. Just off the coast lies the scenic Kawau Island, notable for its historic Mansion House, once the private retreat of Governor Grey. To the east of Warkworth and north of Mahurangi East, you’ll find the Tāwharanui Peninsula, home to the Tāwharanui Regional Park and Tawharanui Marine Park. Here, visitors can enjoy activities ranging from relaxing at stunning surf beaches to snorkeling in the Goat Island Marine Reserve. The nearby Matakana region is known for its excellent wineries, artists’ studios, and cozy country cafés. Whether you’re enjoying a fish and chips picnic by the river or exploring local vineyards and parks, Warkworth provides a perfect base for a range of enriching experiences. Experience the best of both worlds Imagine starting your day to the gentle sounds of nature, with your home nestled amidst beautiful green landscapes, while still enjoying the convenience of having Warkworth's lively town centre just minutes away. At Waimanawa, our goal is to craft a community that offers families the peacefulness of rural living, with the added benefit of being near vital amenities and exciting local attractions. This unique combination of natural serenity and easy access to urban comforts makes Waimanawa an ideal place for families to settle and grow. Explore the local area Learn More Build Partners We will team up with a collection of the region’s most sought after and experienced build partners to deliver Waimanawa. Home’s will be sold exclusively via these build partners as House & Land packages. Simply choose your preferred build partner, choose your architecturally designed house plan, then add your personal touch with colours and fittings to suit. homepage_content: Waimanawa | Kaha Ake Home Our Communities About Land Acquisition Location Build Partners News Enquire Kaha Ake Waimanawa From the mountains to the sea Modern living in harmony with nature Waimanawa promises a harmonious country living experience with easy access to both nature and urban conveniences. Register your interest Build partner info LOCATION Warkworth PROJECT UPDATE Coming soon Join us in creating Waimanawa, a developing community in Warkworth that will feature a blend of residential, business, and open space zones. This thoughtfully designed area will include 1600 new residential lots, parks, a retail center, and a public transport hub. Infrastructure enhancements, such as a water reservoir and cycle paths, aim to provide modern amenities while preserving the natural environment, including the Mahurangi River and Avice Miller Reserve. Register your interest Build partner info Why you'll love living here Located near the charming town of Warkworth, Waimanawa offers residents a gateway to a variety of scenic and recreational opportunities. Warkworth itself is a picturesque town perched by the Mahurangi River, featuring a selection of delightful restaurants and accommodations. Common Space Gateway to the Matakana coast Ideally positioned to explore beautiful beaches, renowned wineries, local art studios, exquisite cafés and much more. This area is ideally positioned to explore the beautiful beaches to the west and the renowned wineries to the east. Just off the coast lies the scenic Kawau Island, notable for its historic Mansion House, once the private retreat of Governor Grey. To the east of Warkworth and north of Mahurangi East, you’ll find the Tāwharanui Peninsula, home to the Tāwharanui Regional Park and Tawharanui Marine Park. Here, visitors can enjoy activities ranging from relaxing at stunning surf beaches to snorkeling in the Goat Island Marine Reserve. The nearby Matakana region is known for its excellent wineries, artists’ studios, and cozy country cafés. Whether you’re enjoying a fish and chips picnic by the river or exploring local vineyards and parks, Warkworth provides a perfect base for a range of enriching experiences. Experience the best of both worlds Imagine starting your day to the gentle sounds of nature, with your home nestled amidst beautiful green landscapes, while still enjoying the convenience of having Warkworth's lively town centre just minutes away. At Waimanawa, our goal is to craft a community that offers families the peacefulness of rural living, with the added benefit of being near vital amenities and exciting local attractions. This unique combination of natural serenity and easy access to urban comforts makes Waimanawa an ideal place for families to settle and grow. Explore the local area Learn More Build Partners We will team up with a collection of the region’s most sought after and experienced build partners to deliver Waimanawa. Home’s will be sold exclusively via these build partners as House & Land packages. Simply choose your preferred build partner, choose your architecturally designed house plan, then add your personal touch with colours and fittings to suit. Learn More Explore the latest news & updates Stay informed with recent developments and updates from Waimanawa and Kaha Ake. homepage_content: Waimanawa | Kaha Ake Home Our Communities About Land Acquisition Location Build Partners News Enquire Kaha Ake Waimanawa From the mountains to the sea Modern living in harmony with nature Waimanawa promises a harmonious country living experience with easy access to both nature and urban conveniences. Register your interest Build partner info LOCATION Warkworth PROJECT UPDATE Coming soon Join us in creating Waimanawa, a developing community in Warkworth that will feature a blend of residential, business, and open space zones. This thoughtfully designed area will include 1600 new residential lots, parks, a retail center, and a public transport hub. Infrastructure enhancements, such as a water reservoir and cycle paths, aim to provide modern amenities while preserving the natural environment, including the Mahurangi River and Avice Miller Reserve. Register your interest Build partner info Why you'll love living here Located near the charming town of Warkworth, Waimanawa offers residents a gateway to a variety of scenic and recreational opportunities. Warkworth itself is a picturesque town perched by the Mahurangi River, featuring a selection of delightful restaurants and accommodations. Common Space Gateway to the Matakana coast Ideally positioned to explore beautiful beaches, renowned wineries, local art studios, exquisite cafés and much more. This area is ideally positioned to explore the beautiful beaches to the west and the renowned wineries to the east. Just off the coast lies the scenic Kawau Island, notable for its historic Mansion House, once the private retreat of Governor Grey. To the east of Warkworth and north of Mahurangi East, you’ll find the Tāwharanui Peninsula, home to the Tāwharanui Regional Park and Tawharanui Marine Park. Here, visitors can enjoy activities ranging from relaxing at stunning surf beaches to snorkeling in the Goat Island Marine Reserve. The nearby Matakana region is known for its excellent wineries, artists’ studios, and cozy country cafés. Whether you’re enjoying a fish and chips picnic by the river or exploring local vineyards and parks, Warkworth provides a perfect base for a range of enriching experiences. Experience the best of both worlds Imagine starting your day to the gentle sounds of nature, with your home nestled amidst beautiful green landscapes, while still enjoying the convenience of having Warkworth's lively town centre just minutes away. At Waimanawa, our goal is to craft a community that offers families the peacefulness of rural living, with the added benefit of being near vital amenities and exciting local attractions. This unique combination of natural serenity and easy access to urban comforts makes Waimanawa an ideal place for families to settle and grow. Explore the local area Learn More Build Partners We will team up with a collection of the region’s most sought after and experienced build partners to deliver Waimanawa. Home’s will be sold exclusively via these build partners as House & Land packages. Simply choose your preferred build partner, choose your architecturally designed house plan, then add your personal touch with colours and fittings to suit. With over 15 years experience in the building industry, G.J. Gardner has built over 25,000 homes nation wide with over 650 of these built in the Manawatu and Horowhenua. “We are committed to delivering our customers the very best value on their new home along with a professional, enjoyable experience.” – Trevor Low. The local Franchise intends to continue building with high standards by using the GJ system, utilising GJ's nationwide buying power, and delivering at a local level with the use of local subcontractors. Ensuring he and his team continue producing quality homes, built on time, and on budget. Talk to the friendly team today and discover why more New Zealanders trust G.J. Gardner to build their homes year after year. name: afm.co.nz
homepage_content: Auckland Fish Market – Eat At The Source Skip to main content Hit enter to search or ESC to close Close Search Chào Authentic Vietnamese food that goes beyond the typical canteen experience. Serving up all your favourites - Pho, Banh Mi, Rice Paper Rolls, Bun Cha - and more. The Store Open from 7am daily serving Allpress coffee, incredible sweet and savoury snacks, sandwiches, salads and our own gelato. Bang Bang Kitchen A vibrant modern Asian Fusion eatery with bold punchy flavours. Think Hawker markets in Singapore, your local Chinese takeaway, Peking duck, lobster fried rice and bountiful dim sum baskets. Lobster & Tap A shack completely dedicated to the delicacy of premium Canadian wild caught lobster in a buttered bun. The Wreck Craft beers, NZ wine, liquor, hard sodas, tall tales. Happy hour from 4pm - 6pm weekdays. Billy Pot When your raw ingredients are the best in the world your dishes deserve to be simple. Fabulous fresh oysters, mussel hotpots, chowders, burgers and more. You just can’t beat the classics. Market Galley Eastern food, Western food, old favourites, future classics. The market’s kitchen where the choicest produce get turned into fresh and flavoursome fare for the whole family. Get stuck in. OJI Sushi FAST FUEL NOT FAST FOOD. From the masterminds behind Azabu and Ebisu, Oji Sushi is back serving up fresh, delicious Japanese fare - perfect for a quick bite. Fresh sushi rolled daily, sashimi, sandos, donburi bowls, and salads. The Fishmarket Grill The Fishmarket Grill by Sanford is your go-to destination for fresh, mouthwatering grilled seafood. Our open-fire grill brings the flavours to life right before your eyes, offering everything from tasty snacks to shareable grilled bites. Sanford and Sons At Sanford and Sons, our goal is to make eating fresh fish and seafood convenient and accessible to everyone! LOOK BEFORE YOU LEAP THE ORIGINAL AUCKLAND FISH MARKET ON AUCKLAND’S WATER FRONT ABOUT US Started by Albert Sanford in 1904 the Auckland Fish Market has been the beating heart of New Zealand seafood for well over 100 years. Now rebooted, reenergised and rebuilt, the Auckland Fish Market is a temple to the senses filled with the most passionate fishmongers and chefs that the New Zealand food scene has to offer. An international standard with a local focus. With 100’s of fish species and dishes on offer curiosity will be rewarded. The Auckland Fish Market is managed and stocked by Sanford who prioritise sustainability and longevity in the way they fish. Respect the ocean. Care for the ocean. Share the ocean. AUCKLAND FISH MARKET 22 Jellicoe St, Wynyard Quarter, Auckland 1010 For Venue or Table Booking, Lost Property and Enquiries contact hello@afm.co.nz Public Transport Info Trading Hours SANFORD AND SONS FISHMONGER Monday – Thursday – 8am – 5pm Friday – Sunday – 8am – 6pm SANFORD AND SONS FROZEN WHOLESALE Monday – Sunday – 7am – 4pm AUCKLAND FISH MARKET AUCTION Monday – Friday View products from 5 – 6am Bidding starts 6am BILLY POT Monday – Wednesday and Sunday – 11am – 5pm Thursday-Saturday – 11am-7pm MARKET GALLEY Monday – Wednesday and Sunday 11am – 5pm Thursday- Saturday 11am – 7pm THE WRECK Monday – Wednesday and Sunday 11am – 5pm Thursday- Saturday 11am – 7pm LOBSTER AND TAP Monday – Wednesday and Sunday 11am – 5pm Thursday- Saturday 11am – 7pm BANG BANG Monday – Wednesday and Sunday 11am – 5pm Thursday- Saturday 11am – 7pm THE STORE Monday – Sunday – 7am – 4pm OJI SUSHI Monday to Sunday 10am – 4pm CHAO Monday – Wednesday and Sunday 11am – 5pm Thursday- Saturday 11am – 7pm Press Enquiry Careers Privacy Policy Terms of Use Close Menu Eateries What’s On Getting here About Auction

homepage_content: Motel Accommodation Whakatane | Awa Motel Welcome to Awa Motel Nau mai, haere mai ki tÅ mÄtou wÄhi motuhake - welcome to our place Arrival Arrival calendar Departure Departure calendar Guests 1 guest 2 guests 3 guests 4 guests 5 guests 6 guests 7 guests 8 guests 9 guests 10 guests Guests calendar Book Now Rooms 2 Bedroom Deluxe Apartment This two bedroom apartment is perfect for two couples or a family. It has a very large lounge area with open plan kitchen. Featuring a full kitchen with oven, cook top, dishwasher and full size refrigerator The master bedroom has a king size bed and the second bedroom has two singles. Learn More 3 Bedroom Family Apartment The three bedroom apartment sleeps up to five. Downstairs is a living room area, dining suite and a full kitchen. There is a bathroom and separate toilet. Upstairs are three bedrooms. The master has a king sized bed, the second bedroom has two single beds and the third has one single bed. Learn More Standard Studio (Economy) Our most basic room type yet great value for money! We've classed these rooms as economy as they can be a little noisier than our other rooms. These rooms are livened up with a splash of colour! Our standard (economy) studios have a King Bed and a Single bed. There is a kitchenette and ensuite bathroom. Two of these rooms are accessible rooms and therefore have wetfloor bathrooms. Learn More Deluxe Studio A spacious studio room with kitchenette and ensuite bathroom. Deluxe studios have a King Bed and a King Single. Learn More Deluxe Studio with Spa Bath A spacious studio room with a King bed and kitchenette. The ensuite bathroom has the added luxury of a large double spa bath. Learn More Micro-village Cabin Whakatane's newest motel rooms! Nine architecturally designed, standalone cabins make up the "Micro-village". Each features a luxurious Californian King bed. Kitchenette with microwave, refrigerator, toaster, and kettle. The spacious ensuite bathroom has a large walk-in shower with instant hot water. Air-conditioning allows for the perfect temperature to be maintained year-round. There is a large semi-covered deck to make the most of Whakataneâs abundant sunshine. Cabins have their own car park conveniently located immediately alongside. Learn More Standard Studio Large studio room with a king size bed and kitchenette. An ensuite bathroom with shower. These rooms are located on both the second and ground level of the complex. Please note that pictures are only an indication, there is some variance in room layout. Learn More The Back Villa The Back Villa enjoys a quiet and private setting. Learn More The Bungalow This is a stand-alone property next door to our main motel complex. It is a three bedroom 1950's bungalow that has been renovated in 2014. There is a large living area, dining area, full kitchen, bathroom, second toilet and a laundry. An exterior all-weather room off the kitchen opens to a grassed courtyard, great for relaxing in summer or storing your fishing gear. The master bedroom has a huge Californian King bed, the second bedroom has a King bed and the third bedroom has a King Single bed. Learn More The Front Villa Enjoy the spaciousness of your own private Villa apartment with views out to a lovely garden and the Whakatane River. Learn More The Garden Unit This one-bedroom unit is nestled in a very quiet part of the motel complex surrounded by a garden. It comes complete with a modern kitchen equipped with an oven, hob, and dishwasher, a bathroom with shower and washing machine, and a King bed in the bedroom. Learn More Previous Next About Us Nestled between the WhakatÄne River and a PÅhutukawa tree lined escarpment lies Awa Motel. Whether youâre travelling for leisure or in WhakatÄne on business, our 4.5 star motel accommodation has a room type to suit every traveller. A quiet location yet only minutes walk from WhakatÄneâs boutique shopping and numerous restaurants. Awa Motel boasts its own onsite cafÃ©, Cafe Awa - a favourite amongst locals. Let our barista make you the perfect coffee to go with your gourmet breakfast. Choose to have it delivered to your room or enjoy in the atmosphere of the cafÃ©. Learn More Attractions MoutohorÄ Island Sanctuary Discover the rare beauty of one of New Zealandâs little-known treasures MoutohorÄ/Whale Island is a pest-free oasis that is home to a number of New Zealandâs rare and endangered plants, birds and reptiles. Keep an eye out for a threatened tÅ«turiwhatu/New Zealand dotterel, boisterous tÄ«eke/North Island saddleback, Tuatara, or kÄkÄriki/red-crowned parakeet as you journey through the regenerated native bush before you dig yourself a soothing geothermal spring pool at OnepÅ« Bay, MoutohorÄâs secluded hot water beach. This is your opportunity to see New Zealandâs wildlife as nature intended it and shows what can be achieved when a concentrated effort on conservation is made, managed and protected. Tour of MoutohorÄ Highlights 4-hour guided tour of one of New Zealandâs most protected wildlife sanctuaries 15-minute boat journey to MoutohorÄ/Whale Island aboard a comfortable catamaran Visit a kekeno/NZ fur seal colony Abundant birdlife including tÅ«turiwhatu/New Zealand dotterel, tÄ«eke/North Island saddleback, kÄkÄriki/red-crowned parakeet, tui and bellbirds Swim at secluded hot water beach OnepÅ«/Sulphur Bay Dig your own private hot springs pool at OnepÅ«/Sulphur Bay Professional and fully trained crew and guides Each ticket price includes a landing fee supporting the Department of Conservationâs work on the island and a contribution to support the WhakatÄne Coastguard. The check-in location for the MoutohorÄ Island Sanctuary is the Awa Motel reception. Please contact reception for bookings or check availability and book online at www.moutohora.co.nz Learn More Gallery We look forward to welcoming you to the heart of NgÄti Awa - WhakatÄne E whakapono ana mÄtou ki te manaaki i a koe ki te manawa o NgÄti Awa Arrival Arrival calendar Departure Departure calendar Guests 1 guest 2 guests 3 guests 4 guests 5 guests 6 guests 7 guests 8 guests 9 guests 10 guests Guests calendar Book Now Awards Awa Motel 15 The Strand, Whakatane, -, 3120, New Zealand T 073089500 T 0800242299 E info@ngatiawatourism.co.nz Learn More Awa Motel 15 The Strand, Whakatane, -, 3120, New Zealand Menu Home Rooms Gallery Attractions More About Us About Us Contact Us Job Vacancies All rights reserved Powered by Canvas

name: abbella.co.nz
homepage_content: Abbella Lodge Motel – Accommodation 0800 422 235 info@abbella.co.nz Facebook Facebook 194 Main North Road, Redwood, Christchurch, New Zealand Abbella Lodge Motel We are close to Christchurch International Airport, the City Centre, and the Casino. EV chargers available here! Ring or email us to book direct and receive our loyalty rewards. Term and conditions apply. Book now Welcome to Abbella Lodge Motel Visitors can easily reach all of the region’s top attractions, including Antarctic Centre, Willowbank Wildlife Reserve, Botanic Gardens, Ferrymead Heritage Park, Akaroa, Hanmer Springs, and Kaikoura. There is a new large supermarket (PAK’N SAVE) directly across the road and the Northlands Shopping Mall, Hoyts cinema and Lone Star Restaurant are all under a kilometre away. We are just 8km from Christchurch International Airport and 6km from Christchurch city centre. St Bede’s College & Papanui High School are nearby and we are approximately 10 minutes drive from Burwood Hospital or 15 minutes to Christchurch Hospital. The popular Papanui Club is also nearby. Clearwater, Hagley and Russley Golf Clubs are also just a short drive away. Abbella Lodge Motel offers value and comfort to guests and promises to ensure a pleasant stay. The motel has free on-site parking with space for campervans/boats. EV chargers are available for guest use charges apply. Free fibre WiFi internet access, a BBQ area, customer-operated laundry, luggage storage, facilities for wheelchairs and designated smoking areas. We also have NETFLIX in every room. Guests can choose from studio rooms or apartments, all with kitchenettes. Rooms with spa baths are available for luxurious relaxation. When you are looking for value and comfort for your Christchurch stay, choose Abbella Lodge Motel. Book now Book now Subscribe To Our E-news Join our mailing list to receive the latest news, special offers and updates from our Abbella lodge Motel Accommodation. Success! Email Subscribe Access Studio Click Here Studio Unit Click Here Spa Bath Studio Click Here One Bedroom Apartment Click Here One Bedroom Spa Bath Apartment Click Here Two Bedroom Spa Bath Apartment Click Here Abbella Lodge Motel Reviews Sustainability Abbella Lodge Motel Our sustainable tourism team is actively working towards new initiatives and reducing our Carbon Footprint. If you wish to comment on our current initiatives or have new ideas please notify our reception staff on your departure. We hope you leave the Abbella Lodge Motel knowing your support helps us maintain the lovely environment we live in. Environmental initiatives: Energy Staff are fully trained in energy saving practices (turning off lights and equipment as necessarily) LED bulbs used in all areas Hot water cylinders set to 55 degrees Air conditioning system maintained to ensure efficient use. Energy efficient appliances used Hot water cylinders and pipes insulated. Suites are insulated to reduce heat loss Sleep mode is installed on all computers along with LCD screen monitors All computers and equipment in offices are switched off when not in use Guest given the option to not have room serviced and towels changed daily All rooms fully insulated Waste Full recycling system in place -Glass, Cardboard, Tins, Aluminium, Paper and Plastic Bulk ordering done in all departments to avoid excess packaging – packaging returned to supplier for recycling Limited printing of emails, reservations, and general paperwork Recycled paper used for note paper, internal printing and where appropriate Eco friendly cleaning products used to a minimum Water Dual flush systems on toilets in new suites Maintenance manager checks for leaks in taps, toilets, valves and pipework on a weekly basis Limited water used in cleaning all windows Community As a community we also support: Offering employment to local residents when possible Commitment from staff to follow all environmental initiatives in place We aim to purchase products from local suppliers We support local business by promoting their attractions and activities through reception Involvement with the sustainable business practice group Dedicated sustainable tourism webpage on our website Visit: https://www.sustainabletourism.nz/ Abbella Lodge Motel Accepts All Major Credit Cards and: Farmlands, China Union Pay Cards. Book a room Today  Contact Info info@abbella.co.nz 0800 422 235  Abbella Lodge motel 194 Main North Road, Redwood, Christchurch, New Zealand Follow us Follow Follow

homepage_content: Welcome to Amross Motel – Your Top Choice for Dunedin Accommodation × Close × Close Home About Rooms Studio Access 1 Bedroom Two Bedroom Spa Rooms Contact Explore Dunedin Sitemap Privacy We offer the best value and best service of all accommodation options in Dunedin Come Stay Book Now More Rooms More Explore Dunedin More About Us More If you're looking for the perfect place to stay in Dunedin, Amross Motel offers exceptional comfort, unbeatable service, and great value. Whether you're visiting for business, a weekend getaway, or a family trip, our modern, well-equipped rooms ensure a relaxing stay. Why Choose Amross Motel? ✔ Unmatched Comfort & Convenience – Our refurbished rooms feature modern fittings, ensuring a fresh and welcoming space. Enjoy free, high-speed Hyperfibre internet , both wired and wireless, perfect for business travellers and streaming entertainment. ✔ Premium Entertainment – Settle in with thousands of free movies on demand, displayed on a 50-inch flat-screen TV. ✔ Peace & Quiet – Our rooms are soundproofed for a restful night’s sleep, complemented by quiet, effective heating to keep you warm in Dunedin’s cooler months. ✔ Self-Contained Facilities – Each unit includes a kitchenette, giving you the flexibility to prepare your own meals. ✔ Free & Easy Parking – No need to worry about parking fees – we provide free off-street parking for all our guests. ✔ Laundry Services – Convenient washing and drying facilities are available to keep you feeling fresh throughout your stay. Located in the heart of Dunedin, Amross Motel is close to the University of Otago, Dunedin Hospital, Forsyth Barr Stadium , and popular attractions such as the Otago Museum and the Dunedin Botanic Garden. Experience the best in Dunedin accommodation with Amross Motel – where comfort, quality, and service come first. Book your stay today! Book Now

With its history-rich design, inspired menu, and full range of beers on tap, it’s the kind of bar Samuel himself would have happily called home. Centrally located on Bealey Avenue, it’s close to the city yet still brimming with laid-back suburban charm. name: caplescourt.co.nz
homepage_content: Caples Court Motel | Queenstown Motel Accommodation Book Now Caples Court Motel Queenstown Premium Motel Accommodation Book Now Our Rooms All our Rooms are equipped with: Fridge Microwave Toaster 37" TV Coffee/Tea Maker Garden View Studio This room offers an outdoor area with a picnic table and lovely garden views. It has a kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator and a portable stove top. Lake View Studio This room offers beautiful views of Lake Wakatipu from your balcony. It has a kitchenette with a microwave and a refrigerator. 1 Bedroom Apartment This spacious, open-plan apartment features a private balcony with views of Lake Wakatipu and the surrounding mountains. 2 Bedroom Apartment This room offers beautiful views across Queenstown and Lake Wakatipu from a shared balcony. It has a kitchenette with a microwave and a refrigerator. Executive Studio This quiet, spacious, more modern studio features a private balcony with partial mountain views. It offers kitchen facilities, 1 bathroom and a dining/lounge area with a flat-screen TV Budget Basement Studio This unit is situated next to the laundry. It is a quiet room featuring a seating area, toaster, jug, microwave and fridge. Executive One-Bedroom This spacious, open-plan, more modern apartment features a private balcony with views of Lake Wakatipu and the surrounding mountains. Book A Room Caples Court Motel Caples Court Queenstown is only 5 minutes walk from the lovely Queenstown Gardens, a great place to relax and enjoy views of the surrounding area. Queenstown Airport is a 10-minute drive and The Remarkables Ski Area is a 40-minute drive. Adventure seekers can book white water rafting trips, bungy jumping and canyon swings with our tour desk. Guest laundry, ski lockers, bike and luggage storage areas are available. All rooms are heated and most rooms feature a private patio with views of the city and Lake Wakatipu. All include a refrigerator, microwave and a TV with satellite channels. Customer Reviews Good views. CBD only 5 minutes walk, although down a hill. Layout of unit was good. Electric blankets on the beds, and the staff offered clean towels and tea/coffee topups each day. John So handy to everything. Nice spacious 2 bed room units with a view. Only a few minute walk to town and super market. Bus stop a 2 minute walk also. Deanna Location is perfect with great views of Lake Wakatipu, it is up a steep hill though from town. A great place to unwind with ample facilities. Reception staff were very kind and approachable. Tiahly 20 Stanley St, Queenstown, 9300, New Zealand | Phone: +64 3-441 3101 | Email: stay@queenstownmotel.com © 2024 Caples Court

homepage_content: Destiny on Fitzherbert | Palmerston North Luxury Accommodation +64 6 355 0050 0800 100 179 office@dof.co.nz Book Your Stay Palmerston North Luxury Accommodation VIEW OUR ROOMS CHECK OUR RATES CONTACT US DESTINY ON FITZHERBERT MOTEL Luxury Palmerston North Accommodation Destiny on Fitzherbert Motel is a luxury motel accommodation located in the heart of Palmerston North . We are just a few blocks from the city centre where you will find the business hub, as well as some of the cities best restaurants, cafes, bars and shops for you to choose from. Our boutique Palmerston North motel has everything you need to make your stay a pleasure, with a range of spacious studio , one bedroom and two bedroom suites with 50” HDTV, Sky, free unlimited high speed Wi-Fi, beautiful bespoke furniture and in-room kitchen facilities GIFT VOUCHERS Purchase a voucher to surprise your partner, family or friends. Call us now for options. CALL NOW ROOMS Relax in your beautifully furnished, well appointed room. The newly refurbished suites have been designed with intrigue, colour and attention to comfort and quality. CONTACT US We look forward to welcoming you to one of Palmerston North's recent refurbished motel. EXPLORE MANAWATU Have a look at what we have to offer during your stay in Palmerston North. Loyalty Programme As part of our commitment to reward our loyal guests, we are thrilled to offer an exclusive loyalty system that lets you save more with each stay. Why Destiny Motel? For the last word in luxury Palmerston North accommodation , and an experience that is truly a home away from home, choose Destiny on Fitzherbert Motel, located a short walk from The Square in the central city. Whether it's for business travel, or a weekend treat in the heart of the Manawatu, our rooms offer the best in luxury Palmerston North accommodation. The city's business hub, best cafes, restaurants and shopping are almost on the doorstep. Please call +64 6 355 0050 to discuss your personal requirements. Comfortable Palmerston North Luxury Accommodation Close to the Business Hub Discover our four-star Palmerston North luxury accommodation . We have corporate, business, couples, and family studios and suites available. Take a look at our premium, exquisitely designed spaces if you plan to be in Palmerston for an event, conference, or holiday. Luxury Palmerston North Accommodation - Destiny on Fitzherbert What Sets Destiny on Fitzherbert Apart Regarding Boutique Accommodation in Palmerston North? We provide free parking and in-room kitchen facilities, ironing equipment, bespoke furniture, free unlimited high-speed WiFi, 50-inch smart TV with Sky Sports channels in our spacious one and two-bedroom suites and studios to make your stay as convenient and pleasant as possible. The Square, shops, excellent bars, cafes, and restaurants are just a few blocks or a six-minute walk away from our stylish motel. It will take you eight minutes to drive to our facilities from the Palmerston North train station and 13 minutes from the airport. Stay online while away from your home or office. We offer no-cost ultra-fast broadband and data facilities and an executive desk in our premium studio. Enjoy the convenience of the microwave, kettle, tea, coffee, bathroom facilities, and privacy in our home away from home. Our beautifully appointed premium studios on the ground and first floor contain king-size or twin beds. Our premium two-bedroom Palmerston accommodation will suit a medium-sized family with a preference for modern furnishings and stylish décor. The suite boasts a king bed in the master, both a double and single bed in the second bedroom, plus a queen sofa bed and flat-screen TV in the lounge. The kitchen facilities include a hob top, and the bathroom has a bath and a separate shower. You have the benefit of high speed fibre internet. Why Trust Destiny on Fitzherbert Regarding Accommodation in Palmerston North, NZ? Our friendly, welcoming, and helpful staff pay attention to every detail to make your stay in our niche accommodation an experience to remember. Book your spa package and find a bottle of bubbly and a cracker and cheese platter waiting in your room upon arrival. Our spa deal offers a delightful couples' date in our premium studio spa, continental breakfast for two, and a late 12-noon departure. Please notify us if you expect to arrive after 8.00 pm, or we may cancel your reservation to house other guests. The prices quoted cover the first two guests in a one-bedroom suite or premium studio. We charge for two-bedroom suites based on four guests. Additional guests who stay over, pay $25.00 each per night. You will incur no charges if you cancel your booking 48 hours or more before your scheduled arrival. Contact us to book and discuss your personal requirements . your host! Owner, Brent Haami, looks forward to welcoming you to Destiny on Fitzherbert where attention to fine detail will ensure your stay is the ultimate experience in the best of accommodation on offer in Palmerston North. Destiny on Fitzherbert motel is the perfect Palmerston North motel from which to head into town for meetings or shopping, explore the beautiful rose gardens , the Manawatu's bridle track walkway, and our famed Rugby Museum , as well as lots more to discover . What You Should Know About Palmerston North New Zealand Palmerston North offers many recreational facilities. Our out-of-town guests have lots to see and do, whether you are here on a business trip, to attend a seminar, or for a family wedding. You may want to visit the New Zealand Rugby Museum to see the vintage All Blacks uniforms and sporting memorabilia displays. Our city on the North Island offers several cultural activities, including small independent art galleries, the Te Manawa Art, Science, and History Museum, and performances at the Regent on Broadway, Centrepoint, and Globe theatres. The Globe Theatre 2014 redevelopment architect, Brian Elliot, won a New Zealand Architecture Award for his brilliant design. We have a flourishing music scene with local, national, and international acts performing regularly. You may book a seat to listen to the Manawatu Youth Orchestra - which has existed for 60 years - or the Palmerston North Brass Band founded in 1868 and pre-dates the city. View the exceptional Dugald McKenzie Rose Garden, a native bush reserve, formal botanical gardens, duck pond, and playgrounds at the expansive Victoria Esplanade, a 64-acre park on the Manawatu River's northern bank, west of Fitzherbert Avenue, Palmerston North . Bicycle and walking tracks connect the various attractions within the Esplanade, the Peter Black Conservatory, the Wildbase Recovery aviary for convalescing wildlife, and the 20-minute scenic miniature railway ride through native bush. The Manawatu River bridle path offers breath-taking views over the mountains. There are approximately 100 parks and reserves in the adjoining areas where you can hike, bike, and run. You may want to visit the Manawatu Gorge with its native bushland and forested hills just outside the city. Palmerston offers several sports fields for golf, hockey, cricket, rugby, softball, football, and baseball. The Hokowhitu Lagoon is a popular canoeing and kayaking spot. You can enjoy indoor swimming at the Freyberg Community Pool and Lido Aquatic Centre throughout the year. Luxury Palmerston North Accommodation - Destiny on Fitzherbert Our motel is the perfect place for those who wish to explore Palmerston North and experience the natural beauty and fresh air in our parks and the surrounding rural areas. Book Your Stay Now https://winifreds.guestybookings.com/en/properties/67eb61768ce6e4001241635c?minOccupancy=1 About Us Our Story Explore More Welcome to iloveWinifreds.co.nz — where comfort meets character. Right in the heart of Hamilton, you’ll find four charming two-bedroom properties, each with its own personality and a touch of unexpected delight. Thoughtfully designed for those who appreciate a little style with their stay, these spaces offer more than just a bed—they offer a mood. If you're after something fresh, stylish, and just a bit different, Winifred’s might be exactly what you didn’t know you were looking for. ​ Named in honour of my grandmother—who wore bold lipstick and brighter prints long before it was fashionable—Winifred’s celebrates individuality in all its colourful forms. Stay bold. Stay bright. Stay at Winifred’s. Features Winifred’s will be your favorite cozy retreat in Hamilton. Enjoy a comfortable stay that feels like a home away from home. Ideally located for events at FMG Stadium and Claudelands Events Centre, our accommodations are designed with a touch of cool and luxury. Each unit is fully equipped with a washing machine, dryer, iron, and features convenient amenities such as an outdoor power point for electric car charging, security gates, and outdoor security cameras. 1 Hotel Bed Linen 2 Digital Entry 3 Security gates 4 Air Conditioning 5 Laundry Fascilities 6 Next to Supermarket bottom of page

homepage_content: ASURE Kapiti Court Motel | Paraparaumu Accommodation | Book Direct and Save Check Availability / Book Online Welcome to ASURE Kapiti Court Motel Paraparaumu Accommodation NZ ASURE Kapiti Court Motel enjoys the best of all worlds. Ideal for those wanting a quiet, sunny break within walking distance of good shopping, restaurants, and an expansive beach with views of Kapiti Island . Ideal for those who want to experience the challenge of the internationally acclaimed Paraparaumu Beach Links Course that is immediately opposite. At the end of the day relax and enjoy a leisurely swim in the pool or enjoy a leisurely walk along the beach and the stunning sunsets. Whatever your interests, we aim to provide you with an enjoyable and memorable stay on the Kapiti Coast in Paraparaumu. We look forward to welcoming you to the ASURE Kapiti Court Motel . Rooms Location Facilities Local Activities Motel Facilities Heated swimming pool BBQ area and playground Offstreet parking and more! 64 SKY TV channels Read our guest reviews Great Location Walking distance to the waterfront and beach. Spacious room close to the pool. Ideal on a sunny warm day. Staff friendly and welcoming. Pat Paraparaumu Stopover We stopped here on our way up to Auckland, it was very convenient and at a reasonable price. The owner was exceedingly helpful and friendly, the room was large with a kitchen and eating area. I found the bed to be very comfortable. I would recommend this place to any overnight traveller. name: mtedenmotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Mount Eden Motel 0 Check Availability Stay Where Stories Begin A Slice of Eden – Comfort, Convenience, and Genuine Kiwi Hospitality Experience holidays like they used to be — comfy rooms, pool and spa, and the friendly Kiwi welcome you remember, right here in Mt Eden. Book Direct for the Best Rates At Mt Eden Motel, we believe holidays should feel easy — relaxed, friendly, and refreshingly simple. For generations, Kiwis and travellers alike have stayed here while visiting Auckland for work, family, or play. Under new ownership since 2024, a husband-and-wife duo — formerly owners of two local cafés — are bringing a fresh, retro-modern style to the motel while keeping the warmth and simplicity of classic Kiwi stays. Our goal is to create a welcoming space where guests can enjoy holidays like they used to — full of comfort, character, and genuine hospitality. Just 15 minutes from Auckland’s CBD, our family-owned motel offers affordable accommodation in Mt Eden, close to Eden Park, Auckland Showgrounds, Greenlane Hospital, and leading event venues. Relax in our outdoor pool, unwind in spacious rooms, and enjoy the friendly, down-to-earth service that makes Mt Eden Motel a true Kiwi favourite. Our Story Book Now Discover Us Comfort and Convenience Made Simple Book Direct & Save Lowest price guarantee: if you find the same type of room cheaper from any other booking sites. We will match that price. Book Now Our Rooms Basic Deluxe Queen Studios Deluxe Studios Family Rooms Queen Suites Deluxe Suites Superior Suites Family & Junior Suites 3 Bedroom Suite Discover Now From Our Guests “ This motel was a pleasant suprise. Rated as 3 star (we booked as other family were already booked to stay there) we wondered what we would be letting ourselves in for. The motel has recently changed hands and the new owners are working through the units and upgrading them. Both units our family were in were clean, modern, comfortable and excellent showers and beds. The Owners were friendly and welcoming. This will become our new affordable motel when staying in Auckland.” — Tricia Diprose “New favorite Motel. Staff are super helpful and friendly. Cleaners are amazing. Family Rooms are very suitable for families with a few children, also with a good amount of space. We stayed here for a week for a local family event and found it suitable for all our needs including the Kids staying entertained with the pool and up stairs while the adults event prepped downstairs. Very clean, fresh renovations. Thanks for the perfect stay and all your help and support during that stay! We will definitely be back again for out next Auckland event.” — Racing Pacific ”You cannot bet the location of this motel. The new owners are doing a fantastic job renovating the rooms. It's very retro and lots of fun. The beds were comfortable and the room very clean. The staff and manager bent over backwards to make our 3 day stay perfect. This motel will get better and better. We will definitely be staying again and again.” — Anne Valk Stay Where stories begin Contact Us We're here to help you discover Mt Eden Planning a work trip, family vacation, sports team event, or seeking medical care? Get in touch with reception for group bookings and tailored pricing. We look forward to hearing from you! 47 Balmoral Road Mt Eden, Auckland 1024 Reception Hours Monday–Friday 9:30am–5pm Saturday–Sunday 10am–5pm Phone (09) 638 7187 0800 737 669 Email info@mtedenmotel.co.nz Follow Our Journey

name: martonmotel.co.nz
homepage_content: Marton Motel | Marton | North Island Prev Next MEET MICHELLE AND ENJOY OUR FULLY REFURBISHED PROPERTY (2024/25) Check Availability / Book Direct Free Wifi G3tv 20,000 Movies Available Off-street parking Heater in all rooms Welcome to Marton Motel Situated two hours north of Wellington and out of the city hustle, you can be assured of a quiet, relaxing night’s rest and home-style hospitality in modern, well-equipped units when you stay with us. An ideal stopover point for accommodation if travelling through the lower North Island or connecting with the Inter-Island Ferry, we offer clean and comfortable accommodation with all units serviced daily. There is FREE Wi-Fi and a Smart 55" TV for your convenience. There is plenty of parking available for cars on-site and & for trucks and trailers roadside. Our units are on the ground floor and are maintained to a very high standard. The accommodation includes four studio units and three one-bedroom units, 2 capable of sleeping 4 persons and 1 capable 5 - 7 persons. No Pets, sorry, we do not allow pets, only service dogs with appropriate accommodation vehicles. EV Charging - If using room power points to charge your EV, a flat rate of $30 WILL APPLY PER CHARGE The Marton Motel is ideal for sports-minded travellers, having numerous golf courses within a 15-minute drive, fishing and white-water rafting on the Rangitikei River, historical homestead tours, and Manfeild. The nearest cities are Palmerston North and Wanganui, both only 30 minutes’ drive away. Bulls is 12 minutes, Fielding is 15 minutes. Also conveniently located only a 5-minute drive from both Nga Tawa and Huntly boarding schools. For great personal service and inviting accommodation, either ring our freephone number or make a booking online for the best prices and instant confirmation. Studio Units 1 Queen bed Work desk, arm chair and two dining chairs En suite bathroom with shower Flat screen television with Sky TV All cooking utensils (pots, pans, plates etc.) Microwave, electric frypan, 2 electric hobs, refrigerator Heater and electric blankets Iron and ironing board, hairdryer Outside seating and table for 2 Book Now Studio Twin Units 2 Single beds Work desk En suite bathroom with shower Flat screen television with Sky TV All cooking utensils (pots, pans, plates etc.) Heater and electric blankets Iron and ironing board, hairdryer Microwave, electric frypan, 2 electric hobs, refrigerator Outside seating and table for 2 Book Online One Bedroom Units 1 Queen bed in Main Room and 2 singles in Bedroom Dining table with 4 chairs Drawers and closets En suite bathroom with shower 2 x flat screen televisions with Sky TV All cooking utensils (pots, pans, plates etc.) Iron and ironing board, hairdryer Heater and electric blankets Microwave, electric frypan, 2 electric hobs, refrigerator Outside seating and table for 2 Book Now Family Units Double bed and a Single bed in the bedroom 1 Single and 1 Double bed in the lounge Large wardrobe and drawers Large couch and armchairs Breakfast bar and dining table with 4 chairs Bathroom with shower 2 x flat screen televisions with Sky TV Full kitchen including oven and large refrigerator with freezer Microwave All cooking utensils (pots, pans, plates etc.) Heater and electric blankets Iron and ironing board, hairdryer Private rear section and seating for 4 Outside seating and table for 2 Book Now Happy Customers Testimonials Friendly and quiet. Really big, clean and comfortable place to stay. Two large bedrooms and well equipped kitchen and bathroom. Perfect if heading North after an afternoon ferry crossing. Definitely recommend this motel for couples or families. Welcoming host who had no problem waiting for our late arrival. - Maggie Read Very helpful Great owners - sorted out making sure I could get into my room after my ferries were cancelled/delayed and generally running very late. Awesome to have that flexibility and helpfulness. Also nice and quiet to get a good nights sleep which helped! - pihatony Start of a road trip Spent one night in the middle of winter at the Marton motel. I could have stayed the whole week. Our twin bed room had everything we needed. It was well maintained and comfortable. The room was warm and welcoming. As for the shower I have never had such strong water pressure any where before. Fantastic location, Friendly reception, Easy parking. A great place to start our week. - Gary M Overnight stay after a Strait ferry crossing Easy place to find - nice and quiet. Very clean and tidy. Good price. Hosts were friendly and helpful - especially recommending a good place for dining. Warm with the heaters cranked up. Ideal overnight stop to break up our trip. - Brent B Great Value Stayed one night. Arrived 10:30pm, left 10:30am. On line booking, but phoned to say we'd be late. Not a problem. Nice, very clean motel room. Everything worked. Could not ask for more. Made me wonder why you spend more around the country and often get less. Highly recommended! - Alan K I had the pleasure of staying here at Marton Motel over the weekend (Sat and Sunday, July 26th & 27th) 2025. Dear Marton Motel. Right from the get go it was evident how welcoming, professional and friendly the current manager was. Her friendly approach was only surpassed by the immaculately kept room we were in. I've never seen a shower, bench and sink that shiny in my entire life. We were warm and catered for with such care and pride of her rooms that I would not hesitate to highly recommend a stay in this beautifully presented and friendly staff to anyone passing through or in Marton looking to stay. Thank you for a delightful visit. We will definitely stay here again. Kind regards, - Connie Cook Ocean Fresh Takeaways Ltd Golfing Weekend What a surprise! This amazing little motel is a real little ripper, right in the centre of all the golf courses of the area. The rooms were absolutely spotless, and everything was brand new. Amazing huge TV setup, great host, and plenty of parking. The weather was great and the golf was good. We couldn't have asked for anything more. - Pete & Pals +64 6 327 8499 reception@martonmotel.nz Book Online © 2025 - Admin Login - Sitemap - Website by GuestTraction

name: ngapaeholidaypark.co.nz
homepage_content: Ngapae Holiday Park | 90 Mile Beach, Northland, New Zealand BOOK YOUR STAY TODAY Nestled amongst the greens of Te Aupōuri & Te Hiku Forests, with the blues of Te Oneroa a Tōhē - 90 Mile Beach at your doorstep Book your stay now About Ngāpae Holiday Park – Te Oneroa ā Tohe – 90 Mile Beach Waipapakauri Ramp is known to some as Ngāpae , with Waipapakauri being situated more inland, closer to Waimanoni. Waipapakauri Ramp is identified as a site of significance and key access point for the iwi of NgāiTakoto on to Te Oneroa ā Tohe / 90 Mile Beach. Tohe named many places along Te Oneroa ā Tohe (The Journey of Tohe)/90 Mile Beach. He was a tohunga and matakite who knew all sacred things. He came to the Waipapakauri Ramp, while making the journey to save his daughter, Rāninikura and named this place ‘ Ngāpae ’ after coming across a whale stranding here. Ngāpae Holiday Park have beautiful pouwhenua standing at the entrance of our site carved by Māori Erstich. The central pou is representative of Tangaroa and three of his descendants. The figure on the front is Poutu, a descendent of Tangaroa who was human. On the back atop is Ikatere and from him descend the creatures of the sea. Below him is Punga and from him descend amphibious creatures, the lizard, sharks and rays. Overall this pou wraps up the surrounding environment and the creatures that dwell within. In front of Tangaroa, are two waka maumahara, which give reference to the many waka that traversed the seas of Te Oneroa ā Tohe. The kōwhaiwha designs displayed take their origin from the shark, a creature of high significance within the iwi of NgāiTakoto. Facilities at Ngāpae Holiday Park – Te Oneroa ā Tohe – 90 Mile Beach Ngāpae Holiday Park is a family park uniquely positioned along side New Zealand’s famous 90 Mile Beach, located at Waipapakauri Ramp. We have excellent modern facilities that will make your stay one to remember, these facilities include: Swimming Pool Accessible Facilities Communal Kitchen Facilities Modern Bathrooms & Showers Playground Communal Lounge Filleting Stations Cabins contain Linen, light blankets, towels, and fan Indoor/Outdoor Dining Area Self-Service Laundromat (Coin Operated – $4 per load) Useful Information for when you’re staying at Ngāpae Holiday Park – Te Oneroa ā Tohe – 90 Mile Beach There is a heater and fan in every unit. name: ngapaeholidaypark.co.nz
homepage_content: Ngapae Holiday Park | 90 Mile Beach, Northland, New Zealand BOOK YOUR STAY TODAY Nestled amongst the greens of Te Aupōuri & Te Hiku Forests, with the blues of Te Oneroa a Tōhē - 90 Mile Beach at your doorstep Book your stay now About Ngāpae Holiday Park – Te Oneroa ā Tohe – 90 Mile Beach Waipapakauri Ramp is known to some as Ngāpae , with Waipapakauri being situated more inland, closer to Waimanoni. Waipapakauri Ramp is identified as a site of significance and key access point for the iwi of NgāiTakoto on to Te Oneroa ā Tohe / 90 Mile Beach. Tohe named many places along Te Oneroa ā Tohe (The Journey of Tohe)/90 Mile Beach. He was a tohunga and matakite who knew all sacred things. He came to the Waipapakauri Ramp, while making the journey to save his daughter, Rāninikura and named this place ‘ Ngāpae ’ after coming across a whale stranding here. Ngāpae Holiday Park have beautiful pouwhenua standing at the entrance of our site carved by Māori Erstich. The central pou is representative of Tangaroa and three of his descendants. The figure on the front is Poutu, a descendent of Tangaroa who was human. On the back atop is Ikatere and from him descend the creatures of the sea. Below him is Punga and from him descend amphibious creatures, the lizard, sharks and rays. Overall this pou wraps up the surrounding environment and the creatures that dwell within. In front of Tangaroa, are two waka maumahara, which give reference to the many waka that traversed the seas of Te Oneroa ā Tohe. The kōwhaiwha designs displayed take their origin from the shark, a creature of high significance within the iwi of NgāiTakoto. name: pukeatua-farmstay.com
homepage_content: Pukeatua Farmstay – Unwind | Relax | Enjoy Skip to content UNWIND | RELAX | ENJOY Comfort away from Home Whether you are simply heading away for a few days, are invited to one of the venues in the area or just looking for a lovely spot to stay, we can provide you comfort away from home . We are a boutique Bed & Breakfast on a little hobby farm offering breathtaking rural views and stunning sunsets all year round, located in Waimauku – the gateway to Muriwai & the Kaipara Harbour – 30min northwest of Auckland. Beautiful Landscape Welcome to the Norwest – Home of Kumeu Wine Country, Muriwai Beach , Woodhill Forest and the Kaipara Harbour . Whether you would like to explore nature, watch stunning sunsets , relax or be thrillseeking – the area offers something for everyone . Our Animals Guests at the farmstay can enjoy lots of cute and friendly farm animals around – Alpacas , cows , chickens , ducks , goats and the cats . All of them have a story and many of them are rescues . You are invited to join in at feeding times or to have a pat. You can also enjoy some of the free range eggs for breakfast on the weekend. Book with us Book now What's new? Every now and then we write stories of some of the events that were happing on the farm or just post some lovely pictures. Please see our news&blog section for more stories. Wasp and Hornet traps 5 November 2025 Activity , Animal , Building , House , News , Summer , trap We typically put a waap trap up around the house in summer to keep the number of wasps at bay. This year, they discovered a queen yellow legged hornet in the early stages of building a nest in Glenfield on the North Shore in October, while two males were spotted earlier in the year in Grafton and Albany. It is the first time a Queen has been found in Aotearoa. Spring has arrived – with its usual mixed bag weather. 3 November 2025 Egg , Flowers , Garden , Land , Sun “If you don’t like the weather, just wait 5 minutes.” Spring came with beautiful warm and sunny days, storm, hail, rain and sunshine in between. It was cold and a few hours later warm again and vice versa. Winter done and dusted 1 September 2025 Alpaca , Animal , Building , Duck , Fire , Fog , Frost , Land , Landscape , Mammal , Night , Rain , Weather , Winter There was nothing extraordinary to write about this winter, really. It’s not been too wet and not too dry, neither too cold or too warm. We had a few frosty nights and a few pretty rainy days but all in all it was reasonably warm and okay from a mud perspective. And just like that it’s winter again 2 June 2025 Fire , Firewood , Fog , Garden , Kaipara , Weather , Winter Feels like summer was just happening. Winter started off beautifully with warm days and sunshine over the long King’s birthday weekend. Sunshine, rain and lots of grass 24 November 2024 Event , Farm , Feed , Grass , Land , Plants , Rain , Sun , Weather , Winter The sun has been more prevalent and the odd shower has helped all plants to grow a lot. It’s nice to see so much fresh green in various shades Springtime is here 2 October 2024 Animal , Cow , Duck , Egg , Farm , Rain , Sun , Weather The weather is getting warmer, and the days are stretching out longer, giving us more daylight to enjoy. The rain is slowly becoming less frequent, making way for sunnier skies. Search
