name: quintaessentia.in
homepage_content: Quinta Essentia | Montessori Adolescent Center for Studies and Work Montessori Secondary Montessori Land Laboratory Nature's Home for Adolescents Nourishing Sunrise Perfecting Nature Growing with Greens Quiescence at Sunset Need for Change in Education The future is entirely a new kind of world with new kind of needs. There are new types of Jobs to address these changing needs. The needs for new kind of competencies arise to suit these new jobs. Quinta Essentia reflects our founder Maria Montessori’s grand vision for a complete and holistic alternative to today’s deficient education. Nurturing the Adoloscent's Spirit Rather than limiting the child to isolated academic facts, the Montessori child undertakes a path of holistic development that has emphasis on the social and moral development as well as academic. The Perfect Path for Learning Accurately perceiving the major faults in our education system, where students’ real learning of knowledge and skill is buried under increasing pressure to memorise from textbooks in search of marks and exam scores, Montessori showed us the perfect path to develop strong, capable, self-confident adults with the perspective and character to flourish in the world. The Land Laboratory The setting for Quinta Essentia is a rural integrated farm environment, that perfectly meets the needs of the adolescent age students. The farm setting is an ideal learning environment, providing limitless opportunities for the study of all disciplines through practical experience. It becomes a natural laboratory for the study of the natural sciences, where practical investigations and learning help build a passion and depth of knowledge for science. Quinta Essentia's Salient Features Montessori Spaces Designed for Adolescents Large, light-filled studios flex between seminar, lab, and maker-space modes. Moveable furniture and dedicated project zones let students configure their environment to match the flow of research, discussion, or quiet concentration. Community Living on a Working Farm Daily life unfolds within our 20-acre agro-ecological campus. Adolescents share real responsibilities—from tending vegetable beds to managing the farm café—forming a micro-society that weaves cooperation, stewardship, and respect for nature. Mixed-Age Mentorship (A-Level & IGCSE Together) Older students pursuing Cambridge A Levels mentor peers preparing for IGCSE O Levels. This vertical community builds leadership and generosity, while younger learners gain role models who make academic rigour feel attainable. Cultivating Independence & Self-Reliance Learners plan their own study blocks, organise field trips, and oversee campus initiatives. Authentic decision-making nurtures judgement, confidence, and the practical know-how required for life beyond school. Flexible Timetables for Self-Directed Learning Core Cambridge lessons anchor each day, but wide “choice blocks” let adolescents pursue personal research, internships, or creative projects. Weekly planning conferences shift time-ownership from teacher-controlled to learner-managed. Study–Work Cycle for Deep, Real-Life Understanding Chemistry connects to soil testing, statistics to crop yields, economics to café pricing. The iterative cycle—research, apply, reflect—turns academic theory into lived experience, embedding knowledge far beyond exam requirements. Experiential Learning Bringing Subjects to Life The setting for Quinta Essentia becomes a natural laboratory for the study of the natural sciences, where practical investigations and learning help build a passion and depth of knowledge for science. The farm is also a place where small economic production occurs, around which the social organisation is formed. This becomes the basis from which economics, commerce, politics, social studies all originate and can be learnt through real participation. Agriculture is also a lens through which to study history and civilisations, while working on the farm brings a deep awareness and appreciation of our rich past. Multiple constructions and work with mechanics further add the dimension of maths and physics. The farm is thus a perfect prepared environment for study, one that now moves out of the classroom and becomes an introduction to the real world. Learning becomes the perfect preparation for adult life and work. Montessori Secondary Adolescent Philosophy Meeting the Natural Needs of Adolescents Development Following the natural needs of Adolescents and presenting then an environment that successfully meets their needs is the perfect path to develop strong, capable, self-confident adults with the perspective and character to flourish in the world, as envisioned by Dr.Maria Montessori. Farm Setting Perfect Place for Adolescent's Psychic Development & Learning The Farm provides key aspects that aid the development of the Adolescent: Unlimited opportunities for applied study, Opportunities for developing Economic and Social Independence, and the Growth of Character. Residential Life Adolescent Community that develops their Personality The students live in a community where social life and responsibility for managing the community livelihood come together to form an important aspect of the Adolescent Experience. The Outcome Fully Prepared Human for Successful Life Life on the farm forms the backbone of Culture connecting the Power of Sciences, Beauty of Literature, Intelligence of Mathematics, Grandeur of Geography and the Essence of History, from which the construction of the individual personality of the adolescent takes place. Through diverse opportunities for Self-Expression, building language for effective social interaction, and acquiring the means of economic independence through the lived experience of Community Life, the Adolescent acquires a Moral equilibrium characterised by a sense of gratitude towards his universe and goes out into the World as an adult with a Cosmic vision; to live a purposeful and productive life, meeting the expectations of the creator of this method, Dr. Maria Montessori. Our Curriculum Rooting Real-World Readiness. Living Curriculum: Theory Meets Practice Quinta Essentia’s Montessori secondary program weaves seminar-style academics with purposeful farm, kitchen, and enterprise work. Adolescents test ideas in real contexts—compost trials for biology, crop budgets for math—while rotating through community governance and micro-business roles that build independence and social responsibility. The result is a living curriculum that fuses intellectual rigor with meaningful labor, preparing self-directed young adults ready to serve a connected world. Cambridge Credentials Real-World Context Alongside this living curriculum, Quinta Essentia offers the full suite of Cambridge IGCSE, AS and A-Level courses. Students prepare for these internationally recognised examinations through discussion-based lessons, research projects, and guided mastery periods that respect Montessori pacing. Practical work on the farm and in on-site enterprises provides authentic data sets and case studies, turning exam syllabi into lived experience while securing the academic credentials needed for seamless entry into universities worldwide. Know More → Rhythm of Our Farm Life Flow Of The Day Rising with the Sun 5:30 am When dawn colours the horizon, our adolescents rise at 5 : 30 a.m.—not to an alarm, but to the soft sounds of rural life. Waking early places them in rhythm with nature’s cycles, sharpening circadian balance, boosting mood, and setting a calm, alert tone for the day. The shared discipline of rising together nurtures collective responsibility and respect for each other’s time and energy. Mind–Body Morning 6:00 am Yoga and functional exercises on dew-kissed grass build strength, flexibility, and breath awareness. Beyond fitness, this quiet hour encourages mindfulness and emotional regulation, equipping adolescents with lifelong stress-management tools. Practising side-by-side also dissolves social barriers: beginners learn from experienced peers, and everyone starts the day feeling centred and capable. Stewardship in Action 6:30 am Next, we turn inward to serve our shared spaces—sweeping the study hut, tidying the dining pergola, refreshing the community hall. Montessori called this “care of the environment,” and it fosters dignity in labour, pride in surroundings, and an understanding that true freedom is paired with responsibility. Every broomstroke reinforces that this farm is their prepared environment. Morning Huddle & Planning 7:00 am After a warm cup of herbal tea which was made using the herbs from our herbal garden, everyone gathers in a circle to outline the day’s practical work—dividing into planting, weeding, and research teams, confirming tools, and setting shared goals. The brief meeting builds organisation, accountability, and collaborative problem-solving before we head out to the fields. Hands in the Soil 7:15 am Planting seedlings, repairing irrigation lines, or logging compost temperatures turns abstract biology into lived experience. Working side-by-side with guides, students practise planning, tool safety, and data collection, linking manual labour with scientific inquiry. Problem-solving here is immediate and real: a drooping vine or clogged dripper invites hypothesis, experiment, and reflection. Self-Care & Culinary Arts 8:30 am - 10:00 am After showers, the adolescent cooking team serves a farm-to-table breakfast—millet pancakes, moringa chutney, fresh fruit. Cooking at scale cultivates math (portion ratios), chemistry (Maillard reaction), and leadership (co-ordinating timing, hygiene, plating). Sharing a nourishing meal they created cements confidence and communal gratitude. Scholar’s Hut 10:00 am – 1:00 pm Morning academics happen in multi‐age clusters. A subject‐matter guide sparks inquiry, then the cohort breaks into research pods. Elder students mentor younger peers; younger learners ask fearless questions that re‐ignite curiosity in the elders. This self‐directed scholarship mirrors university seminars, preparing them for higher study while honouring each learner’s pace and passion. Midday Respite 1:00 pm – 2:00 pm Lunch is hearty and unhurried; conversations flow from soil microbes to Shakespeare. Downtime afterwards respects adolescent metabolic needs and models healthy work‐life rhythm. Digestive ease enhances afternoon focus, and social bonds deepen over shared plates and laughter. Deep‐Dive Studies 2:00 pm – 4:00 pm Afternoons extend academic or project work: coding an irrigation sensor, drafting a short story, or analysing pond‐water pH. Blocks of uninterrupted time cultivate flow states and executive function—skills essential for complex problem‐solving and creative output. Evening Stewardship 4:00 pm – 4:30 pm A brief return to environmental care closes the academic day. Clearing tools, wiping lab benches, and watering seedlings reinforce the morning’s lesson: knowledge and action are inseparable. Play & Team Spirit 4:30 pm – 5:30 pm Whether sprinting across the football field or strategizing in chess, adolescents refine motor skills, resilience, and ethical competition. Mixed‐ability teams encourage inclusive leadership; rotating sports expose them to varied physical challenges and cultural games like kho‐kho. Creative Economy 5:30 pm – 7:00 pm After a wholesome snack, self‐expression studios hum: paint brushes glide, resin cures, clay wheels spin, guitars strum. Students produce crafts and art that feed our weekly market stall, learning pricing, marketing, and quality control—an authentic micro‐economy that links creativity with real‐world entrepreneurship. Community Hall 7:00 pm Dinner brings everyone together again. Sharing reflections on successes and setbacks cultivates metacognition and empathy. The cooking team receives feedback; tomorrow’s team takes notes—continuous improvement in action. Unscripted Evenings 7:30 pm – 8:30 pm Free time nurtures friendships, spontaneous music jams, stargazing, or quiet reading in hammocks. Autonomy in choosing leisure activities reinforces trust and allows adolescents to explore identity in safe, supportive surroundings. Rest & Renewal 8:30 pm Lights dim, crickets sing, and the farm settles. Consistent sleep routines support hormonal balance and memory consolidation. By honouring rest as essential—not optional—we model holistic health. Beyond the Gate: Field Trips Various Times Experiences like welding a wheelbarrow at Auroville’s Institute of Applied Technology, trekking in Kodaikanal, or studying heritage architecture in Mysore expand our adolescents’ “prepared environment” to the wider world. Each journey delivers fresh skills, cultural literacy, and a broader sense of stewardship that they bring back to enrich farm life. WANT A TRUE MONTESSORI EXPERIENCE? Book a Tour Why Families choose Quinta Essentia India’s First Montessori Secondary School Know More about us → See the Journey in Pictures Stroll through our farm, studios, and joyful community life inside the Quinta Essentia Gallery . Explore the Gallery → Testimonies of Graduates I feel like Montessori really made me more comfortable with who I am because everyone was so kind and felt like a family rather than just classmates. Yacine Creative arts I came from a background where I was not given the opportunity to explore my potential, due to the education system that was being followed. I had a lot of energy and had difficulties remaining focused on the same thing for a longer period, this lead to me falling behind in my education. This all changed when I started at the Montessori farm school. Farm school was an outlet where I could use all that energy that was building up inside of me in an efficient way”. “Thanks to my time at the Montessori farm school I graduated A-level equivalent exams as one of the students with the highest marks and got accepted to one of south-east England’s highest-ranked university. Vilma Business Management The Montessori way of teaching and learning has really helped me with my further studies as I have moved on, as it has given me the ability to work independently with purpose which has meant I have no problem making myself focus and always meeting deadlines with ease. It has also made me confident in my abilities, I know what my strengths are and what I need to work most on to achieve as best I can. Rusa Biology “I also believe that Farm School and the Montessori way has created a strive for knowledge and understanding the world. By not only combining practical work with studies, but also linking them together by applying theoretical knowledge in practical tasks, the Farm School has developed a will to understand this connection between theory and practice in the society”. “The Farm School teaches you things that a regular school does not, such as responsibility, sense of community, independence, economy and the strive for knowledge. All these things are capabilities that are essential for a successful adult life and imagine learning all this during your adolescence instead of learning it the hard way as an adult when moving away from home.” Kristoffer Medicine Get in Touch with Us Our Headquarters are in Chennai and Puducherry Puducherry HO: 27-28, 2nd Cross Moogambigai Nagar Reddiarpalayam, Pondy - 605 010 Phone: +91 9994851951 Phone: +91 9047335818 Email: contact@quintaessentia.in Chennai HO: 24-25, 12th Cross Ranga Reddy Gardens Neelankarai, Chennai - 600 041 Phone: +91 9994851951 Phone: +91 9047335818 Email: contact@quintaessentia.in We are social Name Email Message Send message Click For Admission Call: +91 93613 88617

name: slamclub.nz
homepage_content: Slam Club - Cafe Restaurant & Bar - Kaikōura New Zealand 0 Welcome Slam Club is a bespoke ‘fresh wild and local’ cafe, restaurant and bar, based in Kaikōura, New Zealand. We specialise in serving unique food, craft beer, home baking, coffee and refreshments, catering to all food types including vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free. We source our ingredients locally wherever possible; it’s a big part of who we are. Our space is ideal for speciality events such as our regular quiz night and we cater for private functions on request. Slide 1 Slide 1 (current slide) Slide 2 Slide 2 (current slide) Slide 3 Slide 3 (current slide) Slide 4 Slide 4 (current slide) Our Chef About the only thing at Slam Club that’s not locally sourced is our head chef, but try telling him that. Kaikōura’s favourite Austrian expat, Philipp Valentin, arrived in town over 15 years ago and has been at Slam Club since its doors opened in 2016, just before the Kaikōura Earthquake. A much-loved local with a big smile and a flair for creating simple, delicious food from carefully sourced local ingredients. His friendly staff aren’t too bad either! Some of Our Favorites Breakfast Skillet - Fry-up with smoked brisket, bacon, potatoes & mushrooms, topped with melted cheese, a fried egg & homemade relish. (Vegetarian/vegan option available From the Sea to Plate Sustainably sourced catch - inspired by the chef (changes weekly) El Gringo BBQ smoked pulled pork, corn chips, cheese, jalapenos, salad greens, sour cream. Quacky Chan Shredded hoisin roasted duck, pickled slaw, cheese, salad greens, aioli, crackle, sesame seeds. BBQ Smoked Meat Platter - Pork ribs, brisket, chicken wings & pork belly served with slaw, pickles, garlic bread & homemade BBQ sauce. Fresh Salads - All salads are made with quinoa, roasted seasonal vegetables & greens, roasted seeds, sprouts & homemade vinaigrette dressing. (With your choice of pulled pork, wild venison, roast duck or vegetarian/vegan options available). Apple Strudel - Chef's special apple strudel, the Austrian way, say no more! View Our Full Menu “Those sandwiches are quite something: filled with your choice of game, venison, duck or pork, grilled to perfection and served with roasted potatoes. The idea is to make game affordable for people to enjoy and try in an approachable way.” — NEAT PLACES “One of those places you love to discover when travelling. The friendly glow of the staff, the tastefully designed interior, the warm belly full of delicious food & wine. I only wish this place was in Fitzroy.” — SANDY, MELBOURNE Location 10 West End Kaikoura Hours Thursday Dinner from 5pm (Kitchen closes 8pm) Friday-Sunday Lunch from 12pm Dinner from 5pm (Kitchen closes 8pm) Quiz Night Every Wednesday From 6.30pm Closed Monday/Tuesday Bookings recommended for dinner Contact Ph 022 512 0442 slamclubkaikoura@gmail.com

name: kawarauvillage.com
homepage_content: Stacks Queenstown top of page Casual Dining with a Gourmet Twist View Menu Order Takeaway Welcome to Stacks, the social heart of Hilton Queenstown Resort & Spa. Relax in a laid-back yet vibrant atmosphere where the fire is always roaring and the mood is effortlessly welcoming. Gather with friends on the sun-soaked deck or settle indoors for a cosy meal surrounded by alpine charm. Enjoy handcrafted pizzas and hearty comfort classics, perfectly paired with New Zealand craft beers or cocktails on tap. With live sports screenings and après-ski vibes by the fireside, Stacks is the perfect spot for a relaxed family dinner, casual drinks, or an easy-going night out with friends. Open Thursday - Monday 4:00pm - 9:30pm Tuesday & Wednesday - closed Reservations Live matches on display BOOK A TABLE! For same day bookings call Stacks directly at 03 450 3456 Reservations bottom of page

name: lynnmac.co.nz
homepage_content: JR Wholesale Meats - Purveyors of quality meats and service HIGH QUALITY MEATS cut daily to your requirements The Team at JR Wholesale Meats have a long history of providing excellence in products and service to their customers in NZ. Over the last two years they have invested extensively in their facility in Otahuhu, Auckland, upgrading the plant and processes to meet the exacting standards that are required to achieve and maintain MPI accreditation. WHAT WE DO, WE DO WITH PRIDE High Quality & Range of meat products offered to the food service industry JR Wholesale Meats has worked tirelessly identifying only the best primary producers in NZ. The team has chosen only suppliers that share our same passion for quality and service in the meat industry. We are proud to represent our suppliers’ products in the marketplace. We stand behind the products we supply with the confidence and certainty that they are of the highest quality obtainable in NZ. The Master Butchery Team at JR Wholesale Meats take these great products and prepare them to your exacting standards. FACTORY DISCOUNT MEATS Buy Our Factory Discount Meats at wholesale prices! Factory Discount Meats is our onsite shop at JR Wholesale Meats open to the public. We have over 25 years of experience in the meat industry supplying butchers, cafes, and restaurants in the North Island with high-quality Beef, Lamb, Pork, and Chicken products. Factory Discount Meats was established in 2019 to fulfill the high demand for restaurant-quality meat among the community and the public. Open Monday to Friday 7am to 4pm Visit our Onsite Butchery Shop ONLINE MEATS: Online, On time, On budget Restaurant Quality Meat Affordable prices, direct to your door! We deliver Restaurant Quality Meat products to the public no matter where you are in New Zealand. Our focus has always been on providing high-quality meat to our customers and we are pleased that we can now extend this offering of quality meat cuts right to your door for your enjoyment. Visit Online Meats ! Export Quality Prime Steer and Genuine NZ Angus™ Beef Only Prime Steer, Premium Grade beef carcass and cuts are processed at JR Wholesale Meats Buy Exceptional Quality JR Wholesale Meats only supply beef that has been hung, stored and processed to improve the flavor & tenderness profiles. A guarantee of exceptional quality. Would you like to know more ! Export Quality Genuine NZ Lamb™ NZ Lamb that’s free-range, grass-fed, farm-raised and sourced from Approved NZ Farms Free Range NZ Lamb From locally bred flocks our free-range lamb is sourced from small, local, family run farms in the Waikato and Wairarapa Would you like to know more ! Genuine NZ Pork™ Fresh Pork processed daily only sourced from Pig Care accredited farms Pork that delivers on Flavor Hand selected from the Durox and Hampshire pork breeds and carries the essential fat that produces really succulent, flavoursome Pork Cuts. Would you like to know more ! Genuine NZ Chicken NZ Chicken supplied free range or Barn Raised Chicken that delivers on succulence Our Butchers process all our Chicken from whole birds delivering exceptional quality & cuts to your requirements Would you like to know more ! Delicatessen & Specialty Products Deli & specialty products that are hand selected & full of flavour From The Deli We have a range of Artisan made Bacon, Ham and Deli products, manufactured from local and imported Pork to meet your exacting requirements. Would you like to know more ! Delivery to your door We use chilled delivery experts that ensure the product reaches you in perfect condition. Chilled Delivery that exceeds expectations We are committed to providing the highest level of chilled delivery service to our customers. Urgent Cool – Big Chill – Transnorth – Provida – Refridgafreighters Would you like to know more ! Customised Products - No Problem We regularly produce meat cuts to Chef’s exacting requirements, packed & ready to use. Portion Controlled & Special Requirements With our on site Master Butchers we can produce what ever you require. Why not take the hassel out of your prep & let us do it for you Would you like to know more ! JR Wholesale Meats Quality Promise NZ Chicken supplied free range or Barn Raised Our Promise to You We will deliver a product and service that meets our exacting Quality Consistency to every customer. Would you like to know more

name: thelabfnb.co.nz
homepage_content: THE LAB Cafe Wellington The lab CAFES WELLINGTON food and beverage co. est. 2015 Independent. Contemporary. Local. With four locations across the city, our kitchens serve up breakfast and lunch, in-house baked goods, and our own cold-press juices. The Lab University Our original location, in the beating heart of Victoria University of Wellington’s Kelburn Campus. Since 2015, The LAB Uni has been providing VUW students and staff with fast and fresh lunch options, smoothies, cold-press juices and speciality coffee. All at an affordable price. The Lab XXCQ Our exceedingly popular, corporate-hub cafe, on the ground floor of the Deloitte Building, on Customhouse Quay. With a humming kitchen, and ample space for small and big groups alike, The LAB XXCQ provides exceptional food and drink to accompany Monday-Friday work. The lAB press hall Our second location, opened in early 2018 and found at Press Hall- the new, ‘upmarket food-court’, just off Willis Street. With a greater focus on contemporary, made-to-order breakfast and lunch for the busy CBD crowd, The LAB Press Hall was our venture in the central city. The Lab Victoria St. Our latest project! Opened just after the Covid-19 lockdown in 2020, our Victoria St. flagship store is our first classic Wellington cafe. Unattached to any institution, at The LAB Vic St. you’ll find a relaxed atmosphere, a full Brunch menu, and wide windows to watch city life go by.

name: waitakereresort.co.nz
homepage_content: Waitakere Ranges Accommodation - Waitakere Resort & Spa Back Our Rooms Hotel Rooms Premier Rooms Apartments Villa Back Park Restaurant High Tea Back Wairua Day Spa Book Now - Wairua Day Spa Special Packages Back Meetings & Conferences Weddings Team Building Back Packages & Offers Gift Vouchers Spa Specials Back Resort Facilities Things to Do Blog Hotel History Guest and Staff Health Policies Scroll Auckland’s Rainforest Retreat Accommodation | Spa | Meetings | Weddings BLACK FRIDAY SALE - SAVE 30% BLACK FRIDAY SALE - SAVE 30% BLACK FRIDAY SALE - SAVE 30% Book Now Book accommodation Packages/ offers Conferences/events Spa/wellness About Waitakere Resort & Spa Waitakere Resort & Spa is a locally owned hotel, restaurant, day spa, wellness retreat, conference centre and wedding venue. Offering guests comfortable Auckland accommodation just half an hour from the city centre. Waitakere Resort & Spa is set in Auckland's Waitakere Ranges rainforest with spectacular views of Auckland City and the Hauraki Gulf beyond, providing a breathtaking panoramic backdrop for your escape away. Family owned for 85 years 2025 marks the 85th anniversary of Waitakere Resort & Spa being owned by the Nevill-Jackson family. Read more about the Estate History here . The Experience Waitakere Ranges Heritage Park The Waitakere Ranges Heritage Park consists of 28,000 hectares mainly of magnificent rainforest covering the ranges. This provides endless opportunities to experience the rainforest, rugged West Coast Beaches, waterfalls and magnificent Kauri Trees within the Park. Some of the activities and experiences available at Waitakere Resort and Spa and in the surrounding Waitakere Ranges Heritage Park are; RAINFOREST WALKS – Complimentary There are many rainforest walks available either from the Resort and in the surrounding Park. Walks are self guided and include tracks with beautiful waterfalls, magnificent native Kauri Trees, the rugged West Coast and water reservoir dams. MOUNTAIN BIKING – Complimentary Bring your bikes, there are some great mountain biking options nearby suitable for Mountain Bikes/Cross Bikes which involve some gravel roads. The rides include access roads for power lines, quiet gravel roads and some sealed roads. Rides require a moderate level of fitness as the local terrain is hilly. For those that prefer flatter options access to the Opanuku Stream/Henderson cycleway is a short 15 minute drive from the Resort and suitable for all bike types. ARATAKI INFORMATION CENTRE – Complimentary Located approximately a 10 minute drive along the Scenic Drive from the Resort entrance the Arataki Information Centre has some great views of the Waitakere Ranges and information about the area, walking tracks etc. PRIVATE YOGA – From $195 per couple Private Yoga sessions are available subject to availability. Sessions are available for one or more participants and are thoughtfully crafted to meet your goals blending Yoga, Pilates, Pranayama, Mindfulness and Somatic Movement to support both body and mind. AWOL ADVENTURES CANYONING - From $225.00 per person For the more adventurous. No experience necessary – we train you and provide you with the gear the skills to explore the canyon. Not only do you get some great canyoning, but you will see a coastal subtropical rain-forest, learn about the local flora /fauna and history of the area. Half day and full day adventures are available and includes pick up a drop off at the Resort. TE URU ART GALLERY, TITIRANGI - Complimentary Te Uru Waitakere Contemporary Gallery is a regional gallery located a 15 minute drive from the Resort in Titirangi village. The gallery has a distinctive West Auckland focus but a national and international perspective. They present a diverse programme of contemporary exhibitions, events and activities, including art, craft and design, to reflect and strengthen the full diversity of cultural identities, interests and potential of our community. GOLF Price varies from one golf course to another. There are several golf courses within about half an hour of Waitakere Resort & Spa including: Waitakere Golf Club Redwood Park Golf Club Titirangi Gold Course View our Things to Do page here . What Our Guests Say About Us Angela Barry 5 star review..2 weeks ago.. One of the best high teas I have ever had, and I have had a more than a few. The food was fantastic, contemporary and very well priced. The views are superb even on the rainy day we had. Expansive views and atmospheric. The buildings are well kept and are charming in a retro kind of way. Hotel highlights Great view, Great value Larissa Meira 5 star review.. 5 weeks ago.. Awesome place to stay. Very worth it if you are wanting to relax. Beautiful views, food is amazing. And staff is very friendly Hotel highlights Great view, Romantic Pubudini Prasanna 5 star review.. 3 weeks ago. This is our 2nd winter stay in this hotel. The experience has only got better. The high tea and the dinner were amazing and well presented. My favorites were Thai chicken patty entre and the burrito main which came with a divine cheese sauce. Shout out to the chefs… As always we enjoyed the time in the lounge after the dinner. Staff were very nice and friendly (Reception staff and restaurant staff and cleaning staff and everybody we met). I had a hot oil massage from the spa as well. The ladies at the spa were so nice and special shoutout to the lady with short hair (sorry I forgot your name) her massage had a healing power for my tired back. Love the nature and views around the hotel. Being so close to Auckland yet far away from busy life. Thank you for the relaxing experience and will definitely come back. Hotel highlights Great food, Great view, Quiet, Child-friendly

name: welcomebayhotpools.co.nz
homepage_content: Welcome Bay Hot Pools Home About Us Our Pools Our Accommodation FAQ's Contact & Location … Home About Us Our Pools Our Accommodation FAQ's Contact & Location Book Now Home About Us Our Pools Our Accommodation FAQ's Contact & Location … Home About Us Our Pools Our Accommodation FAQ's Contact & Location Book Now Welcome Bay Hot Pools Heated by earth's geothermal energy, enriched with minerals. Open daily - 12 pm to 9 pm Welcome Bay Hot Pools offers the ultimate place to unwind with two mineral-rich pools fed by a natural geothermal spring. Our large pool sits at a refreshing 29°C, perfect for swimming, while the smaller pool, at a relaxing 39°C, is ideal for a soothing soak. These pools are enriched with minerals, providing benefits for both body and mind, all while being naturally heated by the Earth’s geothermal energy. Make a day of it and enjoy ice creams and drinks, fire up the free BBQ, and enjoy a meal at one of our picnic tables. Our campground offers spacious powered and unpowered sites for tents, campervans, and motorhomes. Surrounded by natural beauty, it’s the perfect place to disconnect from the daily grind and reconnect with nature. Whether you’re planning a weekend getaway or a longer adventure, our well-kept facilities ensure a comfortable stay, with clean bathrooms and a communal kitchen. Make Welcome Bay Hot Pools & Campground your home away from home and create memories that will last a lifetime. Book in our campground Our pools are cleaned daily No Chlorine No Oxidizers No Stabilizers Our pools undergo daily cleaning, and we maintain a continuous flow of fresh geothermal water, ensuring that you are swimming in the cleanest pools at their ideal temperature. The large pool sits at around 29 degrees and the small pool sits at around 39 degrees. Pricing $15 Adult $7 Child- 2-14yrs $10 Senior- Gold Card holder $4 Infant - 6- 24mths $37 Family- 2 adults, 2 children Our Campground Our campground is a destination in itself, offering spacious powered and unpowered sites for tents, campervans, and motorhomes, along with a range of cosy cabins in various configurations to suit your needs. Nestled in peaceful surroundings, it’s the perfect place to unwind and reconnect with nature. With well-maintained facilities, including clean bathrooms and a communal kitchen, your stay will be comfortable and hassle-free. Whether you’re planning a quiet escape or an adventurous holiday, our campground provides the ideal base for relaxation, exploration, and creating lasting memories. Book Accommodation Now Additional Benefits BBQ / Party Hire Welcome Bay Hot Pools features a dedicated area ideal for hosting BBQs and parties, offering a unique venue where guests can relax in soothing hot pools and enjoy a delicious BBQ meal in a beautiful setting. To book this area for your next event, please reach out to us today and let us help you create an unforgettable experience. Food & Beverages At Welcome Bay Hot Pools, we invite you to indulge in our delicious snacks, hot food and warm drinks, perfect for enjoying after a relaxing soak in our pools. Savour a variety of comforting meals and beverages in a serene and picturesque environment. Contact us today to explore our menu options and enhance your visit. We would love to hear from you! It offers you the opportunity to dine in peaceful surroundings with a semi-rural backdrop. An enormous thanks is extended to our guests for your continued support. Without it, our students would not be able to meet the high standard of restaurant and culinary techniques that makes them award winners. If you would like to be on our mailout database to receive restaurant timetables and menus send an email to Windows@wintec.ac.nz or contact the Centre for Hospitality on (07) 834 8850. Directions View Windows in a larger map Download Printable Map Please park your vehicle in the new visitor car park off Gilchrist Street. This is allocated to visitors (two hour maximum). You do not need a permit to use a visitor car park. If these are full, or you are going to be longer than 2 hours, you will need to pay and display while parking in any staff/student area. Disability parks are available as per the map. Buses and large vans can park in the service bay marked with the yellow lines just past the main door to L Block. name: wintec.ac.nz
homepage_content: Windows restaurant Skip to content In this section About us Wintec | Te Pūkenga News Covid-19 information and updates Events Our people Honorary award recipients Our Executive Leadership Team Our values and goals Our history Publications Industry and community Venues for hire Industry engagement activities Teaching partnerships and secondments Internships and placements Advertise a job Research and Rangahau at Wintec Researcher profiles Alumni Circle Māori Wintec Marae Marae Wharenui Marae Wharekai Marae Carvings Scholarships Community links Waiata Māori and Pasifika Trade Training Hear From Our Graduates Sheldon Takao Marrin Haggie Ramari Kauluwehi Ellyn Proffit Murphy Firia-Zama Wendy Crawford Pacific Careers at Wintec Current Vacancies What we offer Venues at Wintec The Bill Gallagher Centre The ​​Training Space Rotokauri Campus Map Hamilton Map Contact Details Contact Us The Atrium The Long Room Windows restaurant Restaurant menus and dates Reservations Contact or visit us Our campuses Contact us Wintec Social Media Directory Student Recruitment Representatives Home About us Windows restaurant Windows restaurant Restaurant menus and dates Reservations Contact or visit us Directions Our beautiful restaurant 'Windows' is situated in the Centre for Hospitality at the Rotokauri Campus. It offers you the opportunity to dine in peaceful surroundings with a semi-rural backdrop. An enormous thanks is extended to our guests for your continued support. Without it, our students would not be able to meet the high standard of restaurant and culinary techniques that makes them award winners. If you would like to be on our mailout database to receive restaurant timetables and menus send an email to Windows@wintec.ac.nz or contact the Centre for Hospitality on (07) 834 8850. Directions View Windows in a larger map Download Printable Map Please park your vehicle in the new visitor car park off Gilchrist Street. This is allocated to visitors (two hour maximum). You do not need a permit to use a visitor car park. If these are full, or you are going to be longer than 2 hours, you will need to pay and display while parking in any staff/student area. Disability parks are available as per the map. Buses and large vans can park in the service bay marked with the yellow lines just past the main door to L Block. name: zephyrwainui.co.nz
homepage_content: Zephyr Wainui | Plant-Based Cafe | Gisborne Order Now Shop Our Values Health At Zephyr, we believe food should be inclusive, nutrient rich, and delicious. Our menu features 100% plant-based dishes made with organic, locally sourced ingredients, plus grass-fed meats and organic dairy for those who prefer animal-based options. We cater to all diets, offering vegan, gluten-free, nut-free, and dairy-free meals. Environment Sustainability is key—we compost, recycle, and use eco-friendly products. Zephyr is the perfect place to enjoy wholesome food that supports your health and the planet. Community We wish to provide a space for people to express themselves, connect, grow, and together create a healthier community and planet. We will welcome you with open arms and a smile, and do our best to positively impact your day. Learn More Coffee Come in and taste a divine brew made with love. We serve fair trade, organic coffee, roasted locally by our friends at Far East Coffee Co. We offer both organic dairy milk and plant-based milk options, ensuring there's something to suit every preference. Groceries & Zephyr Goods We have recently started our own range of goods, hemp Zephyr apparel, and the famous house made Aioli. Come in and check them out! We also have a selection of plant-based grocery products, ranging from essentials to items you haven’t seen anywhere else. Kai With influence from all around the world, we take seasonal produce and make beautiful food just waiting for you to devour. Come try our ever evolving offering, which we change seasonally. We strive to use organic and locally sourced goods, creating sustaining, nourishing food to leave you healthful and content. See Menu Keep up on the gram Customer love

Reset Calendar Apply to All Hotels Ramada By Wyndham Hamilton City Center Price Calendar Room Rooms , Guest Guests per Room | Edit Dates Price Calendar | Currency Currency / Previous Slide Next Slide 287 Victoria Street, Hamilton , 03204 NZ +64-7-8394993 Ramada By Wyndham Hamilton City Center +64-7-8394993 Featured Amenities Featured Amenities Featured Amenities All Amenities All Amenities (${ratingCount} reviews) Featured Amenities Featured Amenities Featured Amenities All Amenities All Amenities Hotel Policies Hotel Policies × Hotel Policies Check In Check Out Children Stay Free Policy Pet & Service Animal Policy Smoking Policy General Information Newly Renovated Under Renovation Newly Opened × Stay in the Heart of Hamilton Victoria Street hotel by SkyCity Hamilton and FMG Stadium Waikato Enjoy a convenient location in the central business district and contemporary amenities in a historic setting at Ramada by Wyndham, Hamilton City Center. Just 15 kilometers from Hamilton Airport (HLZ), our non-smoking hotel is minutes from the casino and bars at SkyCity Hamilton and Mooloo rugby matches at FMG Stadium Waikato. You’ll be close to the Hamilton Zoo and Waikato Museum as well as Claudelands Event Centre and the University of Waikato. Relish in views of Victoria Street as you take advantage of on-site dining, parking, and free WiFi. A Welcoming Atmosphere Make the most of our gym, café, on-site parking, and free WiFi Admire original brickwork in the historic wing of our hotel before enjoying a delicious meal at our restaurant. Get around with ease thanks to on-site parking, available for a nominal fee. Check emails using free high-speed WiFi, work out in the fitness center, and freshen up with laundry facilities. We also offer event space and a friendly 24/7 front desk staff. Each non-smoking guest room features a flat-screen TV, desk, safe, ironing amenities, coffee/tea maker, hair dryer, and bath products. Book a spacious apartment for impressive views. Your Local Ambassador Watch a cricket match, see beautiful gardens, or tour Hobbiton™ Local attractions await. Catch a cricket match at Seddon Park, go shopping at Centre Place, or stroll along the walkway at Hamilton Lake Domain. You can also admire the renowned displays at Hamilton Gardens, check out vintage cars at the Classics Museum, or see native birds at Parana Park. Callum Brae Family Golf & Café offers a 36-hole mini golf course while Blastacars® Drift Karts has thrilling indoor racetracks. For more to do, head to the village of Hobbiton and tour the villages featured in The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit trilogies.
